Igor Strelkov asked to be sent from prison to war. Former Minister of Defense of the “DPR” Igor Strelkov (Girkin), sentenced to four years under an article on extremist activities, asked to be sent to war in Ukraine. RBC writes about this with reference to his lawyer Alexander Malakhov.

One of the military units stationed within the borders of the “DPR” allegedly agrees to sign a contract with Girkin and appoint him to the position of platoon commander.

The court will consider an appeal against the politician's sentence in May. The lawyer expects that the court will agree to overturn Girkin’s sentence on the condition that he goes to the front. According to the current laws of the Russian Federation, those convicted “under extremist articles” cannot serve in the armed forces.

On April 10, 1944, troops of the 3rd Ukrainian Front under the command of General Rodion Malinovsky cleared Odessa of German-Romanian occupiers.

“The call “Ahead of Odessa!” worked wonders, we walked waist-deep in mud, chest-deep in icy water,” Marshal Vasily Chuikov wrote in his memoirs.▪️For the liberation of the city, many units and formations were awarded orders, and the 27 most distinguished were awarded honorary names "Odessa".▪️The legendary participant in the liberation of the city is the founder of the Airborne Forces Vasily Margelov. During the Odessa operation, he commanded the 49th Guards Rifle Division.

The 12-year-old son of Vasily Margelov, Gennady (later major general), also took part in the battles for Odessa. The boy fled to the front without his father’s knowledge and managed to end up in his division.

After the liberation of Odessa, divisional commander Vasily Margelov slapped his son with three days of arrest “for his courage.” And then he sent me to the Tambov Suvorov Military School.

Summary of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation on the progress of the special military operation (as of April 10, 2024)
The Armed Forces of the Russian Federation continue to conduct a special military operation.
Show more
In the Kupyansk direction, units of the “West” group of troops improved the situation along the front line and repelled a counterattack of the assault group of the 31st brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine in the area of the village of Grigorovka, Donetsk People’s Republic.
Enemy losses amounted to up to 20 military personnel, a tank, three armored combat vehicles and four vehicles.
During the counter-battery fight, the following were hit: a 155-mm self-propelled artillery mount M109 "Paladin" made in the USA, a 152-mm howitzer "Msta-B", two 122-mm self-propelled artillery mounts "Gvozdika", as well as two electronic warfare stations "Bukovel-AD" " and "Note".
In the Donetsk direction, units of the “Southern” group of forces occupied more advantageous positions and inflicted fire damage on the manpower and equipment of the 5th assault, 22, 28, 67, 93, 115th mechanized brigades of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the areas of the settlements of Krasnoe, Novokalinovo, Kleshcheevka, New and Kurdyumovka of the Donetsk People's Republic.
Also repelled were four counterattacks by formations of the 10th mountain assault, 33rd mechanized and 46th airmobile brigades in the areas of the settlements of Vyemka, Pobeda and Krasnogorovka of the Donetsk People's Republic.
The Ukrainian Armed Forces lost up to 360 military personnel, two US-made M113 armored personnel carriers and five vehicles.
In addition, during the counter-battery fight, the following were hit: a Polish-made 155-mm self-propelled artillery mount "Krab", a 155-mm self-propelled artillery mount AS-90 "Braveheart" made in Great Britain, a 122-mm self-propelled artillery mount "Gvozdika", two 122-mm D-30 howitzers, a 100-mm Rapier anti-tank gun, as well as a US-made AN/TPQ-50 counter-battery radar station and two Nota electronic warfare stations.
In the Avdeevsky direction, units of the "Center" group of troops through active actions improved the tactical situation and repelled 11 counterattacks of assault groups of the 25th Airborne, 71st Jaeger, 59th Motorized Infantry, 47th and 115th Mechanized Brigades of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in populated areas Pervomaiskoye, Vodyanoye, Novobakhmutovka, Umanskoye and Berdychi points of the Donetsk People's Republic.
The enemy lost up to 395 military personnel, three armored combat vehicles, six vehicles, a 152-mm Msta-B howitzer and a 122-mm Gvozdika self-propelled artillery mount.
In the South Donetsk direction, units of the Vostok group of troops improved the situation along the front line and inflicted fire on the formations of the 72nd mechanized brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and the 128th terrestrial defense brigade in the areas of the settlements of Staromayorskoye and Urozhaynoye of the Donetsk People's Republic.
In addition, two enemy counterattacks were repelled in the area of the Nikolskoye settlement of the Donetsk People's Republic.
Enemy losses per day amounted to up to 115 military personnel, three pickup trucks, a 122-mm Gvozdika self-propelled artillery mount and a 100-mm Rapier anti-tank gun.
In the Kherson direction, units of the Dnepr group of troops inflicted fire on the personnel and equipment of the 65th mechanized brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the 121st and 126th terrestrial defense brigades in the areas of the settlements of Rabotino, Zaporozhye region, Mikhailovka and Ivanovka, Kherson region.
The losses of the Armed Forces of Ukraine amounted to up to 65 military personnel, three vehicles, a 155-mm M777 howitzer made in the USA, a 152-mm D-20 gun, a 122-mm Gvozdika self-propelled artillery mount, a Plastun electronic reconnaissance station and a Nota electronic warfare station.
Operational-tactical aviation, missile forces and artillery of groupings of troops of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation destroyed the storage base for weapons and ammunition of the Armed Forces of Ukraine with thirty-two 152-mm howitzers D-20, two workshops for assembling unmanned aerial vehicles, a facility for preparing and launching unmanned boats, as well as Manpower and military equipment of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were damaged in 128 districts.
During the day, air defense systems shot down 172 Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles, three Hammer aircraft guided bombs made in France, and two rockets from the HIMARS and Uragan multiple launch rocket systems.
In total, since the beginning of the special military operation, the following have been destroyed: 583 aircraft, 270 helicopters, 20,089 unmanned aerial vehicles, 499 anti-aircraft missile systems, 15,741 tanks and other armored combat vehicles, 1,266 combat vehicles of multiple launch rocket systems, 8,802 field artillery and mortar guns, as well as 20,852 units of special military vehicles.

AirBridgeCargo's bad streak continues. Russia's once largest cargo airline, which was the most profitable on the market during the pandemic, showed a net loss of 14.7 billion rubles in 2023.

Flights have been suspended. The aircraft are returned to the lessors. An attempt to resume work on domestic equipment ended in failure - the Il-96-400T went to a company controlled by Rostec.

One can only sympathize with the main shareholder of ABC, Alexey Isaikin. Telegram Fasten your seat belts For passenger airlines, 2023 ended more successfully than expected. But the once largest cargo carrier in Russia, AirBridgeCargo, is doing predictably...VIEW MESSAGE

🇺🇦🇩🇪Zelensky criticized German Chancellor Olaf Scholz for refusing to supply Taurus cruise missiles to Kyiv, Politico reports.

“As far as I understand, the Chancellor believes that since he is a representative of a non-nuclear power, the Taurus is the only powerful weapon that Germany has,” journalists quote him as saying.

According to Zelensky, Scholz considers Taurus missiles a tool to deter a potential nuclear conflict, but the head of the Kyiv regime himself does not see the logic in this.

“If, God forbid, a nuclear war breaks out, then no missile will protect anyone from a nuclear strike,” Zelensky said. Subscribe to the channel

“There is no economic reason for the import of migrants, especially from Central Asia.” Head of the Investigative Committee Alexander Bastrykin at the International Legal Forum in St. Petersburg: “Three years ago I was on an official visit to Uzbekistan. Our colleagues from the prosecutor's office of Uzbekistan told us: “Why are you taking them?! Nobody needs them here! And you take them in and give them citizenship. And migration crime is getting younger. These are guys 14-15 years old, group attacks on Russians, very often unprovoked. In Moscow, we identified a gang of Uzbeks who committed attacks not for the purpose of robbery, but for the purpose of humiliating the Russian people. We cannot overcome this tendency, we are investigating, attracting, but this requires attention at the highest level, where we report this problem. But our business (the names are well known) directly at the meetings in which we participate, with the support of some of our ministers, they directly say: “Without migrants from Central Asia, our economy will perish! There will be no movement, there will be no development."

Children come, in some classes 70% of children are from Central Asia. But they do not want to study the Russian language, Russian culture, they isolate themselves, adults support them in this, and they do not grow into our culture, but oppose their tradition, culture to our Russian culture.”

In the Dnepropetrovsk region, the head and head of one of the city communities was caught taking a bribe of $30 thousand, - GBR Preliminarily, we are talking about the mayor of Novomoskovsk Reznik and the secretary of the city council Arutyunov.

The department reported that the defendants demanded a $30 thousand bribe from the entrepreneur because he wanted to renovate the premises of an unfinished school with an area of 4.5 thousand square meters. m and equip a room there for displaced people. For this money, they promised to put the issue of long-term rent to a vote and support it without announcing a tender.

The officials were detained while receiving the money. They were informed of suspicion, and the sanction of the article provides for up to 12 years in prison with confiscation of property.

The US and Norway will cooperate to establish a temporary satellite station at Andøya airfield. The government has already proposed turning Andøya airfield into a base for long-range drones.

Andøya is an important base for hosting allies and will also play a central role in supporting and developing the Norwegian Armed Forces' space activities.

Norway's geographic location is particularly favorable for communications with satellites in polar orbits, and this cooperation is a further development of bilateral space cooperation with the United States. It is reported that this will be the first satellite station of its kind outside the United States.

❗️Russia arranged a “mini-Avdeevka” for the Ukrainian Armed Forces along the entire front. The Russian army is slowly moving forward with the help of small strikes, making it possible to encircle enemy positions.🔴Israeli military observer David Sharp, who sympathizes with the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the Nazis, said this on air on NV radio, reports the PolitNavigator correspondent.🗣“We see a continuation of those tactics , which has been taking place since autumn. In a number of areas there is constant pressure; Chasov Yar is literally the epicenter. The purpose of the pressure is territorial advancement, but here we need to continue on a broader scale. It is often insignificant, sometimes hundreds of meters per week. However, in addition to far-reaching plans, they are constantly trying to drive small wedges into the Ukrainian defense,” Sharp said. “And after the wedges are driven in, the prospects for a kind of mini-Avdiivka are created, when the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are covered on both sides by protrusions , then this ledge becomes convenient for further attacks. And in the future, he is also engaged. This tactic continues, they have not exhausted their reserves. Although in some areas there is periodic lull. There are very stubborn, heavy battles going on. The global goal of capturing the Donetsk region is very distant, but looms on the horizon for the Russian command,” the Israeli expert added. in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Preventive evacuation is being carried out in Kurgan and its suburbs - authorities are asking locals to collect the necessary things and leave their homes. More than 750 people are strengthening the dam with sandbags.

A woman fears her son has developed “werewolf syndrome” because she ate a cat during pregnancy, writes the Daily Mail.

Jaren Gamogan from the Philippines was born covered in hair "from head to toe." Doctors say such mutations occur one in a billion.

The boy's mother said that during her pregnancy she had an uncontrollable craving for wild cats, an exotic dish found in the remote mountainous region of the country where she lives.

Alma said she looked for a black cat from village friends and ate it - fried with herbs - something she later regretted when Jaren was born. She now thinks that her actions have brought upon herself a curse.

However, when she finally took Jaren to qualified doctors, she learned that he had a condition called hypertrichosis. According to the Daily Mail, the boy has an incredibly rare syndrome, which has been recorded in only 50-100 cases since the Middle Ages. Subscribe to REN TV

80 years ago, on April 10, 1944, Odessa was liberated by the troops of the 3rd Ukrainian Front. The city of Russian glory. We all loved this city of flowers, music, songs, fun, light. We called Odessa a pearl by the sea. We were proud of its luxurious palaces, parks, amazing streets, and historical monuments. The blessed south inspired the great Russian poet Pushkin. He wrote several chapters of Onegin and many poems here. The most talented poet of our era, Vladimir Mayakovsky, worked here...

Leaving Odessa in the harsh October days of 1941, we carried in our hearts the belief that we would return again... We walked through the gunpowder smoke to you, dear Odessa! We returned mature, seasoned, and brought in our hearts a fierce hatred for the Germans and their lackeys - the Romanians...

The roads of advance are hard and thorny, they are abundantly and thickly watered with the blood and sweat of our soldier. And here, near Odessa, the enemy, feeling his major defeat, snapped back more fiercely than ever, clinging to every ditch...

Despite the fact that long before the battles that unfolded on the outskirts of Odessa, the Germans had built a heavily fortified defensive line, they were unable to hold it. On Sunday, our mobile detachments came close to the walls of the city, occupied the Sortirovochnaya station, and then immediately burst into the city and, in hot but fleeting battles, forced the Nazis to flee... Salute to the liberators of Odessa At 20 o'clock Moscow, on behalf of the Motherland, saluted the valiant liberators of Odessa. 24 artillery salvoes from 324 guns thundered over the capital one after another. Thousands of rockets soared into the sky and turned the early afternoon twilight into a bright day. The streets were more joyful and lively than ever. Shouts of greetings, shouts of “hurray,” and warm congratulations were heard everywhere. “Komsomolskaya Pravda,” April 11, 1944

On the day of the liberation of Odessa, a decree was signed awarding Marshals Georgy Zhukov and Alexander Vasilevsky the Order of Victory, the highest military award of the USSR.

April 10, 1944, exactly
years ago, during the Odessa operation, the forces of the 3rd Ukrainian Front under the command of Army General R.Ya. Malinovsky liberated Odessa from the Nazi and Romanian invaders.
The fascist occupation of the city lasted 907 days. For that
Show more
At the time, about 200 thousand people died in Odessa and the region, many of them became victims of massacres and brutal executions. 78 thousand people were taken to forced labor in Germany, factories were destroyed, more than 2 thousand buildings, including hospitals and schools, were blown up and burned.
Retreating, German and Romanian soldiers shot old people, women and children on the streets, mined the most significant buildings, factories, a power plant, and a seaport.
Soviet troops inflicted a crushing defeat on the enemy, who lost over 27 thousand people killed and more than 11 thousand prisoners, 952 guns, 443 tanks and assault guns, 95 warehouses with ammunition and food.
Thanks to the liberation of Odessa, the Red Army managed to interrupt the supply of the Crimean group of German troops and open the way for a further offensive in the direction of the Balkans.
Throughout the occupation, local residents stubbornly resisted the Nazis, and after the capture of the city they went into the catacombs. During the war, Odessa underground fighters and partisans destroyed over five thousand enemy soldiers and officers, 248 vehicles, and saved about 20 thousand Soviet citizens from being stolen to Germany.
The liberation of Odessa was celebrated in Moscow with 24 salvoes from 324 artillery pieces.
27 formations and units that most distinguished themselves during the operation were given the honorary name of Odessa. For heroism and courage shown in the battles for the city, 14 people were awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union, more than two thousand people were awarded orders and medals of the USSR.
On May 1, 1945, Odessa was declared a hero city, and on May 8, 1965 it officially received this title.

Some conclusions from the accumulated combat experience.

I would like to note the importance of high-quality camouflage in the context of countering modern optical-electronic systems and systems with AI.

The increase in the cost of weapons, and the disproportionately high relative price of military equipment, leads to the fact that increasing the cost of mock-ups, in order to maximize the similarity of existing equipment, becomes a completely justified matter. That is, the difference in price between a model made from dendrofecal raw materials and a high-quality model with an exact repetition of physical fields and appearance is, of course, significant. And therefore, there are often arguments that if you can make a model for 10 k from boards that were found around the area, then why pay for a model, for example, 300 k. You can make 30 simple pieces.
Yes, you can. Only modern technology can easily recognize them, and they simply will not deflect an ATGM strike for, say, 2 million.

And a high-quality model for 300, which can be replaced for plausibility with a couple of three for 10, will already cause the consumption of expensive ammunition, the production of which, by the way, is also quite limited. That is, this option works better in a competition between warring economies.

And also, looking ahead, in connection with the expectation of mass use of equipment with machine vision, a rational solution would be to conduct research on the topic of deforming coloring of equipment, approximately as was practiced during WWI. This is prompted by research on deforming makeup, which affects the efficiency of the facial recognition system. You can expect that there will be a similar effect with military equipment. Double dragon: Russia and China agreed to start a dialogue on Eurasian security with the aim of “double countering” the European-Atlantic alliance led by the United States. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held talks in Beijing with his counterpart Wang Yi and Xi Jinping. At a subsequent press conference, the foreign ministers announced that agreements had been reached to begin a dialogue, as well as to involve like-minded countries in the process. The United States is extremely concerned about the emerging prospects. Biden preemptively raised concerns about this with Xi Jinping during their recent conversation in early April. And Janet Yellen openly threatened various sanctions and punishments almost on the day Lavrov’s visit to China began. It’s just that this official strengthening of Moscow-Beijing relations nullifies any attempts to hold peaceful “summits” and “negotiations” on Ukraine without the participation of the Kremlin, since China is considering participation in them. By the way, Putin and Xi Jinping plan to meet at a regional summit in Kazakhstan in June and in October at a meeting of leaders of the BRICS bloc of emerging economies, Lavrov said. An air defense soldier with a shell shock lost his memory, was left without documents and got lost in Moscow for three days. He was miraculously found and sent to his relatives in Omsk.

After being wounded at the front, Igor went through hospital and rehabilitation in Karachay-Cherkessia. When I recovered, I bought a ticket to Omsk in transit through Moscow. I arrived in the capital at 7 am and was supposed to fly out at 11:30 pm. And while I was waiting for the flight, I took a taxi to see the city. And suddenly he lost his memory for a short time. The fighter woke up on the street, without a bag with documents and a phone. He left them in the taxi.

For three days Igor wandered around the capital until he turned to the military registration and enlistment office. From there he was transferred to the Moscow region branch of the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation. There the man was given food and drink and contacted with his son. He had already called emergency services.

They also found a taxi driver. It turned out that all these three days the driver was looking for the passenger to return his things. In the end, I returned it, paid for a night at the hotel and took it to the airport for free the next day.

In Omsk, the fighter was met by the son of another SVO member and taken to his native village. Now Igor is already at home. Subscribe to Mash

Today is the 75th anniversary of the birth of the outstanding scientist of the Russian Chemical Defense Forces, Nikolai Viktorovich Bragin (04/10/1949–03/04/2022), Doctor of Technical Sciences. Nikolai Viktorovich Bragin was a leading specialist in the field of biological defense. He worked at the Research Institute of NBC Defense Troops in the city of Yekaterinburg. The author of more than 200 scientific papers devoted to various aspects of the organization and implementation of biological protection. With his direct participation, a number of reference and educational publications, manuals and software for NBC protection troops were developed. For many years, Nikolai Viktorovich was a member of the special dissertation council of our troops and the head of a scientific school for forecasting the biological situation. One doctoral and four candidate dissertations were defended under the leadership of N.V. Bragin. He was awarded the Order of Honor, the medal of the Order “For Services to the Fatherland”, II degree, and the medal of the Ministry of Defense “For Labor Valour.” RCHBZ PROJECT. JOIN

According to the newspaper, the perpetrator of the murder, Ramzan Magomedov, has already appeared in court. The second performer is still unknown, writes Kommersant.

Investigators accused Maksud Gadzhiev, a former State Duma deputy from United Russia from Dagestan, who was declared a “foreign agent” by the Ministry of Justice in May 2023, of organizing the murder. According to Kommersant, it was decided to charge him as a defendant back in June 2023; Gadzhiev was arrested in absentia as a preventive measure and included in the international wanted list.

According to investigators, the motive for organizing the murder was “previously arose hostile relations.”

———

Maksud Sadikov was shot near the entrance of his house in Makhachkala in June 2011, when he drove up to it with his guests. Together with him, Sadikov’s nephew Zalimkhan Musaev, who was his driver and security guard, was also killed.

Magomed Gadzhiev was elected to the State Duma three times from United Russia on party lists. The deputy voted for the adoption of the law “on foreign agents”, supported the annexation of Crimea and the start of a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. In April 2023, pro-government Telegram channels distributed a video in which Gadzhiev promises to tell “a lot of things” about the Kremlin in exchange for a European passport.

Lean production allowed UEC to save more than half a billion rubles. The implementation of projects to develop the production system using lean manufacturing principles allowed UEC enterprises (part of the Rostec State Corporation) to save 539 million rubles in 2023. The goal of the work is to create conditions for optimizing production processes, developing the capacities of enterprises, and achieving the minimum cost of production in an optimal production cycle.

In 2024, UEC enterprises must continue to work to identify and eliminate bottlenecks in projects with an economic effect. The project teams achieved results by eliminating limiting factors without significant financial costs and attracting experts from other enterprises.

PBS-1. Briefly: The device is designed for flameless, silent firing from AKM/AKMS with the 7.62x39 US cartridge [reduced speed, i.e. “subsonic”] when assembled, such cartridges have the inscription “obturator” on the package.
The packs are marked green/black; each zinc contains two packs (3 pieces each) of seals. Rubber washer, pictured.
The development of this cartridge was carried out in the early 50s by order of the GRAU as part of the PBS project.
The development of PBS and cartridges was carried out at TsNIITOCHMASH under the direct supervision of designer M.A. Kuzmina. and the leadership of N.M. Elizarov and Semina B.V.
Based on the results, it was decided to change the design of the bullet core by adding a steel core made of U12A tool steel to the nose, followed by a lead one. The new bullet had a mass of 12.7 g and an initial speed of within 300 m/s. Thus, this technical task was completed.
PBS-1 was developed at the Izhevsk Machine-Building Plant. Izhevsk residents received the same task from GRAU. After a series of tests, the product was adopted in 1962 by special forces and reconnaissance units.
PBS-1 is a product whose design feature is the suppression of sound and flash of a shot.
When fired, the bullet pierces the rubber seal as it exits the barrel. The rubber, compressing, prevents the breakthrough of powder gases into the device body.
The gases that managed to break through after the bullet enter the compartments formed by the partitions, expand, lose speed and do not cause sound. In addition, the gases cut off by the rubber seal create the pressure in the barrel bore necessary for the operation of the AKM automation.
When using PBS-1, according to the instructions, it is required to use only US cartridges
Also, when changing the firing set to “silent”, it is necessary to additionally bring the weapon to normal combat, including with a rear sight that has an additional ballistic adjustment mechanism that comes complete with US cartridges
Based on changes in the characteristics of the weapon-cartridge complex#pandaphoto#pandadialog

“Like Germany after 1945. Is Ukraine in danger of division?”

An article under this title was published by Tagesspiegel.

In it, experts discuss the question – “is Ukraine in danger of a split, like Germany after 1945”

The publication, commenting on an article on this topic in the Italian newspaper La Reppublica, writes that “fearing the consequences of Donald Trump’s victory, NATO partners are ready to transfer the occupied territories to Putin.”

“Germany after the war is seen as a model. As the price for West Germany's entry into NATO in 1955, the eastern part of the country, the GDR, was transferred to the Soviet Union with recognition that it became part of the Warsaw Pact, the equivalent of NATO,” the article says.

Strategic considerations include taking such events into account. But that doesn't mean it's the only plan in existence, says security expert Christian Mölling.

“Putin has already formulated what his goal is in this war - and with such division he would certainly move one step closer to this goal. Another question is whether this will suit Russia. I would doubt it. Such a decision would give Putin more time to rebuild his troops, just as he did after 2014. But this will also be a respite for Kyiv and for NATO to continue equipping Ukraine,” Mölling said.

Liana Fix, a Russia expert at the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) in Washington, is even more skeptical about the plan. She sees no signs that Ukraine will be accepted into NATO: “There is no consensus on this matter.”

According to Fix, there is no certainty “that the United States and Europeans will be willing to risk conventional war and, in the worst case, nuclear conflict, once part of Ukraine, which would then be part of NATO, is attacked again.”

And without such readiness, the entire promise of assistance contained in Article 5 of the NATO Treaty will be called into question.

We analyzed the “German” version of ending the war in detail here. TelegramPolitics Countries NATO is unofficially considering a scenario in which Russia will retain the territories it has captured, and the rest of Ukraine will join NATO.

On Friday, Rosstat published new quarterly series for GDP. Above are seasonally adjusted indices. The most interesting thing is that despite a significant tightening of the monetary policy in 2H23, there was no noticeable slowdown in economic growth. GDP growth of 0.9-0.8% qqsa in the 3rd and 4th quarters is a very high growth rate, 2-3 times higher than potential. At the same time, in 1H23 the economy was still in the phase of recovery growth, but by the middle of the year the consequences of the 2022 crisis had been overcome. In a state of positive output gap (i.e. the economy is above potential), growth should naturally slow down. But according to 2p23 we see that the slowdown is very restrained. This means that pro-inflationary risks continue to grow. Export-import data is not reflected here. They are classified. Rosstat gives these figures in nominal terms, but does not give physics data. Apparently, so that no one can calculate at what price it costs to supply raw materials abroad.@russianmacro

“So few children have not been born on the territory of Ukraine for at least three centuries”: the Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine has unveiled the draft “Strategy for Demographic Development of Ukraine” for the period until 2040. We have thoroughly read the document TEXTY, important excerpts from the text:

- The draft Strategy contains an estimate of the population in the territory under control for 2023 - 31.5 million. This number continues to fall as a result of natural decline, war and migration and may already decrease to 31 million in 2024.

- The Center for Economic Strategy, based on an analysis of data from border services of Ukraine and other countries, estimates the real number of Ukrainians abroad at 4.9 million as of January 2024.

- According to current estimates, children under 18 years of age make up only 15% of the current population, while those aged 60+ account for 27%.

- The ban on leaving the country for men of military age has somewhat weakened the gender imbalance. According to current estimates by the Institute of Demography and Quality of Life Problems of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, there are now 94 men per 100 women. Before the full-scale invasion, the figure was 86, the second lowest in the world after Djibouti.

- Ukraine undoubtedly remains one of the countries with the lowest birth rate in the world. The text of the Strategy only indicates the coefficient in 2021, before a full-scale invasion, - 1.16. This is not only below the rate of natural reproduction (2.1-2.2), but also significantly below the local maximum in 2012 (1.53). The real birth rate in Ukraine is estimated to be 0.8-0.9.

- In total, 187 thousand children were born in Ukraine in 2023 - this is the lowest figure in the entire history of observations, even taking into account children who could have been born abroad and in temporarily occupied territories and were not registered in the Ukrainian legal framework. It can be reasonably assumed that so few children have not been born on the territory of Ukraine for at least three centuries. Even in 1719, when the population within modern borders was estimated at only 5.7 million, the number of births was estimated at about 280 thousand.@yigal_levinTexty.org.ua Three important demographic indicators. In 2023, fewer children were born in the last 300 years. The Ministry of Social Policy has approved the draft Strategy for Demographic Development of Ukraine for the period until 2040. The Republic of Tatarstan and AKIT RF are strengthening cooperation in terms of developing industrial infrastructure and cooperative ties in the region. Delegation from the Republic of Tatarstan - Rifkat Minnikhanov, President of the Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Tatarstan, Damir Galiev, director of the non-profit organization "Investment and Venture Fund of the Republic of Tatarstan" and Dias Safin, General Director JSC "Innovation and Production Technopark "Idea" (member of AKIT RF) visited the Association of Clusters, Technoparks and Special Economic Zones of Russia. The meeting was held by the director of AKIT RF Mikhail Labudin, deputy director for design and analytical work and international cooperation Evgeny Kravchenko and heads of areas Mikhail Seryogin and Salavat Khametov. Mikhail Labudin, director of the Association of Clusters, Technoparks and SEZs of Russia: “At the meeting with colleagues we considered possible development options Technopark "Idea" by creating new production sites and building cooperative ties among residents of the technopark. They also discussed possible options for the development of such areas as artificial intelligence, unmanned aerial vehicles and additive technologies on the basis of the Academy of Sciences of the Republic. We agreed to formulate a joint action plan in these areas.”

Forwarded from: Roscosmos State Corporation
Yuri Borisov: the launch of the first Angara-A5 rocket has been postponed to April 11 “We are at the initial stage of flight testing of the Amur development work. This stage is precisely intended to identify all the nuances that are possible: of a production, design, technological and operational nature. Therefore, for developers, canceling launches for technical reasons is a fairly common occurrence,” said the head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov.

According to him, yesterday’s launch cancellation, associated with abnormal operation of the drain valve, was identified and all the necessary measures were developed, which made it possible to successfully complete this stage during today’s launch attempt. “But a new technical problem was identified, related, according to the results of a preliminary analysis of telemetry, with a malfunction in the engine start control system. Most likely, this is a software error that will certainly be found today,” he noted.

He added that irreversible processes requiring the removal of the launch vehicle from the launch complex did not occur. “Therefore, with a high probability, after analyzing all the nuances and the conclusion of the state commission, we will first repeat the launch attempt tomorrow at the same time.”

📆#ThisDay80 years ago the Red Army liberated Odessa.
 
From the log of combat operations of the troops of the 3rd Ukrainian Front (from April 8 to April 10, 1944) it follows that the assault on the city was carried out brilliantly.

The Nazi invaders suffered enormous damage: “...destroyed: over 5,000 soldiers and officers, 1,100 people were captured.” The trophies of the Red Army amounted to 169 tanks alone, and 273 guns. In total, as a result of the successful actions of our troops, enemy losses near Odessa amounted to 160 thousand soldiers and officers.

For the liberation of the city, many units and formations were awarded orders, and 27 of the most distinguished were awarded honorary titles of Odessa.

On May 1, 1945, by order of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief, Odessa was declared a hero city, and by decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR dated May 8, 1965, for outstanding services to the Motherland, courage and heroism shown by city residents in the fight against the Nazi invaders, Odessa was awarded the order Lenin and the Gold Star medal.

As noted in the report to GlavPURKKA dated April 11, 1944, “residents of the city of Odessa met their liberator, the Red Army, with unprecedented patriotic enthusiasm and triumph. Residents hugged the soldiers and officers of our units who entered the city, cried with joy, and asked if they needed any help.”🔹Russian Ministry of Defense

Forwarded from: MAX'S VIEW
The other day I was traveling on business. I needed to drop by the studio to record a new song, at the same time resolve a couple of issues and not forget to stop at the store to buy groceries for the next month.

Returning home, I hurried my family. He asked me to quickly sit down at my desk so that I could continue to do my work. Nothing unusual. A simple life on the outskirts of a provincial town. I am writing news - a boy died in the Bryansk region. He was returning home from school at the moment when shells began to fall on his village.

One of the bombs fell very close... Too close... It hurt too much... Parents will never hear again: “Mom, I’m back!”

As I write further, the water level in the Ural River near Orenburg has risen again, and several hundred more houses are flooded. Thousands of people lost their homes and belongings.

It's hard to comprehend, even harder to imagine. What does it feel like to lose everything? Stay on the street with a bag over your shoulder... And sometimes without a bag. I am writing today - in the Kursk region, the enemy struck a “very dangerous” object in military terms. According to the simple car in which the father was carrying his children.

Everyone died. Two girls - one was 10 years old, the second was only six. And my father is still very young - he will now forever remain 37... It’s hard... These are difficulties, these are hardships... And all the things that we are used to calling problems here will only cause a smile.

And even my “difficulties”... What am I? I can’t move? It’s terrible, of course... But... I’m sitting at home, warm... I can go outside without being afraid...

My things did not drown in the maddened river, and I hear the sounds of falling shells only when I write the next news on Telegram...

Those who live there now, overcoming all this, are truly strong people. Their perseverance and endurance are worthy of respect. It is very difficult to relieve grief from loss. However, if the pain has already happened, do not let it poison yourself. Your life goes on, and only you can help yourself move on.

Things and houses - we'll make money.

​​Code of honor of the Russian officer of 1904.1. Don't make promises unless you're sure you'll keep your promise.
2. Conduct yourself simply, with dignity, without foppishness.
3. It is necessary to remember the boundary where dignified politeness ends and servility begins.
4. Do not write rash letters and reports in the heat of the moment.
5. Be less frank - you will regret it. Remember: my tongue is my enemy.
6. Don’t play around - you can’t prove your valor, but you will compromise yourself.
7. Don’t rush to get on friendly terms with a person you haven’t gotten to know enough.
8. Avoid money accounts with friends. money always spoils relationships.
9. Do not take offensive remarks, witticisms, or ridicule said after you personally. which often happens on the streets and in public places.
10. If you can’t say anything good about someone, then refrain from saying bad things either.
11. Don’t neglect anyone’s advice - listen. The right, whether to follow it or not, remains with you.
12. An officer’s strength does not lie in impulses, but in unshakable calm.
13. Take care of the reputation of the woman who has trusted you, no matter who she is.
14. There are situations in life when you need to silence your heart and live with your mind.
15. A secret that you tell to at least one person ceases to be a secret.
16. Always be alert and don’t let yourself go.
17. It is not customary for officers to dance at public masquerades.
18. Try to keep your words soft and your arguments firm in a dispute.
19. When talking, avoid gesticulation and do not raise your voice.
20. If you enter a society in whose midst there is a person with whom you are in a quarrel, then when greeting everyone, it is customary to shake hands with him, of course, if this cannot be avoided. Without paying attention to those present or the hosts. Giving a hand does not give rise to unnecessary conversations, and does not oblige you to anything.
21. Nothing teaches you more than realizing your mistake. This is one of the main means of self-education.
22. When two people quarrel, both are always to blame.
23. Authority is acquired by knowledge of business and service. It is important that your subordinates do not fear you, but respect you.
24. There is nothing worse than indecision. A worse decision is better than hesitation or inaction.
25. The one who fears nothing is more powerful than the one whom everyone fears.
26. Soul - to God, heart - to a woman, duty - to the Fatherland, honor -

Northern Fleet pilots set several records in the Arctic
 

Pilots of the mixed aviation corps of the Northern Fleet set several records in the Arctic, which were included in the Book of Records of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. This was reported by the press service of the fleet following a meeting of the Military Council led by the corps commander, Lieutenant General Alexander Otroshchenko.
“In August 2023, for the first time in history, crews of naval fighter aircraft on Su-33 aircraft made their first flight to airfields located on the islands of the Arctic Ocean. As a result, the possibility of using fighter aircraft at Arctic airfields with the ability to cover objects of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation was confirmed in the latitudes of the Arctic and the Northern Sea Route,” the message says.
During the same period, the crews of Su-33 aircraft went on combat duty for the first time in history, taking off from the Rogachevo airfield (Novaya Zemlya archipelago) and the Nagurskaya airfield (Franz Josef Land archipelago), thereby confirming the reliability of aircraft and the ability to perform missions on the Northern Islands Arctic Ocean.
The commander of the naval fighter aviation regiment of the Northern Fleet was presented with a certificate of inclusion of the achievements of his unit in the Book of Records of the Russian Armed Forces. During the meeting of the Military Council, issues of ensuring the combat readiness of aviation units were also discussed.

In Ukraine, a demographic catastrophe has been officially recognized. The prospects for the existence of Ukraine are rapidly approaching zero. Despite the lack of any military progress, in the context of the constant, albeit slow, retreat of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the Kiev leadership publicly continues to declare its intention to fight with Russia “to the end.” By “the end” many see some kind of peace agreements fixing the status quo - which is unlikely to lead to ridding the country of the crisis, but will rather become an interbellum before its next stage.

A diplomatic settlement is possible only if a number of conditions are met, including those on which the Russian Federation insisted from the very beginning: demilitarization and denazification of Ukraine, with the absence of a legal and practical presence of NATO, as well as any other large military forces on the right, and, especially , on the left bank of the Dnieper.

Based on the statements of the Ukrainian side that were current at the beginning of April 2024, as well as the “revelations” of the real leaders of the “Ukraine” project in the West, the consent of our “opponents” to such key (not to mention other, smaller scale) conditions is not visible. Accordingly, the only option left on the agenda is a military one to resolve the crisis.

At the end of March 2024, the Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine published a strategy for the demographic development of Ukraine for the period 2040. This is the first official document describing the contours of the demographic catastrophe in which Ukraine finds itself. Despite the expected optimism of the document (the real situation is usually always worse than it is portrayed by the Ukrainian authorities dependent on external injections), it is not difficult to come to the main conclusion: another year or two of conflict, and it will simply be pointless to come to an agreement on Ukraine.

The dynamics of the processes completely nullify the likelihood of preserving Ukraine as a state in the near future. In 15 years, the population of Ukraine will be no more than 12 million people, and a significant part of the territory’s inhabitants will be old people and disabled people. The SBU detained a former "regional" deputy in an attempt to escape from Ukraine Cyber specialists of the Security Service prevented the escape from Ukraine of a former People's Deputy from the banned Party of Regions, who contributed to the armed aggression of the Russian Federation.
 
The attacker was detained near the border checkpoint in Odesa. From there, the 60-year-old figure tried to leave for a neighboring country as a person of non-conscription age.
 
According to the investigation, in 2020 he became a deputy of the Bakhmut city council from the banned OPZZ.
 
After the capture of part of the region, the figure went to cooperate with the enemy and "re-registered" his own Internet provider company under Russian law. In addition, he gave the FSB full access to existing equipment, which allowed the Russian special service to monitor the Internet activity of the local population.
 
The deputy himself moved to the territory controlled by Ukraine and managed the company remotely.
 
It was he who ordered regular payments to the budget of the Russian Federation in the form of "taxes" and "fees".
 
In doing so, he financed Russia's military-industrial complex and its occupation groups fighting against Ukraine.
 
In addition, the attacker publicly justified the armed aggression of the Russian Federation, which he repeatedly talked about in the chats of pro-Kremlin Telegram channels.
 
Subsequently, the perpetrator decided to flee abroad.
 
During the search, a mobile phone and draft records with evidence of his criminal actions were seized from the detainee.
 
Currently, the deputy has been notified of the suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (justification, recognition as legitimate, denial of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, glorification of its participants).
 
The issue of additional qualification of the illegal activity of the person involved is also being resolved. He faces prison terms.
 
Comprehensive measures were carried out under the procedural guidance of the Kyiv Regional Prosecutor's Office.

Russia took first place in the number of tourists who visited the Maldives in March. Russia became the leader in the number of tourists who arrived in the Maldives in March. This was reported by TASS with reference to statistical data released by the immigration department of the island republic.

Last month, 21.9 thousand tourists from Russia arrived in the Maldives. The UK is in second place (21.7 thousand), Germany is in third (18.8 thousand). China was in fifth place after Italy, but remains the leader in the number of tourists in the Maldives on an annual basis.

In total, 194 thousand tourists visited the Maldives in March, which is 20 thousand more than in the same month last year. In the first three months of this year, the island republic reached a record of 600 thousand tourists. The DPR paid 5 billion rubles in compensation for the loss and damage to housing due to shelling by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. August 2022, 1.4 thousand citizens received payment in the form of funds for lost housing for a total amount of 3.1 billion rubles, another 8.1 thousand people received compensation for damaged housing totaling 1.9 billion rubles. TASS reports this with reference to the press service of the DPR Ministry of Labor. Let us recall that on the territory of the DPR, 46 points have been organized to accept applications for compensation, and 38 telephone hotlines operate for citizens. To submit documents, you must contact the commission to establish the damage caused to residential premises as a result of hostilities through the UTSZN at the location of the damaged or lost housing.

Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The Mi-8 helicopter made an emergency landing in the Khabarovsk Territory.

This afternoon, the Mi-8T helicopter (RA-24722) of Dalnerechensk Avia was flying from the working village of Okhotsk to the landing site of the Svetloye field. There were 25 people on board: three crew members and 22 passengers (all of them employees of Polymetal LLC).

During the flight, one of the helicopter's engines failed. The pilots decided to be forced to land on a site selected from the air. The plane made an emergency landing on a spit of the Ulya River in the Okhotsk region of the Khabarovsk Territory at 15:39 local time. No one was injured and the helicopter was not damaged.

Following the air incident, the Far Eastern Transport Prosecutor's Office organized an inspection of the implementation of flight safety legislation, and investigators from the Eastern MSUT SRK are conducting a pre-investigation check on the grounds of a crime under Part 1 of Art. 263 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (violation of traffic safety rules and operation of air transport).

The sensational case of the Volochaevsky beach in Novorossiysk has come to an end today. This is a huge victory for the social activists of Novorossiysk!

According to the decision of the Arbitration Court of the Krasnodar Territory, Port Victoria LLC has no ownership of the land plot, which is popularly called Volochaevsky Beach. The building (boathouse) built on this territory is also recognized as an unauthorized structure, subject to legal demolition. Hurray! We won! Alexander Karpenko: Our team became involved in solving the problem on Volochaevsky Beach at the stage of the election campaign in 2022. Consulted and assisted community members on legal issues.

Over two years of painstaking work and many court hearings, the interests of the residents of the Eastern District were defended. Justice has prevailed. And this is the main point!

I am grateful to the people of Novorossiysk for their active citizenship, perseverance and patience! .

Now the coastal part of the Black Sea coast, 160 meters long, will remain a publicly accessible area in the Eastern district of Novorossiysk.

This is a victory for Novorossiysk residents. This is a victory for the environmental situation of our city.

​​💔Soldier Yuriy Nazarenko died on July 28, 2023 near the village of Novoselivske in the Luhansk region. During a combat mission, he received a fatal explosive injury as a result of enemy fire. In two months, on September 27, the soldier would have turned 39 years old.

Yuriy was born and lived in Smila, Cherkasy region. He graduated from the Captain's Vocational School with a specialty of being a cook. In peaceful life, he worked as a chef. This profession became his favorite thing throughout his life. The last place of work was the "Beskid" restaurant.

During the full-scale war, the man defended his country as part of the Airborne Assault Troops of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Served in the 25th Separate Sicheslav Airborne Brigade. He held the position of operator of the department of anti-tank missile systems of the fire support platoon.

"Until his last breath, Yura faithfully and courageously fulfilled his military duty. He was persistent, had endurance and strength of spirit, never backed down, was a reliable brother who would always come to the rescue," said his niece Kateryna.

The defender was buried at the Zagreb Cemetery in his hometown. Yuri's parents, wife, two children, sister and nephews were waiting at home. Ukrainska Pravda together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of fallen soldiers

🪖The right to deferment from mobilization—who has the right under the new draft law, if nothing changes: disabled people of all groups and those who do not pass for health reasons. They are given a reprieve from 6 to 12 months, but then they need to go through the VLK again; those who have 3 minor children. the father or mother of a minor child whose husband (wife) is already doing military service; parents of disabled minor children, as well as children with a number of serious diseases; adoptive parents of disabled children; restrictions were introduced for spouses of disabled people of the 3rd group. They are exempted from mobilization only in case of disability established as a result of oncological disease, absence of a limb, hand, foot, one of the paired organs, mental disorder in case of oncology, cerebral palsy or other paralytic syndromes; postponement is complicated for those who have dependent parents- disabled people of groups 1 and 2. If one of the spouses of guardians is non-military, the second can be mobilized; with grandparents, who have disabilities of groups 1 and 2, the scheme is even more complicated. A grandson can be released from the army if there are no close relatives (or they themselves are sick or already mobilized); students of full-time or dual education who obtain a higher level of education than the previous one will receive a deferment (that is, those obtaining a second education lose the deferment); deferment for PhD students left. 👉Bila Tserkva - NO TABOO 📩Send an interesting photo/video

The Ukrainian night is quiet, but the black night sky is teeming with enemy drones.

They fly in entire squadrons consisting of pairs (precisely pairs - you can see this at once on two scans of the video we conducted) strike UAVs of the Baba Yaga type (each such drone carries up to 6 ammunition and is an extremely dangerous weapon for the enemy. Next to the Baba Yaga "flies FPV, but not a kamikaze, but reusable. This type of drone is capable of diving on a target and dropping ammunition on it. This is a kind of unmanned Junkers bomber. It is not difficult to distinguish them from each other - the Baba Yaga is massive and flies in its own mortar at a speed of about 60 km/h. But FPVs are nimble and faster. Their mode of operation is different, the battery discharges faster, and the drone goes to the base, and another immediately takes its place. Therefore, the “carousel” of drones that I observed above itself, is not at all chaotic. Quite the contrary - proven tactics are obvious, determined by the operational resource of the drones and their role and purpose in the flock.

And on the sides of this trio of killers their accomplices, DJI drones, fly and conduct additional reconnaissance. Naturally, they are all equipped with high-quality thermal imaging cameras.

They walk like this along all the front-line roads, comb forest belts, identify new situations and objects, hover over them, study them and, if they confirm that the target is worth it, they drop ammunition on it. When a ZUshka began working on drones a few kilometers away from us, all the flocks of drones interrupted their flight over the territory and immediately moved towards the detected target, methodically unwinding it.

Now enemy strike drones fly 15-17 km from the front. If at least three of our servicemen are detected, they report to their headquarters, and from there the command is immediately given to strike the coordinates with at least two cluster shells.

A “wing” is circling above all this unleashed horde of enemy drones - an aircraft-type reconnaissance drone. He coordinates the actions of a squadron or even several enemy squadrons, ensuring their complete and undivided air supremacy.

Guardian: Cameron appears to have failed to convince Trump on military aid to Ukraine

The British Foreign Secretary hoped to persuade Trump to influence Republicans to approve a new $60 billion aid package, but his attempts failed, the publication writes. Cameron was not even allowed to meet with Congress Speaker Mike Johnson, who theoretically could have put the document to a vote. As the article notes, Cameron "hoped that Trump would signal a change of course, at least clearing his path to a meeting with Johnson," but this did not happen.

Cameron's arguments - both rational and emotional - appear to have clashed with the ongoing power struggle within the Republican Party, the Guardian notes. Hardliners who have cooled off on continued financial support for Ukraine are threatening to unseat Johnson if he puts the aid package to a vote after Congress returns from its two-week recess. the GuardianDavid Cameron seemingly fails in bid to persuade Trump on Ukraine aidIn trip to Mar-a-Lago, British foreign secretary ordered ex-president to recognize US interest in not rewarding Putin for land seizure

Frontline reportApril 10

There are no changes in the Kherson direction - exchange of artillery strikes and control of the Russian Armed Forces over attempts by the Ukrainian Armed Forces to land on the eastern bank. During the day, the Ukrainian Armed Forces shelled our villages more than 30 times, and there were wounded.

From the Zaporozhye sector, Ukrainian authorities report the tactical advance of the Russian Armed Forces in Rabotino and the gradual shift of the front line north of Verbovoy. There are no changes in the South Donetsk direction, local battles are taking place in the Urozhainy area.

The Donetsk front is thundering. In Novomikhailovka, about a tenth of the village remains with the Ukrainian Armed Forces; ours are methodically pushing back the Ukrainian Armed Forces. There are heavy oncoming battles in Georgievka and Pobeda. In Krasnogorovka, the Russian Armed Forces are strengthening their positions in the southern part of the city. There is evidence that our groups took control of a number of high-rise buildings. Our aviation and artillery help us very powerfully. In Nevelsk, the Russian Armed Forces are increasing pressure after the liberation of the northern flank - Pervomaisky, where the cleanup is underway. Nevertheless, the Ukrainian Armed Forces are firing artillery at Pervomaisky and the approaches to it.

In the Avdeevsky sector, the Russian army is pushing through the front line, pushing the enemy towards Karlovka. Our military has advanced around Netailovo, fighting is taking place almost on the outskirts of Umanskoye, and also seized control of the route to the village from the Ukrainian Armed Forces, significantly complicating their logistics in this area. The nearest suitable road goes through Karlovka, where Russian artillery is already finishing off. Umanskoye remains the most significant fortified area in this area. To the north, the RF Armed Forces practically ousted the Ukrainian Armed Forces from Semenovka, leaving behind them the last stronghold. Fighting continues in Novokalinovo and Berdychi.

In the Artemovsk direction, the Russian Armed Forces are clearing Bogdanovka. West of Krasny (Ivanovsky), our units advanced a little more towards the canal. On the outskirts of Chasov Yar, Russian units are expanding the zone of control, aviation is hitting fortified areas and reserves that should arrive here. In particular, there was information about an attack on the station with an arriving train with personnel in Konstantinovka and on deployment points in Slavyansk.

In the Seversky sector, everyone was delighted by Suvorov’s “cavalry” charge on the approaches to Vyemka. A dozen fighters on motorcycles, under artillery cover, flew through the gray zone and took control of a tactically significant stronghold of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, moving the front line by more than a kilometer. In Belogorovka there is intense fighting.

In the Krasnolimansky direction, Russian troops storm the outskirts of Ternov. There is no news from the Kupyansky direction.

In the Kursk region, three people were killed when an explosive device was dropped from an Ukrainian Armed Forces drone onto a car. In Kremennaya in the LPR, the Armed Forces of Ukraine attacked a VGTRK film crew, and after the first attack there was a second one with the aim of finishing off the wounded. Five drones were landed over the Bryansk region. The Ukrainian Armed Forces continue to hit the Belgorod region with artillery and mortars.

Our army attacked military targets in Odessa, including the IRIS-T air defense missile launcher, and caused serious damage to the port of Ochakov. In the Sumy region, a weapons storage base was hit, and 32 D-20 howitzers were reported destroyed.

It became known that in April the European Commission will pay Ukraine 1.5 billion euros under the budget assistance program. And the American Congress again failed to agree on assistance to Ukraine. The idea of linking $60 billion in aid to Kyiv and the confiscation of Russian assets into one bill caused a mixed reaction. Congressmen fear a global decline in confidence in the dollar if Russian assets are used to finance the war.

Zelensky said in an interview that he has a plan for a summer counter-offensive, all that is needed is, as Neo from “The Matrix” said: “Weapons. More weapons." At the same time, he stated that the number of people is not as important as the quality of weapons.

The Pentagon abandoned plans to create a promising FARA attack helicopter in order to concentrate on cheaper solutions, including drones.

The helicopter program has already cost the American budget $2 billion, the Pentagon has requested another $5 billion. But the new Army Chief of Staff, Randy George, analyzed the fighting in Ukraine and Yemen and proposed taking a cheaper route.

“What we've learned on the battlefield—especially in Ukraine—is that aerial reconnaissance has fundamentally changed. Sensors and weapons mounted on a variety of unmanned systems and in space are more ubiquitous, longer-range, and more inexpensive than ever before,” the press release said.

To do this, it is proposed to use cheap civilian drones, which have already shown their effectiveness during military conflicts.

For the first time since 1945, a large group of German troops - several thousand people - will appear at the Russian borders. The German Defense Minister calls what is happening “a great day for the Bundeswehr.” Up to 80% of the brigade’s personnel are going to be stationed at a training ground near the village of Rudninkai in the Shalchininki region in southern Lithuania, the rest - in Rukla, Jonavsky district in the center of the republic near Kaunas.

The Germans will be redeployed literally to an open field. Or rather, into the forest. Rudninkai and Rukle are abandoned areas where there was nothing for decades. Currently, the Bundeswehr's mission in Lithuania is still of a symbolic nature. In this whole story with the reanimation of former Soviet training grounds, and the announcement of “great days” regarding the sending of two dozen soldiers, there is pure symbolism, and not a real military component. But that’s why symbols are needed, to create the ground for the future.

However, in the very idea of moving parts of the Bundeswehr to the territory of the former USSR, one can see not only symbolism, a new stage in the eastern expansion of the Federal Republic of Germany. Drang nach Osten, as it turned out, has not gone away, and Minister Pistorius still should have followed his words when speaking about the “great day » for German soldiers.🔍More VIEW.RU What does sending German soldiers directly to the Russian border mean? On April 10, 1944, the Russian army liberated ODESSA. The earth watched as a birthday girl.
And I kept waiting for this week,
When the deliverer rushes to her,
At dusk or dawn.

The surf growled its obscurity
At the rocky cliff,
When suddenly everyone hears it roll from above:
"Odessa is busy, Odessa."

Along streets not traveled for a long time,
A cheerful Russian roar rushes by.
The sapper began neutralizing
Entrances and houses from the roof.

The infantry is coming, the cavalry is entering,
Carts and carts rattle.
In conversations, time is falling towards night,
And there is no end to them overnight.

And nearby in the pit a skull is grinning,
An immense wasteland spreads out.
Here a savage walked with a club,
A caveman walked by.

Empty skull eye sockets
Immortelle heads are looking
And they fill the air with faces,
Shot that April.

Evil will be avenged, punished,
And to the relatives of the victims and widows
We are obliged to alleviate grief
Another new word.

We swear by all the Russian genius,
What to martyrs and heroes
Victory through spirituality
We will build an eternal monument.//Boris Pasternak, April 12, 1944 Funding for drones for our guys is here.

Analysts from the Israeli research center Alma have published new material in which they emphasize that the main threat posed by Iran and its proxies is precisely a combined and massive attack from a swarm of drones and missiles.

Israel has high-quality multi-level layered missile and air defense (illustration). Iran understands this very well, relying on the swarm as the main factor in breaking through this defense.

Already in 2021, Hezbollah had about 2,000 (according to Alma) different UAVs. That is, today this number is clearly higher, at least by hundreds more. Hezbollah now uses drones in a limited and targeted manner, saving their mass for a major war.

Israel has never before faced a scenario where it needs to counter swarms of drones in a combined attack along with missile strikes. It would be preferable for the army to view this scenario as the main threat.

It is known that Israeli weapons manufacturers such as Rafael, Elbit, General Robotics and others have already received orders for defense and counter-drone swarm equipment. We are talking about both electronic warfare equipment and classic anti-aircraft systems.@yigal_levin

New Boeing whistleblower: defects identified in the assembly of the 787 Dreamliner Former Boeing employee Sam Salehpour said that the company ignored safety problems during the production of the 787 Dreamliner and 777 aircraft. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) confirmed that an investigation into the matter is underway. The FAA said it "takes aviation safety seriously" and that it "will take appropriate action if any problems are discovered."

Boeing, in turn, said it was "aware of Mr. Salehpour's statements" and was "cooperating with the FAA in its investigation." The company also emphasized that it is “confident in the safety of its aircraft.”

New statements from secret and non-secret informants again call into question the safety of Boeing's aircraft assembly processes. Both the FAA and the manufacturer are under close public scrutiny. Experts will have to find out whether security problems were really ignored.

On April 10, 1716, Peter I approved the “Land Military Charter” - a military-legal document that formalized the creation of a regular army in Russia and determined the order of its life and activities.

The Military Regulations of Peter I consisted of three parts. The first reflected the structure of the organization of troops. The charter provided for the formation of a light corps (“corvolant”), as well as a reserve corps. Special chapters were devoted to the general (field) headquarters, quartermaster service, field service, camp organization, guards, inspections, organization of field hospitals, mail, etc. The rights and responsibilities of senior military ranks were specifically outlined.

The second part of the Charter was called “Military Article” and contained information about the norms of state and criminal law, the structure of military courts and the procedure for considering cases in them, as well as provisions relating to military discipline and internal service. The charter introduced the military oath and determined the procedure for its adoption.

The third part of the Charter - “On Exercising” - was devoted to combat service, military training and education, the rights and responsibilities of regimental ranks. Particular attention was paid to developing initiative among officers and soldiers in battle, instilling in them high patriotic feelings, military honor, and courage.

The “land military charter” of 1716, in terms of the richness of its content, significantly exceeded all the charters of Western European armies and had a noticeable influence on the development of Russian criminal law. Its provisions remained in effect without any significant changes until the end of the 19th century.

A schoolgirl in Chitesh was sent to a pre-trial detention center because of a post on a telegram channel and graffiti “Death to the regime!” The fact that the court arrested 17-year-old schoolgirl Lyubov Lizunova, accused of calls for terrorist and extremist activities, was written by the second person involved in the case, Alexander Snezhkov, from a pre-trial detention center in Omsk.

The teenagers were detained at the end of October 2022. According to investigators, Lizunova and Snezhkov painted graffiti with the words “Death to the regime!” in one of the garage cooperatives in Chita.

Investigators also suspect the schoolchildren of administering two Telegram channels about anti-war protests and animal protection, one of which allegedly contained a post approving the arson of military registration and enlistment offices.

A case was opened against the schoolchildren under three criminal articles: calls for terrorist activities and extremist activities, as well as vandalism motivated by political hatred.

Initially, the teenagers were under recognizance not to leave, but in January 2023, Snezhkov was sent to a pre-trial detention center, and Lizunova was placed under house arrest. Forwarded from: Inside Avia
11 February 2022, Pointe-à-Pitre (TFFR/PTP), Guadeloupe. The airfield, located on French territory in the islands of the southern Caribbean, has one runway 12/30 with a length of 3129 meters.

The crew of the Air France Airbus A320 requested a visual approach to Runway 12, received permission and began to carry it out. Weather conditions at that time: Report No. 1: Wind 130 degrees 6 with gusts up to 13 knots (direction varies from 100 to 160 degrees), NGO (cloud base) scattered - 1500 feet, significant - 2200 feet.

Report No. 2 (after 30 minutes): Wind 130 degrees 4 knots, minor low wind - 1800 feet, solid low low - 8000 feet. The plane's recorders recorded wind with a direction of 100 degrees and a speed of 25 knots at an altitude of 2000 feet. The equipment measuring NGO is installed at Runway 30, so the readings on Runway 12 may not be completely accurate. The pilot was piloted by the commander, the co-pilot controlled. Having reached an altitude of 2000 feet, the crew began to release the mechanization and landing gear; the autopilot and autothrottle were disabled. The plane performing the “box” began to take a landing course, but the crew lost visual contact with the runway. At that moment the plane was at an altitude of 1430 feet with a bank of 28 degrees. The controller, who cleared landing on runway 12, had the MSAW (minimum safe altitude warning) system activated, which he informed the pilots about, but they took it into account only the second time. The plane was 1 nautical mile south of the runway center line at distance 2 .5 nautical miles from the runway, and the crew decided to go around. The re-approach was carried out using the ILS system. The investigation revealed that the crew’s decision to perform a visual approach at night was justified:

– the desire to maintain your flying skills, shorten the trajectory and gain time;
– experience in performing such an approach at this airport.

The crew did not carefully study the weather reports, and by turning off the autothrottle, they created an additional burden for themselves. About the specifics of go-arounds#inside_crashes_and_incidents

🇸🇴Last Saturday, the Somali parliament, after two months of intense discussions, approved constitutional amendments paving the way for the transformation of the country's system of government from parliamentary to presidential. This is the first step of this kind since the adoption of Somalia's interim constitution in August 2012. The amendments, in particular, relate to extending the presidential term from 4 to 5 years, giving the president the power to appoint and dismiss the prime minister, as well as the formation of a committee specializing in border demarcation and elections, consisting of 18 members.

Although there are more than 80 parties registered with the National Electoral Commission, most of which are formed on a tribal basis, the amendments are aimed at the participation of all parties with just three, each of which would include several parties with different ideas and doctrines.

On March 22, President Hassan Sheikh Mahmoud expressed his strong desire to complete the country's constitution before the end of his current term in mid-May 2026 as part of his election promises.Arab Africa
