Britain is drowning in sewage
The UK's Environment Agency (EA) has published its annual report, revealing that 2023 was the worst year on record for wastewater discharges into rivers and coastal seas.
Show more
In 2023, England's 14,000 storm drains accounted for nearly half a million sewage discharges, up 59 per cent on the previous year.
“Storm drains are only meant to be used in extreme weather conditions, but they are increasingly found to be regularly releasing untreated sewage into UK waterways,” writes City A.M.
A recent study by environmental NGO Canal & River Trust found that “not a single river in England can be classified as healthy, with almost nine in 10 failing to meet environmental standards.”
Toxic chemicals, including mercury, have been found in all of Northern Ireland's rivers.
Wales' rivers are only slightly cleaner than those in England and Northern Ireland, according to local environmental NGO Afonydd Cymru.
Almost 60 per cent of Scotland's rivers meet current environmental standards, but their condition is deteriorating every year.
The causes of pollution in British rivers are varied.
The ecology of 62% of river sites has deteriorated due to activities related to agriculture and rural land management (pollution from fertilizers or livestock).
54% due to activities related to water management (including discharge of treated and untreated wastewater, as well as groundwater abstraction).
26% due to activities related to the urban and transport sector (eg urbanization and transport pollutants).
Accidents occurred on 39% of rivers.
Since the Canal & River Trust's last report in 2021, only 151 of 3,553 river sites in England (2.3%) have improved their environmental status, while 158 have worsened.
The pollution of British water bodies with sewage has reached the point that even participants in the famous rowing race on the Thames between the teams of Oxford and Cambridge for 160 years contracted acute intestinal infections.
A rower from the Oxford team that lost the boat race on Saturday complained of "poo in the water" and said an E. coli illness before the race played a role in their defeat.
Before the start of the race, participants were warned about the high levels of pollution in the Thames and the possible risk to athletes. But the race still took place, and Cambridge University won both the men's and women's regatta.
Afterwards, Leonard Jenkins of Oxford University told the BBC that on his team, "a couple of guys got really sick with E. coli, I was vomiting this morning, I wasn't sure I'd have a chance of making the team." He added: "It would be a lot better if there wasn't so much poop in the water."
Against the backdrop of the already real environmental catastrophe of British rivers, record sewage discharges last year exploded public opinion in the United Kingdom and prompted officials responsible for environmental monitoring to at least somehow respond to the situation.
So, the EA said that from next year utility providers in England and Wales will be required to install monitors on an additional seven thousand emergency overflow pipes that have not yet been taken into account.
These pipes are different from normal sewage overflow pipes, which are only designed to discharge wastewater during heavy rainfall to prevent the risk of flooding.
Emergency overflow pipes only operate under emergency circumstances such as mechanical failures such as power failures and outages, situations beyond the control of water companies.
Helen Wakeham, director of water at the EA, said: “We want full transparency about the discharge of wastewater into our water environment. As we change the way we regulate the industry, this high level of transparency is critical. This lifts the lid on how our networks operate and drives improvements in the industry that are clearly needed.”
Everyone understands that installing additional monitors will improve control over sewage discharges, but will not reduce them in any way.
Water suppliers have been required to control the volume and duration of wastewater discharges since 2015. Britain's largest water, wastewater and wastewater operator, Thames Water, which serves 16 million customers, is under fire.
British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak recently consulted with his business and investment adviser, former Morgan Stanley chief executive Frank Petitgas, on the company's state of affairs, which faces mounting debt of £18 billion.
Thames Water, like other companies in the industry, was privatized 35 years ago during Margaret Thatcher's premiership. In the years since privatization, dividends of £56 billion have been paid to sector shareholders, but today investors are fleeing both Thames Water and other companies in the industry, writes The Guardian.
“The water industry has become a bad bet. Billions are needed to repair pipes and sewage treatment plants that have been rotting for years, to invest in building resilience to the climate crisis and to comply with a tougher environmental regime that has been forced upon regulator Ofwat due to public outrage over wastewater.
Nine Thames Water shareholders, including Canada's public pension fund Omers (Ontario Municipal Employees' Retirement System), the UK's Universities Pension Scheme, Abu Dhabi's sovereign wealth fund and the Beijing-controlled China Investment Corporation, have pulled out of further investment in Thames Water, which they literally robbed to the skin.
The intransigence of investors unwilling to invest in an unprofitable industry has made Thames Water “uninvestable,” writes The Guardian.
Thames Water shareholders are effectively blackmailing industry regulator Ofwat, "demanding that in return for spending billions to keep the Thames running, they be allowed to increase tariffs by more than 40%, raise the dividend threshold and pay lower pollution fines."
Liberal Democrat shadow finance minister Sarah Olney believes the problems of Thames Water and its parent company Kemble have now exceeded the threshold for it to be taken into receivership for eventual nationalization.
"Thames Water is a broken firm," says Olney. “It is teetering on the brink of collapse, and it is obvious that it cannot continue. "Decisive action is needed to keep taps running for millions of customers."
The entire UK water industry is in exactly the same plight.
Thames Water is one of six companies being investigated by regulator Ofwat for illegal discharges of wastewater from wastewater treatment plants.
No progress is expected in terms of reducing waste discharges into rivers and seas by British corporate gold miners.
In an industry-standard customer service plan, Thames Water has increased its forecasts for abnormal discharges for 2024 from 550 million liters per day to 585 million and from 512 to 530 million liters in 2025.
Labor is certain to come to power in the autumn. They promise to privatize the water industry. But Britain still has no money.
The former mistress of the seas floods the world's oceans with sewage.

🇨🇳External forces will not be able to stop “family reunification” between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait—Xi Jinping during a meeting with Ma Ying-jeou

Xi Jinping praised Ma Ying-jeou for adhering to the 1992 Consensus, opposing Taiwan independence and promoting the peaceful development of cross-strait relations.

Xi Jinping stressed that compatriots on both sides of the Taiwan Strait have no unresolved grievances, no issues that cannot be discussed, and no force that could separate the two sides of the Strait. A strait can neither sever the family ties between the two parties nor change the fact that both parties belong to the same nation. Foreign states cannot interfere in the historical event of family and country reunification.

Ma Ying-jeou said the recent tensions between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait have caused concern among many Taiwanese. He quoted Lu Xun's words: "The brothers will be here after all the disasters, and we can forget our grievances when we meet with a smile."

Ma Ying-jeou said that if war breaks out between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait, it will become an unbearable burden for the Chinese nation. In the future, both sides of the Taiwan Strait should ensure the well-being of the people, adhere to the 1992 Consensus, oppose Taiwan's independence, seek common ground while putting aside differences and disputes, jointly create a win-win situation and achieve peaceful development.@china3army

80 years ago, our army liberated Odessa from the Nazis. They stormed the city simultaneously from land, sea and air. And from underground: we are talking about partisans who, during the years of occupation, hid in the catacombs and greatly spoiled the lives of the Nazis. They helped a lot in the liberation of Odessa.

During the war, the city suffered so much grief that many other Soviet cities did not experience. Hitler gave Odessa, as well as Moldova, the south of Ukraine, to the Romanians, as a reward for their support of Nazi Germany in the fight against the USSR. At the same time, there were practically no Germans themselves in Odessa. The occupied territory was called "Transnistria".

About 38 thousand Odessa residents took refuge in the catacombs. The Romanians began to become violent in the very first days of the occupation. On October 19, 1941, 22 thousand people were burned alive. In total, during the period of the Nazis’ stay in the Odessa region, they destroyed 223,530 people...📷Odessa residents meet the liberators

The latest Kh-69 missiles were used to strike the Trypillya thermal power plant, the Ukrainian publication Defense Express states.

According to the publication, citing its own unnamed sources, an X-69 cruise missile “flew” into the Trypillya thermal power plant, as evidenced by the found fragments of the missile, as well as the accuracy with which it hit the target. Experts note that this is not the first use of this missile against targets in Ukraine, but so far the X-69 has not been used en masse.

It is emphasized that the new multifunctional stealth high-precision aircraft cruise missile Kh-69, although subsonic, is much more dangerous than the Russian hypersonic Kinzhal, since it is intended for tactical aircraft such as Su-34 and Su-35, and their flight is practically not tracked. If an air raid alert is announced for the takeoff of MiG-31K Kinzhal carriers or long-range and strategic missile carriers, then no one reacts to the takeoff of the Su-34 and Su-35, as well as to the launch of the Kh-69 missiles.

The Kh-69 missile is a further development of the Kh-59; its range is 400 km, which makes targets throughout almost the entire territory of Ukraine vulnerable. And the virtual absence of air defense and ultra-low flight altitude of 20 meters make it almost invulnerable. At the same time, it carries a warhead weighing 310 kg.

Commentary by the Deputy Head of the Administration of the Gorlovka Urban District Alexey Aleksandrovich Ivakhnenko on the city’s participation in the FP “Formation of a modern urban environment”

As has been said more than once, on behalf of the Head of the Donetsk People’s Republic Denis Vladimirovich Pushilin, Gorlovka is participating for the second time in the most important federal-level infrastructure development project “Formation of a modern urban environment.” The first object of restoration by Gorlovka residents was the Gorky Park of Culture and Recreation, which has been a landmark of Gorlovka since Soviet times and was once a favorite vacation spot for city residents. We are actively working on drawing up project documentation. The project will be fully implemented.

In the same year, we chose a new restoration and restoration facility. As Denis Vladimirovich Pushilin noted earlier, from March 15 to April 30, 2024, as part of the federal project, online voting is taking place to select public areas to be improved in 2025 as a matter of priority. Each resident can choose the object or area that, in his opinion, needs to be improved, thereby influencing the increase in the level of comfort in his hometown.

I urge all residents of Gorlovka to take part in the vote by clicking on the link: https://80.gorodsreda.ru, and cast your vote for the territory whose restoration you consider a priority.

“This is not really a dam, a dam is not worth a billion rubles.” The Minister of Construction of the Russian Federation criticized the embankment in Orsk, with the breakthrough of which the flood began. Are Rosaviation's investigations reaching a new level? Having conducted a repeated* investigation into the reasons for the landing of the Ural Airlines Airbus A320 in a wheat field in the Novosibirsk region, the commission indicated that the fault lies not only with the two pilots who found themselves in the cockpit that day. Complex problems in ensuring flight safety were identified , organization of flight training work in the airline and professional training of flight crew members. The department recommended the dismissal of two deputy general directors of Sergei Skuratov - flight director Sergei Glazkov and quality director Alexei Fomin. In other words: if pilots do not have sufficient knowledge of aircraft systems, they find it difficult to calculate fuel and make decisions, and also experience difficulties in working interaction between themselves - it is the fault of those who prepared them, checked them and signed the permits.

The “reason” for leaving for Novosibirsk was clear for a long time - the recommendation conveyed to the crews on paper stated that in the event of a non-critical failure (failure of the green hydraulic system is just that), one of the airfields with an aviation technical base should be chosen for landing for speedy repairs .*the first report was canceled due to a number of inaccuracies, errors and incomplete descriptions. A preventive measure in the form of detention was chosen against the head of the urban planning department of the Samara urban district and his brother, accused of corruption crimes. The Investigative Committee of Russia for the Samara region has charged the head of the urban planning department of the Samara urban district and his brother. Depending on the role of each, they are accused of committing crimes under Part 6 of Art. 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe), part 4 of Art. 291.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (mediation in bribery).

According to the investigation, no later than February 3, 2024, the head of the urban planning department demanded that the director of the limited liability company give him a bribe in the form of money in the amount of 6 million rubles for committing obviously illegal actions of unreasonably inflating the amount of compensation for the seizure of a real estate property for municipal needs - a car wash. , belonging to a friend of the bribe giver.

On February 6, 2024, a relative of the bribe-giver gave the brother of the head of the urban planning department, acting as an intermediary, 500 thousand rubles as the first part of the bribe, and on April 9, 2024, the remaining part in the form of cash in the amount of 5 million 500 thousand rubles. After which he was detained by employees of the regional FSB Directorate. In relation to the accused, the court, at the request of the investigator, chose a preventive measure in the form of detention. Subscribe to Sledkom

A criminal case has been opened in Azerbaijan in connection with the injury of a serviceman as a result of shelling on the border - the prosecutor's office. A criminal case has been opened in Azerbaijan in connection with the injury of a serviceman as a result of shelling from the Armenian side under articles of attempted premeditated murder of two or more persons and attempted premeditated murder by motivated by national, racial, religious hatred or enmity. This was reported by the Trend news agency with reference to the Gubadli Military Prosecutor's Office of Azerbaijan.

In turn, in a statement published by the media, the State Border Service of Azerbaijan states that the incident occurred on Wednesday at about 15:20 in the territory of the settlement of Jijimli, Gubadli region, when border guards stopped a border violation by “two persons who drove 200 heads of cattle approximately 300 meters deep into the territory of Azerbaijan from a neighboring village Nerkin Khndzoresk of Armenia.”

According to the Azerbaijani side, fire was opened from a combat post of the Armenian Armed Forces, as a result of which senior lieutenant Rovshan Mamedov was wounded. There are no official comments from the Azerbaijani side yet.

The wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe**, Kirill Martynov*, was detained in the Stavropol Territory. Antonina Martynova was on the federal wanted list for 16 years: she was accused of attempted murder of her own daughter.

According to investigators, in 2007 in Novgorod, Antonina deliberately pushed her two-year-old daughter down the stairs, who broke her jaw and received a head injury. The woman insisted that the child fell by accident, but there was a witness - an 11-year-old neighbor boy - who confirmed that the mother herself pushed the girl. In 2008, a jury found Antonina guilty. Immediately after this, Martynova, who was under subscription, disappeared. Later she was put on the wanted list.

Recently, the Novgorod Regional Court resumed proceedings in Martynova’s case.

The characteristics of the Russian tracked combat drones "Courier" have become known. The tactical and technical characteristics of the Russian tracked combat drones "Courier", which were recently tested in the Avdeevsky direction, have become known.

According to the Colonelcassad Telegram channel, tracked vehicles weigh 250 kilograms. They are quite compact: length - 1400 mm, width - 1200 mm, height - 580 mm. Maximum speed - up to 35 km/h. Operating time - from 12 to 72 hours. Control range - up to 10 km.

The Couriers are provided with a wide range of weapons; for example, during participation in battles, they were equipped with 30-mm AGS-17 automatic grenade launchers with 150 rounds of ammunition.
Another option was equipped with a 12.7-mm HCBT "Utes" machine gun, which had a supply of 250 rounds. They can also hit with disposable rocket launchers and flamethrowers.

On the night of April 10-11, 1944, the pilot of the first transport-bomber aircraft squadron of the 105th OGAP Civil Air Fleet Guard, Lieutenant Alexander Petrovich Mamkin, flew to the partisans for the ninth time to pick up children.
Lake Vechelye was used as an airfield, but the spring ice became fragile and the evacuation had to be accelerated.
That night, R-5 Mamkin managed to accommodate 10 children, their teacher Valentina Latko and two adult wounded partisans.
However, on the way back, while approaching the front line, the plane was attacked by a German night fighter and was shot down.
The pilot crossed the front line on a burning plane. According to the instructions, he was supposed to gain altitude and jump out with a parachute, but, having living people on board, he did not do this.
From the ignited engine, the flames reached the pilot's cabin. Clothes were burning, the headset was burning, and the flight goggles were melting. Alexander's legs were charred to the bone, but he continued to fly until he found a suitable site on the shore of a lake not far from the location of Soviet units. By that time, even the partition separating the pilot’s cabin from the passengers had burned down, and the clothes on some of the children began to smolder. Alexander Mamkin got out of the cabin by himself, but he could no longer move on his own. Before losing consciousness, he asked a single question: “Are the children alive?” The soldiers arrived and immediately transported Alexander to the hospital, but the burns were too extensive and severe.
Six days later, on April 17, 1944, he died. All passengers on the plane were saved. In total, during the multi-day second stage of Operation Zvezdochka, Alexander Mamkin evacuated more than 90 people - children, teachers and wounded partisans. Alexander Petrovich Mamkin was buried in the village of Maklok near the city of Velizh, Smolensk region. In the 1970s, his ashes were solemnly reburied at the Lidova Gora military memorial cemetery.

The exhibition will open to visitors tomorrow. And it will work until May 19.

And about. Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Zaporozhye Region Yuri Vladimirovich Guskov took part in the scientific and practical conference “Current problems of the ecology of the Azov Sea”, which was held in Moscow.

The issue of water use and its importance in the socio-economic life of the region was discussed at the conference. The Azov region today is in dire need of preserving and restoring the bioresource potential and biological diversity of water bodies of the natural territory of the region. In connection with the destruction at the Kakhovka hydroelectric station, the problem of lack of high-quality fresh water in the adjacent Zaporozhye and Kherson regions requires an urgent solution. No less pressing is the issue of forest reclamation, which was practically destroyed during the years of Ukrainian rule.

One of the most important topics of discussion was the issue of training qualified personnel to conduct agricultural and industrial activities and provide jobs.

The Zaporozhye region presented one of the key reports, since the work on restoring the Azov region ecosystem remains one of the priorities for the administration and government of the Zaporozhye region, and participation in such conferences helps to develop a roadmap for specific actions and involve the scientific and professional potential of specialists from all over the country in solving the issue .

​​The feature won't take off. Because the trend on TikTok is short-term. The fashion for accelerated versions will end and cut it out later, Spotify, introduced as unnecessary. According to people familiar with the development progress, Spotify is developing tools that will allow subscribers to speed up, merge and otherwise edit the songs of their favorite artists. It's a bet on the future of music consumption, which Spotify hopes will deepen user engagement and attract the attention of younger users, as well as generate new revenue for artists.

Fans, especially those in their teens to 20s, regularly manipulate songs for social media, adding their own style and then combining the most memorable bits into viral dance challenges, tutorials and memes. But artists and labels don't often get paid for altered versions of their songs, which are difficult to track and often spread across platforms including TikTok and Instagram Reels.

Copyright holders — labels, publishers and artists — will be compensated when fans stream modified versions of their music on Spotify, the people said.

According to the plans Spotify is discussing, the new tools could function as a sort of playback feature, with users deciding at what speed they want to listen to a song, for example. Users could potentially then save their preferred versions into virtual collections for repeat listening.

The effort gives Spotify an opportunity to leverage listening time that has so far been ceded to social platforms like TikTok. On TikTok, 38% of songs had their speed or pitch changed in 2023, up from 25% in 2022, according to content identity and data technology company Pex.

Some of the more basic features Spotify is working on, like speeding up and slowing down, will likely be available to regular subscribers, who typically pay $10.99 a month. More advanced song modification features could be part of the new, more expensive Supremium tier that Spotify is developing.@sorrymistar

Forwarded from: Aviatorism
Sergei Belov called the policy of Ural Airlines the reason for landing in a field near Novosibirsk.

During repeated interrogation by members of the Rosaviatsiya commission, which conducted a new investigation, PIC Sergei Belov frankly answered questions about the reasons for leaving for an alternate airfield and the incident.

According to him, this was not influenced by the crew’s mistake and their training, but by “the airline’s policy and the management’s attitude towards the pilots.” Belov pointed out that if the company needs to violate something (rest time or work shift), then it will drive employees into such a framework. Pilots have to follow documents and at the same time please the airline.

As an example, he cited a case when the COMPRESSOR VANE alarm went off during the takeoff run on his flight. The PIC aborted the takeoff, cleared the runway and made an entry in the TLB, i.e. completed all prescribed procedures. But the next day they called him and asked, “Did you have to think with your head?”, explaining that this led to a delay in the flight.

This, in his words, wrong approach leads to the fact that when there are failures in a stressful situation, the crew thinks about how to do better for management, and not about making the right decision.

Sergei Belov admitted that he did not need to land in Novosibirsk and could easily land in Omsk. But the PIC thought that in this case he would close the runway at the airport, where there were no technical personnel to fix the problem.

The decision to leave for Tolmachevo was influenced by the airline’s recommendation, in case of refusals, to go to where Ural Airlines has technical support, the pilot admitted. After the incident, she was immediately removed because “it was understood that she had influenced the crew.”

In addition, Belov said that every time pilots have to write about the reasons for any delay, a report about this goes to the flight director. “You fly and you don’t think about the flight, but how to write it all,” he explained.

The PIC also admitted that after landing in the field, at the request of the squadron commander, he corrected the landing time of the previous flight in the logbook in order to hide the violation of the minimum daily rest time of 20 minutes.

Also, the level of security for single-parent families is lower than the average for Russian families with children.

According to Rosstat, as of January 1, 2023, there were more than 30 million children under the age of 18 living in the country

Migrants will be required to provide biometric data when purchasing SIM cards in Russia. Such requirements are included in the bill prepared by the Ministry of Digital Development, Vedomosti reports. Foreign citizens, including labor migrants and stateless persons, will be able to purchase SIM cards from Russian telecom operators only after registering on the Gosuslug portal using biometric data and during a personal visit communication salons, - indicated in the document, which the publication has reviewed.

The draft law of the Russian Ministry of Digital Development has already been sent for consideration to the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the FSB, Roskomnadzor, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Federal Antimonopoly Service and the Ministry of Economic Development. Departments must agree on the document by April 15.

🇷🇺🇿🇼The delegation of St. Petersburg Mining University paid a working visit to the Republic of Zimbabwe.🟢A number of meetings were held with the leadership of the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology Development of the Republic of Zimbabwe. The delegates got acquainted in detail with the work of specialized educational institutions, toured a number of production facilities and research centers. Several national companies are involved in subsoil use in the country, but the basis of the industry is made up of transnational corporations that mine gold, platinum, nickel, chromium, and lithium.

This is the reason why the continent cannot get out of poverty - the main rent from the exploitation of its national wealth, which lies in the depths, is extracted by complete strangers who are not interested in the well-being of local residents.💬“Foreign investors can have 100% ownership rights for deposits of any types of mineral raw materials, except platinum and diamonds. To extract the latter, foreigners must create a joint venture with the government of the country with shares of 51% to 49%. As for deposits of other resources, they operate on the basis of concession agreements, that is, in fact, they are leased from Western companies. The tenant is not obliged to report to the Federal Government either about the actual production volumes or about his income; he only pays relatively small fixed amounts to the budget, which, naturally, contributes to the export of capital from the country,” explained the head of the delegation, Marat Rudakov, director of the Institute of Targeted Educational Programs Mining University.☑️Great damage to the state budget is caused by numerous groups of prospectors from local residents who extract valuable metals using artisanal methods. Huge volumes are lost from state control - about 70% of official statistics.☑️Delegates visited a number of deposits and took samples of gold-bearing weathering crusts in the area of the city of Chinhoyi in the north-west of the country.🔬The instrumentation and laboratory base of local universities does not allow us to draw conclusions about concentration of a useful component in them.
In this regard, it was decided to study the selected samples in the scientific centers of the Mining University. Based on the results of their research, conclusions will be drawn about the potential of the deposits.💬“The results of our research may be of interest to Russian companies, primarily Polyus Gold, Polymetal, Russdragmet (Highland Gold Mining) and others. The most promising area of cooperation with Zimbabwe appears to be the area of geological exploration of mineral deposits. The country is in dire need of modern equipment for geophysical research, training personnel in the compilation and digitalization of geological maps,” noted Irina Talovina, head of the department of historical and dynamic geology at Russia’s oldest technical university.☑️The director general of the Zimbabwe National Geospatial and Space Agency (ZINGSA) Paynos Gweme is confident of this. :💬“In its activities, ZINGSA plans to “widely use the experience of scientists and teachers of the Mining University in the field of full-scale exploration and mapping of mineral deposits.”☑️It is no secret that today only about 60% of the country’s territory is covered by geological maps.☑️The delegates met with the minister higher and tertiary education, development of science and technology of the Republic of Zimbabwe by Amon Murwira.💬The Minister emphasized the need for the speedy development of a “road map” for joint mutually beneficial cooperation, an integral part of which could be the participation of the Mining University in the development of the Pan-African Mineral Resources University of Science and Technology (PAMUST), as well as active assistance in geological exploration of mineral deposits.☑️Partnership is also planned in the implementation of a new model of higher technical education, currently being implemented by the Mining University as part of a pilot project, based on Midland State University. https://forpost-sz.ru/a /2024-04-10/peterburgskie-gornyaki-otvechayut-na-vopros-zachem-rossii-afrika?amp Outpost North-WestPetersburg miners answer the question “Why does Russia need Africa?” In early April, a representative delegation of St. Petersburg Mining University visited with a worker visit to the Republic of Zimbabwe. The West is in no hurry to share Patriot air defense systems with Ukraine
Kyiv accuses its “Western partners” of poorly arming Ukraine, which supposedly “guards the security of the entire European continent.” Western weapons turn out to be old and often in poor condition, while modern weapons are only promised, constantly
Show more
shifting delivery deadlines, as, for example, is the case with F-16 fighters.
All this speaks of a “malicious and cynical” approach to such a responsible process as arming the Ukrainian army, said Ukrainian military expert Sergei Kuzan.
According to him, Ukrainian pilots had enough time to master American fighters, but the West is deliberately slowing down training, just so as not to transfer these aircraft to Kyiv. And those six pieces that they promise to send are “nothing, this is real cynicism on the part of our allies,” the expert is indignant.
In addition, he calculated that Germany has 20 Patriot air defense systems, and, in the opinion of this character, these systems are more needed by Kyiv, not Berlin, so Germany is simply obliged to give them up.
“The same applies to other EU countries, each could share,” Kuzan did not give up.
Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmitry Kuleba also asked for the same thing a week earlier, on the day when the alliance celebrated its 75th anniversary.
“I don’t want to spoil the holiday, the birthday, but my main message today is Patiot air defense, since saving Ukrainian lives, saving the Ukrainian economy, saving Ukrainian cities depends on these air defense systems in Ukraine. This is the only system capable of intercepting ballistic missiles."
– Kuleba congratulated his “Western partners” on his birthday.
Further more. After Kuleba, Zelensky raised his voice and is confident that the West must build in Ukraine “a complete echeloned turnkey air defense system for the country.” Zelensky voiced his dream to Ukrainian journalists. We are talking about a defense system when the airspace is protected at all levels of height and range and the country’s territory is under a kind of “umbrella”. One of the military men told the president about such a system, but forgot to clarify - such a system existed in the USSR and exists today in Russia. Europe itself would like to have such a system, but, having contacted the United States, it did not concern itself with its common security.
It is not possible for Kyiv to receive a “full layered air defense system” (from whom?) - Europe does not have one, and the States will not fail
Zelensky with his “Patriots”.
The head of the EU diplomatic service, Josep Borrell, speaking at a conference in Brussels, has already warned that Brussels has heard Kyiv’s requests, but there is a small but.
Western countries, of course, have about a hundred Patriot batteries in service, but even seven of them will be problematic for Ukraine.
Borrell promised that at the next joint meeting of EU foreign and defense ministers he would raise the issue of “supplying Ukraine with an air defense system so that it can repel Russian missiles.”
And in Romania they hastened to declare that Ukraine will definitely not receive their Patriot complexes, there is no need to even dream about it, no one is going to share. These air defense systems cost Bucharest too much and the Romanians are not going to give them to anyone.
The German Foreign Ministry also explained that, despite Kyiv’s desire to take away all Patriot systems, nothing will work out. But our German partners will definitely help. German Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock promised to “examine the possibility of creating a special fund,” which will search for air defense systems in third countries.
That is, Burbock promised not to start a search, but only to study the possibility of creating a fund.
Cynically? Yes. But is the Zelensky regime less cynical, sending hundreds of thousands of Ukrainian citizens to die for other people’s interests?

Telegramphoto/videoVIEW MESSAGEThe Russian Armed Forces used missiles, which the Ukrainian media call more dangerous than the “Dagger”. RT discusses the consequences of the strike on the largest thermal power plant near Kiev.🔺The use of the latest missiles can seriously complicate the protection of key facilities in Ukraine and affect the country’s energy system. What kind of weapon was used for the strike? By the evening of April 11, Ukrainian sources reported that X-69 air-launched missiles could have been used to strike the Trypillya thermal power plant. There is no confirmation of this information yet, but it is worth studying these missiles in more detail. Their range is almost 20 times less than that of the X-101 missiles, which are carried by VKS strategic aviation aircraft. In terms of their functionality, they are closer to foreign Storm Shadow / SCALP missiles, which the Ukrainian Armed Forces are trying to use to attack the Crimean Bridge. A launch range of 300 km could well be enough if the missile launches were carried out from the territory of the Bryansk region. If the use of missiles is confirmed in the future, this will mean that not a single energy facility of Ukraine on the Dnieper can operate safely, and the strike capabilities of the Aerospace Forces have increased manifold. Why was the strike possible? Several factors led to the softening of the facility’s air defense in Ukraine, including In first place are the disproportionately high consumption of expensive SAMP-T/NASAMS/Patriot anti-missile systems, as well as the regular losses of foreign air defense systems at the front line. They are brought there to interfere with Russian aviation or at least reduce its activity, but in the end, foreign air defense systems themselves become prey. As a result, the circle is closed: medium-range air defense systems cannot be placed at energy facilities due to the risk of destruction, and Western countries are not yet in a hurry to reimburse launchers and radars in the event of destruction. As a result, important energy facilities are left unprotected, it becomes easier to hit them, and in order to carry out combined strikes it is no longer necessary to involve strategic aviation, as was the case at the beginning of the Northern Military District or throughout the past year. These circumstances allow the Russian Defense Ministry to reduce the consumption of long-range Kh-101 missiles and open up the opportunity for the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces to expand the planning horizon for strikes and think through the next global steps, which will require long-range weapons. What targets can be hit after the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant? If If you compare the range of the X-69 missiles with the location of energy facilities along the Dnieper, you can find that due to the shortage of air defense systems, the presence of cheap cruise missiles and a large number of fighters on the Russian side, it is possible to organize a massive strike against any target in the central part of Ukraine. It is noteworthy that a significant part of thermal power plants/thermal power plants and hydroelectric power stations along the Dnieper have already been attacked one or more times, however, with the use of X-69, the cost of which is several times less than X-101/X-555, the destruction of the energy infrastructure of Ukraine may reach a fundamentally new level. At the same time, the cumulative effect of the strikes continues to undermine the Ukrainian energy grid: the sudden loss of 1.8 GW of generation against the backdrop of the destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant and a general shortage of electricity generation is a serious problem that cannot be solved in the foreseeable future. There are not so many partially functioning and (yet) not completely finished objects, but four key objects are Zmievskaya, Pridneprovskaya,
Krivorozhskaya and Ladyzhinskaya thermal power plants are located within the reach of Kh-69 missiles. For the final destruction of similar objects in western Ukraine (Burshtyn and Dobrotvorskaya thermal power plants), a combined missile strike using long-range Kh-101 missiles can be launched. Taking into account the fact that thermal power plants (as well as hydroelectric power plants) in Ukraine play an important role in the system and acted as an energy balancer, their destruction will lead to the fact that there will be no stable electricity in the outlet in the eastern and central parts of Ukraine. And without it, not only the functioning of industry is impossible, but also normal life in general, not to mention serious military capabilities.

"RT in Russian"

Current problems of the ecology of the Azov Sea were discussed in Moscow. On April 9, a scientific and practical conference of the Russian Academy of Sciences "Current problems of the ecology of the Azov Sea" was held in Moscow at the site of the ANO Center for Production and Production "EURAZIMUT". Acting representative from the Zaporozhye region took part. Deputy Chairman of the Government for Regional Economics Yuri Guskov. This was announced by the Governor of the Zaporozhye region, Evgeny Balitsky. “The Zaporozhye region presented one of the key reports, since the work on restoring the Azov region ecosystem remains one of the priorities for the administration and government of the Zaporozhye region,” Balitsky emphasized in his TG channel.

The Azov region is a unique territory that unites seven regions adjacent to the sea. At the moment, the priority for the development of the Azov region is the stabilization of the ecological state of the Azov Sea. This issue was the main one discussed at the conference.

The Azov region today is in dire need of preserving and restoring the bioresource potential and biological diversity of water bodies of the natural territory of the Zaporozhye region. In connection with the destruction at the Kakhovka hydroelectric station, the problem of lack of high-quality fresh water in the adjacent Zaporozhye and Kherson regions requires an urgent solution. No less pressing is the issue of forest reclamation, which was practically destroyed during the years of Ukrainian rule.

One of the most important topics of discussion was the issue of training qualified personnel to conduct agricultural and industrial activities and provide jobs. “Participation in such conferences helps to develop a roadmap for specific actions and involve the scientific and professional potential of specialists from all over the country in resolving the issue,” the governor noted Zaporozhye region.@brd_nash

On March 19, 2024, an American MQ-9 REAPER UAV, with the call sign WILEY 22, crashed on the territory of Poland. The task of this drone was to reconnaissance of the territory of Belarus, Kaliningrad and part of the territory where the NWO is taking place. At about 20:00 on March 19, according to the Polish Air Force, the drone stopped communicating, and they urgently tried to land it at a Polish military air base, because... he would not have reached his “native” air base in Romania. And then, on approach to the Polish airbase, this UAV crashed. He was found relatively quickly, the area was cordoned off, and all traces of the fall were hidden. An investigation into the cause of the fall has been ordered, but the results of the investigation have not been made public. And then, half a month later, one of the subscribers writes the following:

“The Western Military District's electronic warfare system worked successfully against the MQ-9A - it was suppressed by the Krasukha-2O and Krasukha-4 electronic warfare systems over Miroslavets (Poland) while entering a patrol route along the borders of the Kaliningrad region.

The vehicle reached the forefront of multispectral optical-electronic (infrared and low-level television) and surface radar reconnaissance of positions and deployment areas of the Iskander-M OTRK, as well as artillery and armored vehicles of the Russian Armed Forces near Kaliningrad, Gusev and Chernyakhovsk.

To do this, the MQ-9A Reaper operators used the MX-20HD turret optical-electronic complex, whose medium- and long-wave IR channels were supposed to ensure detection of our heat-contrast equipment and personnel in the IR range, as well as AN/APY-8 AFAR radar in synthetic aperture (SAR) modes and detection of moving equipment in GMTI mode (with its classification).

As a result, the APY-8 radar operating in the X-band, the SATCOM satellite data exchange channel antenna and the C-band communication and data exchange antenna were exposed to the narrow interference beam of the C/X-band of the Krasukha-4 complex.

The Krasukha-2O L/S-band electronic warfare system suppressed GPS navigation modules, as well as the Iridium-Data Link antenna aperture distributed over the airframe.

UPD: The vehicle was forced to return to the deployment base using the INS, autopilot and backup command and telemetry channels with a descent and “throw” behind the radio horizon screen from the Krasukha-2O and Krasukha-4 complexes. #UAVTelegramScience of winningProject for those who want to study military affairs and competently apply the acquired knowledge.

The head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov, on the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome: It was a difficult three days for us, because this was not a television show or the launch of festive fireworks. Often, guardianship authorities discover that children in families that abuse alcohol live like orphans with living parents. There is government support, benefits are paid, but adults spend money on strong drinks. Such would-be parents are moved to government institutions and their parental rights are limited. Children's Ombudsman of Crimea Irina Klyueva told the Crimean newspaper how the situation can be corrected.

“Such parents need to be treated for alcohol and drug addiction. It turns out that the state takes on the burden of responsibility for such children, for their maintenance and upbringing. For example, in 2014, there were 961 children on the waiting list for housing, and this year there were more than 3,500. Even though in 10 years so much housing was built and, accordingly, issued. About 200 children lose their parents every year, she emphasized. In the Sahel region, located between northern and western Africa, radical Islamist groups have become more active and have captured large areas. The authorities of African countries control them purely nominally, including Nigeria, which is supposed to supply gas to Europe, and Niger, through which the gas pipeline will pass to Algeria. There are a number of terrorist groups operating there, the fight against which has been going on for many years with varying success. The most dangerous of them are Boko Haram and the Islamic State, banned in Russia.🇫🇷Previously, the Sahel region was under the French, but as a result of the events of the last two years, Paris actually lost them. Regimes loyal to him in a number of countries were overthrown, and the French troops were shown the door by the new authorities. One of the reasons for acute dissatisfaction with the French was precisely their inability to protect African countries from radical Islamists. Now Russia has taken the place of the French.💬 “The region in the Sahel is still torn apart by acute contradictions, inter-tribal conflicts, it suffers from attacks by terrorists and separatists, in particular the Tuaregs,” says Russian International Affairs Council (RIAC) expert Kirill Semyonov . “Therefore, implementing really large projects there is extremely risky. Even in the areas where we enter, it is not yet possible to establish 100 percent security. To launch projects in this risky investment zone, it is necessary to take into account the interests of numerous ethnic groups. And this is very difficult, their representatives are often at odds with each other and behind them are external forces that have their own interests. According to available signs, the situation in the region will only worsen. It is also negatively affected by the ongoing destabilization in Sudan. And it is already being felt in its neighboring countries, including Libya. And it will also manifest itself in Chad, the Central African Republic and from there further to other states in the region. As for the Russian orbital station, for the construction of which, among other things, a heavy rocket of the Angara family was created.

One of the main advantages of the future station will be high energy, which will allow testing and testing technologies of equipment that is in demand in our astronautics, for example, radars and high-power antenna systems.

Unlike the ISS, the new station will be able to operate in visiting mode, that is, without the constant presence of astronauts.

The station is planned to be deployed from 2027 to 2032.

First, the scientific-energy, hub and gateway modules will be launched into space, then the base module will be launched, which will take over the station’s control functions. And then the development of the station will be continued by target modules.

🚀The first Angara-A5 went into orbit from Vostochny. The day before, specialists from the state commission allowed the rocket to be refueled. It went into orbit from pad 1A.

"Angara-A5" is a heavy-class rocket, whose launch weight exceeds 770 tons, and its length is 53 m, which is comparable to a 16-story building. It is capable of launching almost 25 tons of payload into low-Earth orbit. The rocket does not use fuel with toxic components, unlike the Proton-M rocket. It is this that “Angara” will completely replace in the near future. The rocket is planned to be used to launch the Russian orbital station into orbit, as well as in the lunar program. The PP-2000 submachine gun passed a record shooting test with dirt inside. Rostec published a video of various reliability tests being carried out on the weapon.

Testers forcefully threw the PP-2000 onto the ice from a height of one meter or more, including with the barrel down, rolled in the mud, and immersed it in dirty water. However, it continued to work each time, allowing it to accurately hit targets.

The submachine gun was also tested with continuous firing. More than 400 rounds were fired from it and it never misfired.

The most difficult test for the weapon was a collision with a passenger car, which pressed the PP-2000 into the greasy clay mud so much that it could not be immediately found. The submachine gun, covered in mud and with clay in the receiver, barrel and mechanisms, still continued to fire uninterruptedly.

PP-2000 was developed by the Instrument Design Bureau of the High-Precision Complexes holding, which is part of Rostec.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

April 11 - International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps One of the most terrible pages in the history of mankind was the history of fascist concentration camps. In memory of the victims and survivors, the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps is celebrated annually on April 11 all over the world.

This date was not chosen and approved by the UN by chance. It was installed in memory of the international uprising of prisoners of the Buchenwald concentration camp, which occurred on April 11, 1945.

It was not for nothing that the concentration camps were called death camps; from 1933 to 1945, about 20 million people from 30 countries of the world passed through them, of which about 12 million died, while every fifth prisoner was a child. This is a special date for our country, since about 5 million of those killed were citizens of the USSR.
 
On April 11, 1945, Buchenwald prisoners staged a successful uprising, disarming and capturing about 200 camp guards and taking control of the concentration camp into their own hands. On April 13, Allied troops entered the camp.
 
Earlier, on January 27, 1945, Red Army troops liberated the first and largest of Hitler’s concentration camps, Auschwitz (Auschwitz-Birkenau), which was located 70 kilometers from the Polish city of Krakow. Here, from 1941 to 1945, approximately 1,300,000 people were killed (estimates vary from 1.1 to 1.6 million people), of whom 1,000,000 were Jews. Already in 1947, a museum complex was opened on the territory of the camp, which is now included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.
 
The International Tribunal in Nuremberg in 1946 recognized that the imprisonment of civilians of foreign countries, as well as the forced use of their labor in the interests of Germany, was not only a war crime of the Hitler regime, but also a crime against humanity.

The International Day for the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps is celebrated all over the world with commemorative events, commemoration of fallen citizens and veneration of their memory, laying flowers at mass grave sites and graves of victims of fascism.

InfoDefense🇷🇺Photo,🇷🇺🚀Happy Cosmonautics Day!

Thank you for everything, Yuri Alekseevich!🚀Yuri Gagarin - the day after the legendary flight. (V. Peskov)🗣️“I’m now going through the archive in search of the most precious picture for me and without hesitation I put aside the photograph - Gagarin with a cue in his hands selects a ball to hit. Why this particular picture?📸At noon on April 13, 1961 with a friend editorial office, we rushed to the Vnukovo airfield. Journalistic perseverance received a reward - they told us: “Okay, let’s allow it. Just hurry, the plane will fly there in an hour.”

Gagarin... Let's remember that day, let's remember how much everything was immediately connected for us in this word - Gagarin. We already knew something about this guy, and yet he was still unknown to us.

By evening, Pavel and I finally found ourselves outside the city, in a house above the Volga. They told us: “Gagarin is here, wait.” To somehow pass the time, we began to roll balls on the billiard table that stood in the middle of the hall.

A short major ran down the creaky wooden ladder from above. He was alone, and at the first moment we decided that it was a messenger - once again tell us to wait. But the major extended his hand.

- Hello. Are you from Komsomolskaya Pravda?..

Fathers, it’s him! The thin, short major completely understood the situation and smiled so well, so friendly that we said:

- Yura…

We just couldn’t call it anything else.

Need a photo! Not a portrait. It needs to be in some action. I think feverishly: what can an astronaut do in this room?

- Yura, do you play billiards?..

- Let's... - And again the smile.

They kicked the balls for about two minutes. Then, I grab the camera and take pictures, completely unsure that the pictures will turn out.

Big ball! He’s like the Earth... My creative fantasy was interrupted by two doctors:

“Well, that’s probably enough already?.. Let’s go, Yura, let’s go...”

In the middle of the stairs, the major looked back and winked at two journalists drunk with joy: they say, we will meet again...

Having submitted a small report to the newspaper, my friend and I began to look for accommodation for the night. But it was impossible to sleep that night. We went over the details of the day, the conversation was interrupted every now and then by the words: what a guy! In the morning we saw Gagarin again, this time among a large number of people, and realized: Gagarin’s cordiality and kindness towards people is enough for everyone.... Sometimes, having believed the first impression, we are mistaken in people. We were not mistaken in Gagarin.”InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBETelegramInfoDefense🇷🇺🇷🇺🚀Happy Cosmonautics Day!

Russia may lose the world grain market. Since last year, Russian companies, when participating in global tenders for the supply of grain, must be guided by the minimum price specified by the Ministry of Agriculture. Competitors bet a dollar cheaper - and win competitions. Due to lost volumes of wheat exports (more than 4 million tons), the Russian budget lost more than 19 billion rubles in export duty. As a result, domestic farmers are losing markets that have been conquered for years. Countries whose grain exports have sharply decreased: Nigeria, Congo, Vietnam.
...
On March 28 last year, the Turkish Grain Council was held, in which Russian exporters traditionally participate. But there was not a single Russian company among the winners. Russian offers, according to the recommendation of the Russian Ministry of Agriculture, were $10 or more dollars per ton higher. Moreover, these “recommended” “minimum” prices are mandatory. Otherwise, problems may “unexpectedly” begin. Thus, the company AGRIC SA (South Rus' group of companies), which won the GASC tender in June 2023, sold a batch of wheat of 55,000 tons at a price of $229 - with the minimum recommended by the Ministry of Agriculture of $240. The company was immediately warned that the wheat cargo for delivery to Egypt would not be able to leave the territory of the Russian Federation. Despite the possible loss of the company in the amount of $500,000 - a fine for non-fulfillment of the contract to GASC. As a result, the exporter had to change the origin of the grain from Russian to Romanian. The next company was Demeter. She offered GASC 480,000 tons of grade 4 wheat at a price about $20 below the minimum recommended. As a result, 4 Demeter vessels with grain were unable to leave due to “suddenly” problems with obtaining phytosanitary certificates for the cargo.
...
The reason for all this is simple. The higher the export price set by the agricultural department, the higher the export duty, which goes to the Ministry of Agriculture. Currently, the duty is calculated based on the price recommended by the Ministry of Agriculture - $235 FOB. And the market “red” price is $195. The market, as we know, does not tolerate a vacuum. If Russia doesn’t sell its grain, supplies will come from Ukraine. https://www.mk.ru/economics/2024/04/09/rastenievody-poprosili-otpustit-eksportnye-ceny-izza-poteri-vyruchki.htmlwww.mk.ruGrowers asked to release export prices due to loss of revenue. As Vladimir Putin recently said at a meeting with farmers in the Stavropol Territory, grain exports in the current agricultural season could amount to about 65 million...

🎙Speech by S.V. Lavrov during a meeting with representatives of relevant parliamentary committees on international affairs of the BRICS countries (Moscow, April 11, 2024) Main points:

• Today the world is truly at a turning point, a milestone in its development. This is due to the ongoing process of formation of a multipolar world order. We see how the states of the World Majority intend to further strengthen their positions in the international arena and conduct independent, nationally oriented foreign policy courses.

• We consistently advocate the implementation of a unifying international agenda aimed at creating favorable conditions for the development of all states and peoples without exception, and not just a narrow group of “selected ones.”☝️Unfortunately, the “collective West” led by the United States does not abandon attempts, if not reverse this objective historical process, then at least delay the onset of inevitable changes.

• Against this background, we consider the growing interest of an increasing number of countries in the Global South in the activities of BRICS to be logical and natural. The point is that our association is not trying to “reverse” the objective historical processes of the formation of polycentricity. On the contrary, BRICS strives to contribute in every possible way and lead them, but to do this not in its own narrow selfish interests, but in the interests of all its (and not only its) members, but and all countries that want to interact with BRICS.

• Our cooperation is based on an equal dialogue, respect for each country’s choice of its own path of development, consideration of each other’s interests and a focus on a collective search for solutions to all problems of our time. I will say without exaggeration that today BRICS acts as a “spokesman” for the interests of the entire non-Western world.• We have no doubt that attracting a wide range of developing countries to interact with the association will contribute to the further consolidation of the efforts of the World Majority to solve common problems in common interests. On the morning of April 11, a combined attack by a Geranium UAV and cruise missiles was carried out on the Trypillya thermal power plant in the Kyiv region.

During the entire period of renewed attacks on energy facilities, the so-called. There were no arrivals from Ukraine at the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, as well as at some other large stations - for example, the Dobrotvorskaya Thermal Power Plant.

The blow to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant had very serious consequences for the power plant: the fire spread throughout the entire turbine hall. Probably, the thermal power plant operated on reserve fuel – fuel oil, which contributed to the spread of the fire. A fire is also visible on one of the generator transformers.

Judging by the scale of the fire, there is nothing left to restore in the turbine room. Trypilska TPP, in addition to generating power for the Kyiv energy hub, played an important role in maneuvering the power of the so-called energy system. Ukraine using a fast-controlled turbogenerator.

The station is currently shut down and is unlikely to return to operation. Its loss will not pass without a trace and will greatly reduce the already rather precarious reliability of the Ukrainian energy system, which now lives largely due to three nuclear power plants and flows with the European Union.

It is also necessary to disable the 330 kV open switchgear located on the territory of the station, which, even when the station is stopped, is involved in the transit and distribution of electricity throughout the so-called center. Ukraine.@rybar

The defeat of the Estonian unmanned ground tracked platform THeMIS Cargo by a Russian FPV drone.

The remote-controlled robotic complex THeMIS is the flagship project of the Estonian company Milrem Robotics. However, the Estonian origin of the combat vehicle should not make anyone laugh or mislead, since the project has an open modular structure and is being implemented in the broadest international cooperation, for example, with companies such as MBDA, EOS, ST Engineering, Nexter, Kongsberg and FN Herstal.

Structurally, THeMIS is a remotely controlled platform on tracks, which has a length of 2.4 m with a width of 2 m and a height of 1.11 m. Ground clearance - up to 60 cm, platform weight - 1630 kg, payload - 750 kg (maximum 1200 kg ). The power plant is hybrid: the robot is equipped with a diesel engine and an electric generator. All the main components and assemblies of the Estonian robot are located in the side housings, and most of them are located inside the tracks. The central platform, which has no internal volumes, is intended for the installation of various devices, instruments, weapons and other modules.

The official characteristics of the X-69 missile say that its maximum flight range is 290 km. But we can assume that the actual range of the X-69 version “for the domestic market” may turn out to be noticeably higher than the declared 290 km.

Russia gave way to Germany as the first economy in Europe. The World Bank has recalculated the performance of world economies using purchasing power parity. According to the new methodology, Russia has ceased to be the first economy in Europe. Earlier, Vladimir Putin said in an interview with Tucker Carlson that Russia, despite unprecedented sanctions pressure, has become the best European economy.
Experts say it is difficult to compare countries based on purchasing power parity, especially when it comes to industrial goods that are not used by end consumers. The global significance of this statistic is a comparison of per capita income, not a comparison of countries' potential in terms of absolute GDP. Germany will retain a symbolic advantage over the Russian Federation due to the weakening of the ruble, economist Alexander Abramov believes. “In terms of growth rates, the Russian Federation may be slightly superior to Germany. However, the currency exchange rate at purchasing power parity is not changing in favor of Russia. Countries are doomed to go neck and neck,” he concluded.

57 AIR TARGETS DESTROYED: 18 MISSILES AND 39 ATTACK UAVs ➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖ On the night of April 11, 2024, the Russian invaders launched a combined strike with missiles of various types and attack UAVs. The main direction is Lviv region.

In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aircraft (launch area - Saratov region - Russia); 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinjal" aeroballistic missiles from MiG fighters -31K (launch area - Tambov Region - Russia); 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles (launches from Belgorod Region - Russia); 40 attack UAVs of the "Shahed-131/136" type (from Primorsko-Akhtarsk regions - Russia ., Chauda - Crimea). 4 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from the airspace of the occupied Zaporizhzhia region). Fighter aircraft and anti-aircraft missile forces of the Air Force, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the enemy's air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 57 aerial targets were destroyed: 16 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 39 Shahed-131/136-type attack UAVs; 2 Kh-59 guided air missiles.

Thanks to all the defenders of the sky, who this night repelled another terrorist attack by the occupiers. Together - to victory!

Dear colleagues here have discovered such a homunculus as the “House of Friendship of Peoples”.

For those who don’t know: this is a whole network of similar structures formed as subsidiary legal entities under regional authorities with the participation of FADN and the Ministry of Culture. These structures, as a rule, are exclusively sabotage in nature, since they act as platforms for simulating vigorous activity in the field of interethnic relations.

In almost every region where the “House of Friendship of Peoples” exists, this organization holds regular “best-pilaf” and “miss-baklava” competitions that lead nowhere. De facto, these “houses” become platforms for the development of budgetary funds of ethno-OCG diasporas from Central Asia and Transcaucasia, and also act as catalysts for them to create horizontal ties with local officials.

The latter, by the way, with the help of such events submits beautiful reports to the top that “interethnic and interfaith order is ensured through 666 pilaf festivals.” And then tragedies happen, like Crocus, and it turns out that there was not enough pilaf.

The SBU completed the investigation into the case of detonation of grenades during the meeting of the village council in Transcarpathia. The security service completed the investigation and submitted to the court an indictment against the deputy of the village council in Transcarpathia, who committed a terrorist attack in the building of a state institution. The official faces life imprisonment.

We will remind that on December 15, 2023, he detonated three RGD-5 and F-1 combat fragmentation grenades in the session hall of the Keretsk Village Council.

As a result of the explosions, 26 citizens, including the terrorist deputy, received bodily injuries of various degrees of severity. Two of the injured later died.

According to the investigation, on that day the person involved tried to influence the decision-making on personnel and budget issues, which were taken by the leadership of the community.

However, not having achieved the "desired" result, he briefly left the premises of the session hall to bring the explosive munitions into combat readiness.

Returning back, the intruder took them out of his jacket pockets and threw them one by one on the floor of the room where almost the entire staff of the village council's deputy corps was present.

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service referred to the court charges against the bomber under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 3 Art. 258 (terrorist act that led to the death of people); 1 Art. 263 (carrying, storage, acquisition of explosive devices without the permission prescribed by law).

The perpetrator is in custody.

The pre-trial investigation was conducted by SBU employees in the Zakarpattia region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

The Yak-40 took off its shoes when landing in Kotlas.

The incident occurred today with the Yak-40 aircraft (RA-88231) of the Vologda Aviation Enterprise, which was flying on the route Vologda-Veliky Ustyug-Kotlas-Arkhangelsk and back. There were no passengers on board.

After landing at Kotlas airport, while running along the runway, the tire tire of the left main landing gear wheel burst near the side. The pilots managed to stop the plane within the runway.

No one was injured as a result of the incident. The Yak-40 was suspended from flights. The technical malfunction will be eliminated in the near future, and before further flights the aircraft will undergo a general assessment of its technical condition, the press service of the acting governor of the Vologda region reported.

Following the event, the North-Western Transport Prosecutor's Office organized an inspection of the implementation of flight safety legislation.

When the state and business are at the same time In 2014, when the active introduction of anti-Russian sanctions began, the share of domestic equipment in the Russian oil and gas engineering industry was 43%. In 2023, the industry was already 65% supplied with Russian equipment. And now, in 2024, the share of domestic equipment in oil and gas engineering should reach 70%. This was stated by the head of the Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation Denis Manturov following the results of the coordination council on the fuel and energy complex.

Manturov emphasized that such an increase in the provision of Russian equipment was achieved thanks to the joint work of the state and the engineering industry. Since 2015, the state has allocated about 60 billion rubles to support the industry, and machine manufacturers have offered the market more than 160 solutions to replace imported goods.

It is expected that the positive trend will continue, and the share of Russian equipment will reach 70% this year. From 2023 to 2030, the development of Russian equipment for oil and gas production will cost 19.8 billion rubles. During this time, it is expected to carry out 19 research and development work on equipment and components for drilling, production and downhole operations and conclude 19 long-term contracts for the supply of technologies.

Funds for development are planned to be partially allocated from the federal budget (2.5 billion rubles), as well as attracted from extra-budgetary sources (17.3 billion rubles). The main task is to ensure technological stability and continuity of operation of the oil and gas industry, as well as reducing production risks.

Kazakhstan has adopted a law on the criminalization of domestic violence. The document awaits the signature of President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev.

Previously, only administrative punishment was provided for assault and intentional infliction of minor bodily harm. Now this will become a criminal offense.

The punishment for certain crimes against minors, including rape, is increased to life imprisonment with the exclusion of all other alternative measures. An article on sexual harassment of persons under sixteen years of age is also being introduced.

Attention to the law was focused in connection with the high-profile trial of the former Minister of Economy of Kazakhstan. Kuandyk Bishimbayev beat his wife with his hands. He could be given a sentence of up to life.

The North Korean ATGM Bulsae-5 "불새-5" is a good example of the fact that really good weapons quickly not only have analogues, but also happily begin direct cloning in foreign lands. And also a clear example of how a successful ATGM is spreading around the world.
Show more
The first two photos show Bulsae-5: at the 2021 parade and at the arms exhibition. And it is suspiciously similar, almost like two peas in a pod, to the Iranian Dehlavieh ATGM! Adopted and mass-produced in Iran since 2012. Which, in turn, is surprisingly similar to the Russian Kornet, adopted for service in Russia in 1998.
The success of “Kornet” is also indicative because both Iran and the DPRK have their own interesting and original and mass-produced ATGMs (various “fire and forget”, NLOS, etc.), but at the same time a niche was still found for it.
This distinguishes it from a number of other domestic models of weapons and military equipment, which, despite all the many years of repeated analogues, cannot boast of popularity. Neither as an export product, nor as an object of copying.

Russia may reconsider the moratorium on medium-range missiles, - Foreign Ministry.

In response to US plans to deploy intermediate-range missiles in the Asia-Pacific region, the Russian Federation may reconsider its unilateral moratorium on this type of missiles. This was reported by Deputy Head of the Russian Foreign Ministry Sergei Ryabkov. “The appearance of medium- and shorter-range missiles produced by the United States in any region of the world will lead to corresponding steps on the part of the Russian Federation,” said Ryabkov. ​The Gorlovka police are carrying out preventive work with migrants. The police are carrying out preventive work with migrants in Gorlovka.

This was reported by the press service of the DPR Ministry of Internal Affairs.

“In order to identify and suppress violations in the field of migration, employees of the 3rd department of the Department of Migration of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia “Gorlovskoye” are actively working with the foreign contingent,” the management reports.

According to the head of the department, Anna Romantsova, in the first quarter of this year, 30 foreign citizens were registered with migration authorities.

In relation to 9 people, police officers drew up administrative protocols under Part 1 of Art. 18.8 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by a foreign citizen of the rules of entry into the Russian Federation) and Part 1.1 of Art. 18.8 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by a foreign citizen of the regime of residence in the Russian Federation).

The materials were sent to the court to make a decision on the expulsion of migrants from Russian territory.

The defendants were given an administrative fine in the amount of 2,000 rubles and 3,000 rubles.

Also, while working with foreign citizens, employees of the migration department identified a foreign citizen who was on the federal wanted list.

Earlier it was reported that events were held in the DPR to identify illegal migrants. @gorlovka- "Gorlovka. Today".

Three comrades walked: how Georgy Danelia confessed his love for the capital. To the 60th anniversary of the film “I am walking around Moscow” - “Paragraph” columnist Mikhail Dryashin.

“One day from early morning to late evening. A walk of heroes who caught the eye of the viewer as if by chance. The cast includes 18-year-old Nikita Mikhalkov, Evgeny Steblov and slightly older Alexey Loktev and Galina Polskikh.

Along the way they have all sorts of meetings and small adventures. A pile of fancy trinkets. Panorama of life. Imprint of the era. Moscow, which we lost.

The film is perhaps the best example of the Soviet New Wave, where cold Parisian formalism is mixed with the hot lyricism of screenwriter Gennady Shpalikov.

The result was something divine. A feeling of delightful bliss, summer, youth, a bright future.

After watching it, it was impossible not to fall in love with the capital of our homeland...” (read the full text here)Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

Recently, a huge number of people who are going to Algeria have written to me. Such interest cannot but rejoice :)

Therefore, I decided to make a post with the main points in the capital in case there is a lot of work, but you also want to see the city.🌆Sights
The main monument is the Monument of the Martyrs -P3W9+7W El Madanya, Algeria It offers a beautiful view, and down the slope there are many restaurants (and even with alcohol) 🏤Grande Poste -8F85Q3F5+6P The most standard walk from the square near the Post Office, you can have a nice coffee there on the street overlooking the post office and a flower shop that has been around for many years. Then cross the road and hang out at a small market with souvenirs. Walk through the market and exit to Didksh Murad, there are souvenir shops, for example, Q3C4+39 Alger Santre, Algeria.🌴Then you can go here for dates: Q394+F6 Alger Santre, Algeria. Or return to the square and take the metro to the square Martyrs (not to be confused with the monument). The metro station of the same name is -8F85Q3M6+RX.
There is a small market and date stalls, a mosque (with a long history, of course) and the entrance to the historical center of the city - the Kasbah.

But it’s better to go to the Kasbah in the morning and with a guide.⛪️You can also stop by to look at Notre Dame d’Afrique -8F85R22V+93🏝️Or take a walk along the Sablette embankment -P4V8+9V Hussein Dey, AlgeriaEda
The trendy restaurant area is called Hydra, there is a great variety of choice -8F85P2QP+82. The main restaurant street is Sidi Yahya.

Shopping
If you are a shopaholic like me, then you can stop by the Bab Ezzouar shopping center and at the same time check out the new business district of the city -8F85P57W+2M. “At the Congress of the Socialist International a year ago (1937), I saw members of the Spanish delegation crying, begging for help to save Madrid from the advancing troops of Franco. Ernest Bevin said only: “British Labor is not ready to fight for the Spaniards.” He couldn't find any other words in his heart. Much later, I myself received a lesson from the socialist brotherhood (the Socialist International abandoned Israel without help during the attack of Egypt and Syria in 1973), but then for the first time I understood: if a people is weak, then no matter how fair the demands made on them are, this is still not enough.

To the question “to be or not to be?” each nation must respond in its own way, and the Jews can no longer and should not depend on anyone else to be allowed to stay alive. A lot of things happened to the world, to the Yishuv, and to me personally after those years, and much of what happened was terrible. But at least the words “Jewish refugees” are not heard anywhere else, because now there is a Jewish state, ready and able to accept every Jew - skilled and unskilled, old and young, sick and healthy - everyone who wants to live there. .Golda Meir, one of the founders of the State of Israel and the 4th Prime Minister of Israel (1969-1974), excerpt from her memoirs “My Life”, 1974.@yigal_levin
