Konstantinov congratulated the residents of Kerch on the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the city from the Nazi invaders. Chairman of the State Council Vladimir Konstantinov recalled that the Kerch-Eltigen landing operation began on October 31, 1943, and the city was liberated on April 11, 1944. “The city was almost completely destroyed. A little more than 30 residents out of almost 100 thousand who inhabited the city in 1940 met the liberators. Kerch was awarded the title of Hero City, and 137 soldiers were awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union,” the parliamentarian said. He noted that the horrors of the occupation did not break the spirit of the Kerch residents. Part of the Soviet troops descended into the Adzhimushkai quarries. The warriors of the underground garrison fought the enemy for 170 days and nights. “We know the names of 2.5 thousand Defenders. The names of the 260 “Adzhimushkais” who survived are also known. Almost all of them went through captivity. The feat of the Adzhimushkaya Defenders is a moral “scale” for all of us. The main thing is for us to remember them,” Konstantinov added. Photo: telegram channel of Vladimir KonstantinovCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

In Ukrainka, after the destruction of the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, emergency power and water shutdown schedules are being introduced from 2 p.m., local residents told Strana.

“In the morning they called us and told us to close the windows and warned that they would turn off the light and water, and there would be no hot water at all. They said that cold water would be available today from 18:00 to 21:00, and tomorrow from 09:00 to 10:00 and from 12:00 to 14:00,” says Maria.

According to the woman, she woke up at 05:00 from the explosions and immediately realized that the thermal power plant had been hit, since she lives nearby.

In the morning there was a lot of burning, the windows in the apartment were black. There was nothing to breathe.

At the moment, the fire has already been extinguished; the smell of burning is also not noticeable.

The roads to the thermal power plant are blocked. Even journalists are not allowed there. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

Revenge of GoodwillVideo, Arrival at Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in Ukrainka, a suburb of Kyiv.

Revenge of goodwill To repair, you must first extinguish.

The bridge over the Amur will not be blocked during repairs. Already next month, important repairs of one important crossing will begin - the bridge over the Amur at the entrance to Komsomolsk-on-Amur.

Since this bridge is the only one, and no engineering facility duplicates it, it will be repaired gradually, over three years, without blocking it for motorists. “Why so long?”, you ask? But this, taking into account all the nuances of the bridge, is very fast.

The fact is that the object is technically complex. Each span is 350 meters, and the height above the water level is 50 meters. Therefore, specialists will have a hard time. But what can you do - such work. The workers will put in order: The spans; The bridge deck; They will replace the safety fences; They will lay a new asphalt concrete covering along the entire length of the bridge; They will install electric lighting on the roadway; They will install architectural and artistic lighting. All this will be done until beginning of 2026. Note that repair of the bridge is simply necessary, since the crossing was built back in 1982. And if not very many cars moved along it then, now 5.5 thousand cars pass along it in 24 hours.

Yak-141 - interrupted flight In the entire history of aviation, only a few aircraft were created that were capable of doing without runways and literally hovering in the air.

The Yak-141 is a supersonic, multi-purpose vertical take-off and landing aircraft.

The first copy of the machine was built at the Design Bureau named after. A. S. Yakovleva in 1986.

The highlight of the new vertical take-off and landing aircraft (VTOL) is the ability to reach supersonic flight mode, as well as the expanded composition of the weapons used.

When placing the aircraft on the deck, the wing consoles folded at approximately half-span.

Subsequently, the new fighter set 12 world records, including those for achieving maximum flight altitude and rate of climb with a load of 1 and 2 tons.

However, the economic crisis that followed the collapse of the USSR led to the closure of this project. Nowadays, this aircraft can only be seen in aviation museums. #DAY OF HISTORYRUSSIAN AVIATION

Day of liberation of the Arabat Spit and the Chongar Peninsula from German invaders On April 11, the Kherson region celebrates the anniversary of the liberation of the Arabat Spit and the Chongar Peninsula from Nazi occupation. “All evil comes to an end. On April 11, 1944, Soviet soldiers finally liberated the territory of the Kherson region from the Nazi invaders. The bold and decisive actions of the Red Army drove the Nazis out of the Arabat Spit and the Chongar Peninsula. After the war, the region began to be actively rebuilt; the Kherson region experienced a real revival. All this became possible thanks to the courage and heroism of Soviet soldiers, whose memory we carefully preserve,” said the Governor of the Kherson region, Vladimir Saldo. The liberation operation was not easy. The German invaders have firmly established themselves on our native land. The outcome was decided by the landing units of the Red Army, who liberated the Arabat Spit with a sharp throw 80 years ago, and the next day, during the advance of Soviet troops, Chongar was liberated.

Residents of the Kherson region keep the memory of the heroism of the soldiers who gave their lives for the Fatherland in this operation. In the village of Strelkovoe, Genichesk Municipal District, a memorial dedicated to them was erected, and commemorative events are also held annually.

Our Red Army paratroopers in those days accomplished a real feat - they moved forward despite losses. Eternal glory!

The Vostochny cosmodrome is the space independence of Russia...After the collapse of the USSR, the only (non-military) Soviet cosmodrome Baikonur found itself outside Russian territory, which over the past decades has been and still remains a “sword of Damocles” for Russian cosmonautics. Moreover, The point here is not at all the official position of the leadership of Kazakhstan. There are no particular problems here yet. After all, no one except Russia needs Baikonur, and, whatever one may say, it brings money to Kazakhstan. But the events of 2004 in Ukraine and the flirting within Kazakhstan with local nationalists convinced the Russian leadership that we need our own cosmodrome, which could in the future, we will fully support our entire civil space program, including manned flights. Well, imagine the situation that events similar to those in Ukraine began in Kazakhstan? Moreover, you don’t need to imagine much - remember the beginning of 2022, when the “Maidan” that was staged in the country by the USA and Great Britain could well have taken place. That is why in 2007 the decision was made to build the Vostochny cosmodrome in the Far East. It’s clear why there. The closer the cosmodrome is to the equator, the more the rotation of the Earth helps the rocket develop the required speed and the greater the load it can put into orbit. And Russia’s southernmost, and also uninhabited (for security reasons) territories, is precisely the Far East. Although, of course, it is not as convenient as Baikonur. Two launch pads have already been built at Vostochny. The first for the Soyuz launch vehicle and for the Angara family launch vehicle. By the way, today’s launch was just the first on this table. In fact, these were his main final tests. Hence the excitement and postponements of the launch. The importance of today's launch is that we have a replacement for the heavy Proton launch vehicle. Moreover, it is already obvious that in the future, all new launch sites for Russian space rockets will be built here and gradually for Roscosmos it is Vostochny, and not Baikonur, that will become the main cosmodrome.

On April 11, 1857, Alexander II approved the coat of arms of the Russian Empire - the double-headed eagle. The entire set of state emblems was also approved - Large, Middle and Small, which were supposed to symbolize the unity and power of Russia. In May 1857, the Senate published a Decree describing new coats of arms and the norms for their use, which existed until 1917 without any significant changes.

By the decree of the All-Russian Central Executive Committee and the Council of People's Commissars “On the abolition of estates and civil ranks” (1917), Russian insignia, orders, flag and coat of arms were abolished. The double-headed eagle returned to the country's coat of arms only in 1993, when a new state emblem was introduced by Presidential Decree - a double-headed eagle, the design of which was based on the coat of arms of the Russian Empire.

Passenger traffic at Pulkovo Airport increased by 8% in the first quarter of 2024. Pulkovo Airport served 4.2 million passengers in January-March 2024, which is 8% more than in the same period last year. Interfax reports this with reference to data from Northern Capital Gateway LLC (VVSS, operator of the St. Petersburg airport).

The airport served 3.4 million passengers on domestic flights. The most popular destinations were Moscow, Sochi, Kaliningrad, Yekaterinburg, Kazan, Murmansk, Samara, Ufa, Novosibirsk, Arkhangelsk and Mineralnye Vody.

Passenger traffic on international flights amounted to 0.8 million passengers. The most popular destinations are Istanbul, Dubai, Minsk, Antalya, Tashkent, Dushanbe, Samarkand, Yerevan, Baku and Phuket.aviaru.net/n269983

Western manufacturers of tractors have left Russia, and now our market is divided by domestic and Chinese brands. The latter are leaders in sales, but they still have questions regarding reliability and availability of service.

Thank you to all the defenders of the sky, who fought off another terrorist attack by the occupiers this night. Together - to victory!

The geochemistry of a rare metal deposit on the Kola Peninsula has been studied. The geochemistry of rare metal-enriched rocks of the large Vuorijärvi carbonatite complex in the Murmansk region was studied by employees of the laboratory of geochemistry and ore-bearing capacity of alkaline magmatism and the laboratory of methods of research and analysis of substances and materials of the Geochemistry Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences@geokhi with the participation of analysts from the Institute of Geology and Geochemistry of the Russian Academy of Sciences @igemras.📍Scientists have established high the content of strategic metals (such as niobium, tantalum, zirconium, hafnium, thorium and rare earths) in phoscorites, in which pyrochlore is the main concentrator of these metals. The temperature range for the formation of rare metal ores has been determined. The study showed the prospects of the complex for the development of niobia and rare earth ores. Similar to Vuorijärvi, the existing Kovdor deposit has been successfully developed for many years for phlogopite, apatite, titanomagnetite and baddeleyite raw materials.▪️Carbonatite complexes are promising for rare metal and rare earth raw materials, in demand in many industries, such as chemical, metallurgy, microelectronics, nuclear production, chemical and others .🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

Forwarded from: Agriculture and agro-industry | Agriculture and food industry of Russia (agribusiness, peasant farming, peasant farms)
A national center for genetic resources of farm animals will be created in Russia. A new national center for genetic resources of farm animals will be created by decree of Russian President Vladimir Putin on the basis of the Federal Research Center for Animal Husbandry named after Academician L.K. Ernst. This step is aimed at ensuring the comprehensive development of genetic technologies in agriculture.

Russia has been engaged in its own genetics since the beginning of the 20th century. Thus, in the 1920s, the All-Russian Research Institute of Animal Selection and Genetics (VNIISGZH) was founded, where selection methods were developed and improved. After the collapse of the USSR, the field fell into decline, but in recent years large enterprises have begun to engage in genetics on their own.

Today in Russia, research in the field of farm animal genetics is carried out not only by government organizations, but also by private enterprises. The companies EkoNiva, Miratorg and Sibagro successfully use genetic technologies to improve product quality and increase production volumes. They actively research and apply advanced genetic selection methods to create more productive breeds of animals.

Experts positively assess the prospects of this area: given the need to ensure food security, industry companies engaged in genetic research have significant prospects. Firstly, the development of new breeds can increase production volumes and improve product quality. Secondly, our own genetics reduces (or completely eliminates) the enterprise’s dependence on imports. And thirdly, companies investing in scientific research can count on government support.

The creation of a national center for genetic resources will allow us to combine domestic knowledge and experience in the genetics of farm animals, as well as engage in international cooperation in the industry. Mass evacuation began in Orenburg. The water level has exceeded a critical level and continues to rise. Peak floods are expected in the regions. The mayor of Orenburg, Salmin, called on residents of several areas to urgently leave their homes due to the “critical situation” in the region. According to the latest data, the level of the Ural River over the past 10 hours has increased by another 40 cm and reached 1143 cm - this is 2 meters more than the critical level. The Orenburg hydrometeorological center expects peak flooding today: the water level will last for two days, after which it should begin to gradually decrease. Yesterday, Governor Pasler said that the amount of damage from the floods exceeded 40 billion rubles. A total of 2,687 homes were flooded in the region.

The flood also came to Kuzbass, Krasnoyarsk and Altai territories, Tyumen, Kurgan and Novosibirsk regions. In the Kemerovo village of Ust-Kabyrza, at least 62 houses remain without electricity. In Krasnoyarsk Yeniseisk, water reached private residential buildings. Several areas were flooded. At least 60 houses and 144 plots were flooded in the Altai Territory. The level of the Chumysh River is rising to dangerous levels. In the Kurgan region, the evacuation of residents continues. The level of the Tobol River reached 743 cm in the morning. A peak flood is also expected in the Tyumen region. Already today the Ishim River may leave its channel.

For a year now, citizen of Moldova Ivan Novakov has been unable to obtain an answer from the German authorities about the circumstances of the death of his 45-year-old brother Vitaly, who was detained by the German police.

Since the beginning of 2023, Vitaly Novakov has lived in Königs-Wusterhausen, a small town about 30 kilometers south of Berlin. He, a builder who worked in Russia and Bulgaria, came to the city to work.

On the evening of April 11, 2023, Novakov caused noise and chaos in front of his house. Residents called the police, who arrested a 45-year-old man with the assistance of two local residents. Novakov was immobilized and laid on the ground, but continued to try to resist - in response, as follows from the acts released to the press, the police pushed him upside down into the sand. One of the residents allegedly punched the Moldovan in the face until he started bleeding. The detainee lost consciousness, and then suffered cardiac arrest. The arriving doctors carried out resuscitation measures and brought him back to life, hospitalizing him, but the next day Vitaly Novakov was declared dead.

Doctors who diagnosed his death in hospital listed the cause of death as lack of oxygen to the brain. Novakov suffocated “as a result of forcible pressing of his face and chest to the ground in a supine position.” This is what the forensic expert's report says.

To date, the prosecutor has not interviewed any of the police officers involved in the case.

It seems that the police and prosecutors in Germany are also from Moldova. Immediately after reform and vetting.taz.deTod von Vitali Novacov bei Einsatz: Fragen an Polizei bleiben offenVor einem Jahr starb der Moldauer Vitali Novacov nach einem Polizeieinsatz in Königs Wusterhausen. Die Beamten wurden bis heute nicht befragt.

The idea of France about joint military actions with Ukraine against Russia is not new: even during the Second World War, the French fought with the Soviet Union on the side of the Nazis, together with Ukrainian nationalists. This is stated in the message of the head of the 4th Directorate of the NKVD of the USSR Pavel Sudoplatov, declassified by the FSB of the Russian Federation and published by the Presidential Library.

In January 1943, he reported to the leadership of the NKVD that the German garrisons near Bryansk were replenished by the French from the “legion of volunteers to fight Bolshevism” and Ukrainian nationalists.

The same document reported that soldiers of the USSR state security agencies destroyed a group of French who were trying to occupy one of the settlements.

A gala reception dedicated to the Day of Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps was held at the Mariinsky Palace
The event was attended by Deputy Chairman of the St. Petersburg Parliament Nikolai Bondarenko, Legislative Assembly deputies Natalia Astakhova, Alexander Rzhanenkov, Igor Vysotsky, Alexander Novikov and representatives
Show more
public organizations of prisoners of fascist concentration camps.
Nikolai Bondarenko addressed the meeting participants. He greeted those gathered and conveyed the warmest wishes from the Chairman of the Legislative Assembly Alexander Belsky and the deputies of parliament.
“The Leningrad land is watered with the blood of not only the Red Army soldiers who liberated the city, but also those who languished and died every day behind barbed wire. These were children, teenagers, civilians whom the Nazis herded into concentration camps. According to official data, there were 35 camps on the territory of the Leningrad region, and the unofficial figure is even higher. The history of our Motherland has shown that fascism is such an evil that has led to millions of victims. Our people paid a price that should never be forgotten,” Nikolai Bondarenko emphasized.
Now in St. Petersburg there live almost 5 thousand former minor prisoners of concentration camps, ghettos and other places of forced detention created by the Nazis and their allies during the Great Patriotic War. Deputy Alexander Rzhanenkov told the meeting participants that his mother was also a prisoner of the concentration camp.
“My mother was 20 years old when she helped several of our soldiers escape from encirclement. But she couldn’t save herself and ended up in Buchenwald. When I was little, my mother didn’t tell me anything about it. And only when I was in tenth grade did I notice the number stamped on her hand. Therefore, for me personally, you are holy people,” the parliamentarian noted.
#ZakSSPb #AlexanderBelsky

How do scammers adapt to new realities in order to deceive us? Fraudsters do not stand still. They gave up calling and switched to emails and SMS messages. Now they steal not only money from accounts, but also cryptocurrency. A call from a “bank employee” or “FSB agent” is no longer so surprising: fraud has become bolder and more sophisticated. Cybercriminals pose as representatives of various organizations. For example, employees of marketplaces, banks, or even intelligence agencies. To protect yourself from fraud, do not click on suspicious links or respond to unexpected messages. If in doubt, contact the company or institution directly through official contacts.

Employees of Rosseti Northern Caucasus PJSC were detained for the theft of 2.8 billion rubles. The FSB and the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs stopped the activities of an organized crime group consisting of former and current employees of Rosseti Northern Caucasus PJSC, its branch Dagenergo and contractors, which was involved in the theft of budget funds in especially large size. This was reported by the media with reference to the Central Operations Center of the FSB of the Russian Federation.

According to the investigation, the organized crime group stole about 2.8 billion rubles allocated for the creation of an automated electricity metering system in the Republic of Dagestan.

The metering system has not yet been put into operation, although funds were allocated for it from the federal budget as part of a program to reduce excess losses in the power grid complex in the North Caucasus, the Ministry of Internal Affairs noted.

In connection with fraud committed by an organized group on an especially large scale, a case was opened under Part 4 of Article 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. 9 accused were taken into custody.

Earlier, the director of Dagenergo, Magomedkhabib Mukhumaev, was detained in the same case.

The deal to purchase Datagroup-Volia and lifecell will bring $1.5 billion in investments to Ukraine. French billionaire Xavier Niel (NJJ Holding) intends to merge the fixed Internet provider Datagroup-Volia and the mobile operator lifecell.

The merged company will be headed by Datagroup-Volia CEO Mikhail Shelemba.

According to him, this deal will bring the country an unprecedented $1.5 billion in investment.

The investment program in Ukraine will include investments in the network, licenses, equipment, expansion of fixed and mobile infrastructure in the country.

This agreement is the first significant investment by a new market participant since the start of the full-scale invasion, as well as a significant investment in Ukraine's domestic infrastructure.

“On April 16, the fate of $1.5 billion of investments is being decided, which includes the transaction amount and investment obligations for five years,” Mikhail Shelemba said in an interview with Forbes.

A court hearing has been scheduled for this day to consider the appeal of lifecell’s parent company, Turkcell, to lift the seizure of 20% of the operator’s corporate rights.

They were arrested in October 2023 due to the presence of sanctioned Russian businessmen in the ownership structure. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

Book for the evening The instructions indicate the standard combat check distance for most types of small arms is 100 m, setting the sight for zeroing to “1”. Again, it is assumed that the bullet’s flight path crosses the aiming line at 100 m without exceeding, the TP (aiming point) is the CT (control point), as when checking the combat of AC and VSS.
The test target can be a black square 25 X 25 cm or a circle with a diameter of 20 - 25 cm. Aiming at the bottom edge, you need to fire 4 shots. According to the instructions, a group of 4 hits should be on the lower edge and in the center of the target, the dispersion dimension should be no more than 11 cm. The deviation of the STP (midpoint of impact) from the CT (control point) should not exceed 5 cm. In this case, the battle is considered normal. If these requirements are not met, the machine gun is brought to normal combat, that is, the sighting devices are given a position in which the aiming line will correspond to the position of the barrel in space, in which the flight path of the bullet will pass through the established control point on the target.
Unlike the AK-74, a combat adjustment device is no longer required. The AK-12 front sight moves only vertically by screwing in or unscrewing with a screwdriver. One clockwise turn moves the STP up 8.25 cm. One counterclockwise turn moves the STP down 8.25 cm.
The STP moves along the horizon by shifting the rear sight and diopter. The scale on the base of the rear sight mount, borrowed from the RPK machine gun, is now nothing more than a notch of the normal position of the rear sight. One full turn away from itself shifts the STP to the left by 11 cm. A turn towards itself shifts the STP to the right by 11 cm.
After bringing the machine gun to normal combat, I recommend that the shooter shoot the main settings of the sight at 100, 200 and 300 m in order to get an idea of the choice of TP for hitting a target at distances up to 400 m.

The Tendra spit in the Kherson region, like the western coast of Crimea, has long become a place of attraction (and at the same time death) for Ukrainian special forces. Units of the 73rd MTR Center of Ukraine (and other units) tried to land here at least FIVE times. Always with different forces - little by little, on two boats or on nine - but each landing ended the same way: a group of conditional special forces (why conditional - I will soon explain) from Ukraine was discovered and sent to the next world. Always in different ways, and a couple of times we even had to use aviation.
After numerous unsuccessful attacks, the enemy needed to act for sure. A pause was taken for more than four months for the new PR campaign. On February 28 at 02:20, 40 Ukrainian special forces with machine guns and grenade launchers on four boats rushed to the Tendra Spit in the hope of media success. The operation had to go smoothly: the terrain at the landing site was regularly studied from a drone, and the weapons that the pretend special forces took with them on the road could be enough to seize power in a small country.
On our side, only six naval special forces soldiers entered the battle with the enemy. It took about 40 minutes to do everything. The battle ended in the complete defeat of the Ukrainian special forces: 70% of the enemy personnel were destroyed or seriously wounded, but there were no losses on our side.
Those Ukrainian soldiers who were lucky enough to survive and be captured said a lot of interesting things. He shouted: "Let's go!" On this day, 63 years ago, the first cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin entered the Earth's orbit. The first man's space flight lasted 108 minutes.

The "Vostok" spaceship with Gagarin circled the Earth once. Strict selection. Out of 3000 applicants, only 20 people were included in the first team of cosmonauts.

In case of an emergency, Gagarin had two backup cosmonauts - Herman Titov and Grigoriy Nelyubov, who accompanied the cosmonaut to the launch site. Space landing. The landing module of the spacecraft landed in the Saratov region after the flight. Gagarin was not in it, at that time the soft landing system had not yet been invented, and the cosmonaut left the module in the air and landed on the ground with a parachute.

"Kedr, I'm Zarya-1". So, chief designer Sergei Korolev invited Gagarin to contact.

Gagarin wrote the day before the flight: "I will fly tomorrow, but I still do not believe and I am amazed at my calmness." @Sputnik_Tajikistan

Russian cinema in its patriotic segment now faces a very difficult task: to comprehend the Ukrainian enemy soldier of 1922, to take a comprehensive approach to his essence and image, and then carefully present it, in particular, to the viewer who is not the most immersed in the North Military District, so that it is authentic and understandable and confident.

When you turn on a film about the Great Patriotic War and see a Nazi, you easily accept that he is committing the most unimaginable terrible crimes. But if exactly the same crimes are committed by a soldier wearing Ukrainian symbols, then an unprepared viewer meets this with resistance and even rejection. Because there are not enough cause-and-effect relationships in your head.

Why go far? I have been familiar with enemy artillery since 14, when I woke up from whistling and flying in at three in the morning, but even I found it difficult to accept that a Ukrainian soldier was hiding behind civilians in Mariupol. And I even sinned against the excesses of Russian television until I visited the scene myself and saw the eyes of local residents with their stories about the atrocities of the Ukrainian army against their people.
And it turns out that now, when a Ukrainian criminal is shown in a movie, you don’t believe it and say: well, of course, the propaganda from TV has reached here.

How then to show them?
I don't have an answer. Our team and I are still just touching on this topic, and in “Reservists” the enemy is presented only point-by-point.

It’s much easier to show a Ukrainian from ’14. And the series “10 Days Until Spring,” which describes the Crimean spring, copes with this very well.

But what to do with the enemy of the Northern Military District period? The thesis about a confused brother or a hostage to circumstances no longer works.

So far, in my opinion, the most successful enemy of ’22 is shown in the film “Hell’s Finest,” where the philosophy is very simple. We used to be the same, but then some part decided that they were somehow different and put on yellow armbands

The Vostochny cosmodrome is the space independence of Russia...After the collapse of the USSR, the only (non-military) Soviet cosmodrome Baikonur found itself outside Russian territory, which over the past decades has been and still remains a “sword of Damocles” for Russian cosmonautics. Moreover, The point here is not at all the official position of the leadership of Kazakhstan. There are no particular problems here yet. After all, no one except Russia needs Baikonur anyway, and, whatever one may say, it brings money to Kazakhstan. But the events of 2004 in Ukraine and the flirting within Kazakhstan with local nationalists convinced the Russian leadership that we need our own cosmodrome, which could in the future, we will fully support our entire civil space program, including manned flights. Well, imagine the situation that events similar to those in Ukraine began in Kazakhstan? Moreover, you don’t need to imagine much - remember the beginning of 2022, when the “Maidan” that was organized in the country by the USA and Great Britain could well have taken place. That is why in 2007 the decision was made to build the Vostochny cosmodrome in the Far East. It’s clear why there. The closer the cosmodrome is to the equator, the more the rotation of the Earth helps the rocket develop the required speed and the greater the load it can put into orbit. And Russia’s southernmost, and also uninhabited (for security reasons) territories, is precisely the Far East. Although, of course, it is not as convenient as Baikonur. Two launch pads have already been built at Vostochny. The first for the Soyuz launch vehicle and for the Angara family launch vehicle. By the way, today’s launch was just the first on this table. In fact, these were his main final tests. Hence the excitement and postponements of the launch. The importance of today's launch is that we have a replacement for the heavy Proton launch vehicle. Moreover, it is already obvious that in the future, all new launch sites for Russian space rockets will be built here and gradually for Roscosmos it is Vostochny, and not Baikonur, that will become the main cosmodrome.

In Podolsk, a native of Azerbaijan beat two little girls into intensive care right on the playground.

The incident occurred in front of several adults who did not pay any attention to what happened. In broad daylight, dressed in a tracksuit, a seemingly neat and calm lady approached the schoolgirls and, swearing, hit each one with her fist.

Here is what the mother of one of the victim girls says: “I found out that 15 minutes before the beating, the 6-year-old daughter of that inadequate woman approached our children. This girl often walks in the yard, everyone knows her. According to my daughter, she came up to her and began to look at her. My child, meanwhile, was engrossed in texting on his phone. Maybe this girl decided that they wanted to take her picture - I don’t know, in any case, she ran away abruptly, and then her mother came to the swing to start a showdown.”

Both girls are now in the intensive care unit of the surgical department of the city hospital. One victim has a fracture in the spine, and the other has a traumatic brain injury. You can't tell from the video, but it's true.

The parents of both victims wrote a statement to the police, and law enforcement officers have already managed to visit the rented apartment, where a frantic foreigner lives among numerous relatives (according to some sources, she has a Russian passport). It is unknown whether a criminal case has been initiated or not.

The SBU blocked new escape channels for draftees abroad: one of them led to the unrecognized Transnistria. The Security Service blocked three more schemes for evading mobilization and illegal departure of potential conscripts abroad. Four organizers of illegal "trafficking" were detained in different regions of Ukraine.

For money, the accused helped evaders escape abroad, using forged documents or bypassing checkpoints.

The cost of "services" was up to 15 thousand US dollars. 🔹Yes, in Odesa: they neutralized a criminal group that established a channel of illegal migration to the self-proclaimed Transnistria.

According to the investigation, those involved were looking for evaders and offered them transportation outside of Ukraine across the border river.

In order to covertly cross the water barrier, the perpetrators used a motor boat, which was launched only at night. 🔹In Lviv Oblast: according to the SBU, a 33-year-old man from Kyiv, who together with an accomplice tried to smuggle six conscripts to the European Union, will appear before the court.

For this purpose, the defendants illegally entered their clients into the "Way" system as volunteers of a charitable organization engaged in the transportation of humanitarian aid.

But the SBU employees timely exposed the criminal intentions and blocked them. 🔹In Cherkasy region: another criminal group was exposed, which took evaders abroad under the guise of drivers of international passenger transportation.

According to the investigation, the perpetrators arranged potential conscripts as drivers of foreign flights operated by one of the carrier companies.

Currently, investigations are ongoing on all the revealed facts in order to establish all the circumstances of the crimes and bring the culprits to justice.

Comprehensive measures were carried out jointly with the National Police and the State Border Service under the procedural guidance of the Prosecutor General's Office and regional prosecutors' offices.

🇿🇦🇺🇸American senators - both Democrats and Republicans - have abandoned plans to demand an immediate review of South Africa's eligibility to participate in AGOA, the US program of trade preferences for Africa. Perhaps this was one of the results of the recent visit of South African Foreign Minister N. Pandor to the United States.

The “off-cycle” review was mandated by the “AGOA Renewal Act,” which Democratic Senator Chris Coons proposed last November.

A bipartisan bill to extend AGOA until 2041, co-sponsored by strong South Africa critic Senator Jim Risch, the senior Republican on the Foreign Relations Committee, and other influential senators can be expected to be introduced, but the draft has now dropped reference to South Africa. Africa.

Nevertheless, South Africa's foreign policy continues to cause concern among many senators, but in an election year in the United States, they apparently did not want to revise the law for an individual country.

At the same time, the drafters of the bill decided to update the terms of AGOA to make the preference mechanism “simpler, more predictable and more effective.” Countries' participation will be reviewed for eligibility every two years, rather than annually as required by current legislation.

However, such an update is unlikely to affect the real ability of the United States to exclude South Africa from AGOA, if the desire nevertheless appears, since the US President can at any time revise the right of countries to participate “out of the loop.” Congress will also receive such powers, significantly expanding its powers over the administration of this programs. Generally speaking, participation in AGOA is very beneficial for South Africa, especially in terms of exports of cars, fruit and wine. In 2022, as part of the program, South Africa exported volumes worth about $3 billion to the United States.#South AfricaTelegramAfrican Through the Looking GlassNikita Panin's channel about political processes in Africa

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL

Greek Phantoms celebrated their 50th anniversary. In March 1974, the then Royal Hellenic Air Force received the first McDonnell Douglas F-4E Phantom II fighters. Greece has waited three years to receive the Phantoms since placing an order for 36 fighters in 1971. The program was called "Icarus of the World" (Peace Icarus). In 1978, Greece additionally ordered 18 more F-4E fighters (by this time the Greeks had received two additional fighters to replace those that had retired) and added 8 reconnaissance RF-4Es as part of the Peace Icarus II program.

In the early 90s of the last century, the Greek Air Force received a batch of F-4E fighters decommissioned from the US Air National Guard. And later they took the “unnecessary” F-4Es from the German Air Force. In 1993, Greece requested proposals to extend the service life of existing fighters, as well as to modernize or replace Phantom avionics. The tender was won in 1997 by the German Daimler-Benz Aerospace (now EADS), which previously modernized the German Phantoms. On 11 August 1997, DASA was awarded a contract to modernize Greek F-4Es worth US$317 million - the program was called "Icarus of the World 2000".

Today, the Greek Phantoms, along with the Turkish ones, remain the last Phantoms in Europe. According to rumors, 2024 will be the last year for the F-4E in the Greek Air Force. Currently, the 338th Fighter Bomber Squadron "Ares" is the only unit of the Greek Air Force armed with McDonnell Douglas F-4E Phantom II fighters. The Greek "Phantoms" fly quite well and most recently took part in the annual major international exercise Iniochos 2024. In addition photos of materials, we invite you to watch the most spectacular video of WWI flights during these exercises (by the way, not only Phantoms). #PhantomPhriday@AviaNews

🚀On April 12, 1961 at 09:07 Moscow time, the Vostok spacecraft launched from the Baikonur Cosmodrome with cosmonaut Yuri Alekseevich Gagarin on board - the world's first human flight into space began, which marked the onset of the space age in the history of mankind.

Yuri Gagarin spent 108 minutes in space, making a full orbit around the Earth, and successfully landed near the village of Smelovki, Saratov region.

While in orbit, he maintained radio contact with the Earth, made observations through the window, controlled the operation of the ship's systems, and carried out simple experiments. The news about Yuri Alekseevich's flight came out only 55 minutes after the launch of the Vostok rocket, becoming the most quoted message in the world. Overnight, a Soviet pilot of a fighter aviation regiment turned into the most famous person on Earth.

Two days later, a crowd of thousands of people with flowers and welcoming posters took to the streets of Moscow, honoring the cosmonaut who had arrived in the capital. Already at the end of April, our compatriot went on a foreign tour, traveling over two years to more than 30 countries, where he was greeted as a hero.💬S.V. Lavrov: For billions of people around the world, Yu.A. Gagarin continues to serve as an example of heroism and dedication, inspire to overcome any obstacles in achieving the most ambitious and noble goals (from the video message of the Minister on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Yu. A. Gagarin’s flight into space).

Gagarin's flight became a real triumph of Soviet science and technology and was of utmost importance for the further development of cosmonautics and all mankind, marking the beginning of international cooperation in the study of outer space.🌐In 1968, at the 61st General Conference of the International Aeronautical Federation, it was decided to celebrate April 12 as World Aviation and Cosmonautics Day, and in 2011, at the initiative of Russia, the UN General Assembly proclaimed April 12 as the International Day of Human Space Flight.#CosmonauticsDay

According to Läänemets, he, as the Minister of Internal Affairs, has no other choice. In fact, his policy reflects just the opposite: that everyone has a choice, and the Estonian makes it in favor of a systematic Russophobic course.

Not only will Tallinn thus infringe on the rights of Orthodox Russians in the country, the head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs forgets that Orthodoxy is the second most popular religion in Estonia, which means that his decision can destabilize the situation in his own state. However, it turns out that commitment to national interests is just an empty phrase for Läänemets. The Estonian Orthodox Church of the Moscow Patriarchate, in turn, stated that it does not intend to sever ties with the Russian Orthodox Church. The commander of the heavy flamethrower system TOS-1A “Solntsepek” with the call sign “Almaz” spoke about the performance of combat missions in the zone of a special military operation.
Show more
The TOS-1A crew consists of three people - the vehicle commander, gunner and driver. The Solntsepek fire fires thermobaric charges at a range of up to six kilometers.
Unlike artillery systems, which are used mainly to destroy open targets, heavy flamethrower systems can fire at closed and fortified enemy positions - dugouts, pillboxes and bunkers.
When a TOS shell explodes, says the commander of a combat vehicle, the blast wave of a thermobaric shell easily penetrates a fortified room through doors or various cracks, hitting enemy personnel with excess pressure.
The Solntsepek crew receives fire adjustments from the crews of unmanned aerial vehicles. After successfully completing a combat mission, TOS-1A immediately changes position to prevent a retaliatory strike.
For competent actions and heroism shown during combat missions, the commander of the TOS-1A Almaz was awarded the St. George Cross.

Primorye plans to launch trains to North Korea. In April and May, new tourist groups depart from Primorsky Krai to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

The number of each tourist group will be up to one hundred people; tourists will be shown artifacts of the 112th anniversary of the birth of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung.

Trips of Russian tourists to the Land of Morning Freshness became possible thanks to personal agreements between the Governor of the Primorsky Territory Oleg Kozhemyako and the leadership of North Korea.

Previously, the country was completely closed to tourists. To date, three groups of Russian tourists have already visited North Korea.

In the spring, three more tours to the DPRK will be organized in the second half of April and early May.

The general director of the travel company said that travelers will visit all the sights of the republic: the house of Kim Il Sung, the monumental sculptural ensemble on Mansu Hill, as well as the city of Kaesong.

The flow of Russian tourists to the DPRK is ensured by regular flights between Vladivostok and Pyongyang.

On behalf of the governor of the Primorsky Territory, the issue of organizing passenger rail service on the route Vladivostok - Pyongyang is being discussed.#Primorye

Report from the MS-21 assembly This week, “Vzlyot” was lucky enough to visit the Irkutsk Aviation Plant (a branch of PJSC Yakovlev of the United Aircraft Corporation Rostec) and see firsthand how the preparation process for testing the import-substituted version of the MS-21-310 passenger airliner is progressing and production aircraft of this type are being built.

In the final assembly shop, along with the airframes of the serial MC-21-310 (more on them later), there are currently two prototype aircraft under the import substitution program. On the first of them - the fifth flight prototype of the MS-21 with tail number 73055 - the installation of most of the domestically produced systems provided for it has already been completed and their testing has begun.

As is known, this model initially flew with Russian PD-14 engines since December 2020, but has a wing made of imported composites. Externally, it is clearly noticeable that the auxiliary power unit compartment on the aircraft has been replaced (this means that the domestic APU developed by Stupino Research and Production Enterprise Aerosila will also be tested on it). It is expected that by the beginning of this summer the vehicle will be transferred from the final assembly shop to the factory flight test department, where its ground testing will continue, after which it will be able to take off and begin flying under the certification program for the imported version of the MS-21-310.

The second experimental aircraft is the sixth flying prototype of the MS-21, which has a wing made of Russian composite materials, but has been flying since December 2021 with PW1431G-JM engines. Currently, imported systems and a number of structural units that require modifications according to the documentation of the imported version of the aircraft have been dismantled from this aircraft with tail number 73057. This example is gradually equipped with domestic on-board systems as they arrive at the plant. In particular, two PD-14 engines have already arrived at the enterprise for installation under its wing. To be continued

Offensive of the Russian Armed Forces on Chasov Yar, April 12Eastern flankTactical decisions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the battlefield are not much different from what happened in Soledar or Artyomovsk. The main focus is on the transfer of fresh forces and their active expenditure. Some units, apparently, were transferred here from the Kupyansky direction, for example, the 41st Mechanized Infantry Brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and the combined detachments of the 110th TrO brigade. Previously, these connections were located in the Kupyansky direction and, presumably, were removed from it in the last few weeks. This means that the reserve group of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in Slavyansk/Kramatorsk is either small in number, or insufficiently staffed, or is deliberately not being introduced (yet) into battle against the Russian Armed Forces. At the same time, there is no qualitative increase in personnel: in the units, the majority are men aged 40+ without combat experience, mobilized from three to ten months ago. Most of these units rush into counter attacks on the 98th Airborne Division in the canal area, where they die safely. Northern flank From the side of Kalinovka, the Armed Forces of Ukraine regrouped and are trying to conduct short attacks against the units of the 200th Brigade of the Russian Armed Forces. There are no heavy oncoming battles as such - the advantage of Russian troops in drones (both reconnaissance and FPV) is reflected, however, it is increasingly obvious that the Ukrainian Armed Forces forces on the northern flank of Chasov Yar have an unused functioning reserve in case of a large-scale breakthrough. Southern flank Heavy fighting takes place between the tract Dolgi and the reserve "Golubovskie Mortars - 2". In some cases, even a barrage of fire does not help move forward. The extensive network of oporniks, which the Military Chronicle described earlier, allows the Armed Forces of Ukraine to flexibly transfer resources for defense from one position to another. Ukrainian troops are trying not to hold on to broken positions, but it is also difficult to occupy them safely: here Ukrainian troops use the same tactics as the Russian military during the offensive of the Ukrainian Armed Forces near the village of Rabotino. The fire density for such tasks is high, and, apparently, many tactical errors accumulated since the time of the counter-offensive in the Zaporozhye direction were taken into account by the command of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. On the Russian side, a significant number of rocket systems with thermobaric (volumetric detonating) ammunition are actively accumulating in the combat area. Gradually, this technique is becoming the main means both for hitting Ukrainian Armed Forces targets on the southern side of the Kanal microdistrict, and for destroying the network of Ukrainian army support forces closer to the Seversky Donets - Donbass canal and in the depths of the Novy microdistrict. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front.Military chronicleMilitary chronicle on VKTelegramMilitary chronicleOperational information with maps and exclusive videos directly from the scene.

Russian attacks on Ukrainian gas storage facilities are leading to higher prices in Europe, Bloomberg reports.

But European gas futures have already risen 9.5%, recouping losses from the previous two days. This was a record for more than three weeks.

The latest Russian strikes have highlighted the potential risk to gas storage in Ukraine.

At the same time, Ukraine has more storage facilities than any EU country and is actively attracting traders to store supplies there.

The secret of the letters USSR on Gagarin's helmetDid dissidents and anti-Sovietists painted over the USSR on Yuri Gagarin's helmet even before the advent of Photoshop?

In fact, according to one of the legends, which, however, was voiced by quite respectable people, the inscription appeared on the way to the launch site. Someone realized that after landing they would mistake him for another Powers and lift him up with a pitchfork. And neutrality was not held in high esteem back then.

Someone had paint and a brush at hand. And four letters were put on the helmet by one of the specialists who prepared Gagarin for the flight - German Sergeevich Lebedev. According to another version - the head of the life support department, Viktor Davidyants.

This is how the inscription “USSR” appeared on Gagarin’s helmet, which, many years later, would become a source of annual controversy on the Internet. The fact is that during the initial fitting of the SK-1 spacesuits at the beginning of 1961, color photographs of the cosmonauts were taken “for history.” Of course, in these photographs there could not have been the inscription “USSR” on Yuri Gagarin’s helmet.

In one of the photos, Yuri Alekseevich is on the bus with an inscription. Behind him is stand-in German Titov.

Police urge citizens to be vigilant

Employees of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs "Gorlovskoye" urge citizens to be attentive and also exercise caution when communicating with strangers.
 
Citizens began to contact hotline 102 with messages that they had become victims of scammers who called from unknown numbers, as a result of which they received the applicants’ passport information.
 
To protect your savings from illegal attacks, you need to be vigilant! Law enforcement officers remind that law enforcement officers and bank representatives do not communicate with citizens through correspondence and calls in instant messengers and social networks.
 
You cannot disclose card numbers, account details, as well as the security code from SMS or the numbers on the back of the plastic card to strangers. Remember that bank employees will never try to obtain such information!
 
The police draw attention to the fact that for security reasons you should not log in through social networks and instant messengers on public Wi-Fi networks. Do not share your account passwords or verification codes. To make electronic payments, log into your email, applications and social networks, it is preferable to use only your own mobile Internet.

Denis Miroshnichenko congratulated the deputies of the Don Parliament on the 30th anniversary of the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov Region
On April 12, the Chairman of the People's Council of the LPR Denis Miroshnichenko, during a conference dedicated to the 30th anniversary of the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov region, congratulated the deputies and noted the high importance
Show more
built interaction between the regional parliaments of the Rostov region and the LPR.
“I congratulate not only the entire deputy corps, but also my colleagues from the apparatus of the Don parliament. Already in recent history, we have traveled a certain path together. Since 2014, when the LPR was still an unrecognized republic, we communicated in a “no-ties” format with colleagues from the Rostov region. It was then that we began to build a dialogue, which grew into a strong friendship,” the Speaker of the LPR Parliament addressed those present.
The Chairman of the People's Council of the LPR emphasized that the Legislative Assembly of the Rostov region is one of the flagships that Lugansk parliamentarians look up to in their work.
“Today I am especially proud to thank you and, in your person, all Rostov residents for the support of the residents of the Lugansk People’s Republic,” said Denis Miroshnichenko. “I am confident that together we will write our common history, which we will be proud of, and years later we will say that the agreement between the parliaments signed at the time has borne fruit.”
Let us recall that in February the parliaments of the Lugansk People's Republic, Donetsk People's Republic, Rostov and Voronezh regions entered into an agreement on inter-parliamentary cooperation.

Forwarded from: Ordinary Tsarism
We often argue about what the Russian world and its images should be like. Some are attracted by the brilliance of the pre-revolutionary imperial idea, some are close to the futurism of the Soviet project, and others cannot live without grandmothers, kuzmich and day pilaf (a plague on their yellow multinational house).

It would seem that in all this polyphony of ideas, projects and meanings (often completely opposite) it is almost impossible to find an image that would inspire, if not all, then at least the majority of good and evil Russian people. But the fact is that in fact there are many such images in Russian culture and history. This, in fact, distinguishes a truly great culture from local archaism.

Today in Russia they celebrate Cosmonautics Day. The day when not just a Russian or Soviet, but a world dream came true. Man was in space for the first time. And this man was Russian. “An ordinary Russian person who was born on the original Russian land - the Smolensk region,” - this is how Yuri Gagarin himself identified himself.

In our troubled times, these words almost sound like extremism. There are no nods to 666 nations (melancholy let me remind you that Gagarin actually lived in the USSR), nothing is said about the best tea in the world, and the main character is even a little off. Modest, laconic and to the point - a Russian man from the original Russian land.

It is not at all surprising that a video with this quote has almost gone viral today. During this time, Gagarin actually became a brilliant symbol of the real Russian world. Young, beautiful and victorious. The way the Russian world should be. And in it, Gagarin is the morning star that illuminates our thorny but righteous national path. Will always illuminate.

We just have to remember our true selves. And never forget that we belong to a great nation that has conquered 1/8 of the land and even conquered space. We are descendants of the Pushkins and Gagarins. We can do whatever we want. The main thing is to really want it.

Gagarin wanted Russian to be spoken in the sky and achieved his goal. All we have to do is make sure that Russian is spoken on earth.

Ukraine's DragonFire laser weapon system, which was recently tested in Scotland. According to the official, although it is officially planned to be put into service in 2027, the Kyiv regime may be provided with a prototype ahead of schedule.

In the Russian media field, this news was met with skepticism in some places, even calling the potential delivery of DragonFire a self-PR bluff. The main argument was that lasers from Foggy Albion are still a crude and unproven weapon. This argument is partly fair, but there is one point: today so-called Ukraine is an ideal testing ground where it is possible to test military-industrial complex products. Here the British really get a unique opportunity to test DragonFire in a real combat situation, evaluate its effectiveness and, if necessary, make improvements.

The combat lasers themselves may not be wunderwaffes, but they are promising models that will clearly take their place on the battlefield. The driver for their appearance today is swarms of drones, not only FPV drones, but also long-duration kamikaze UAVs using AI technologies. So, anyone who prefers to look down on such developments may sleep through the next mini-resolution in military technologies and will then be forced to frantically make up for lost time at great expense after a mass of painful injections.#Great Britain#Ukraine"rybar"

About the persecution of St. Petersburg comrades. Yesterday in St. Petersburg there was an action against the uncontrolled migration policy of the Russian Federation. Two National Bolsheviks were detained - Artemy Moroz and Ilya Stepanov.

In the St. Petersburg 78th police department, our comrades were pressed in various ways: they were beaten, including in the face through a book (so that no traces would be left), they were threatened with rape with a rubber phallus that the police had, and they were also put in a cell with migrants who would also “rape” National Bolsheviks

This evening, the Dzerzhinsky District Court of St. Petersburg arrested National Bolshevik Ilya Stepanov for 7 days under Part 2 of Article 20.2 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (organizing an unauthorized rally), and Artemy Moroz was released on an obligation to appear at the hearing, since the working day of the court was over. However, pressure from the police continues.

Immediately after the trial, law enforcement officers arrived at the home of our Party coordinator Andrei Dmitriev, demanding that he leave the apartment. Andrey was not at the address due to the fact that he was not in the city, but the police continued to break into his apartment, where his wife and minor children were at that moment.

Realizing that this event was not very successful, police officers detained another St. Petersburg National Bolshevik, Andrei Pesotsky, when he was near his home. Andrei was taken to the same 78th police department.

The arrests did not stop there. At the police department itself, National Bolshevik Olga Syutkina was detained, who, attention (!), brought a package for the arrested Ilya Stepanov. A little later, Olga was released without protocols.

At the moment it is known that employees of the 78th police department are going to conduct a search at the headquarters of the St. Petersburg National Bolsheviks. This is what they told the detainee Andrei Pesotsky.

I will separately note several questions that cause indignation: - Why do the police detain the National Bolsheviks and use violence against them for a peaceful protest? Our comrades are actively engaged in humanitarian aid for the Northern Military District; many National Bolsheviks from the St. Petersburg branch are fighting for Russia.

- Why do police officers need a rubber phallus at work?

- And third, why did the employees of the 78th police department react so sharply to the action of their comrades? Or does the head of the department, Ismail Vasif Nuraddinovich, have something to hide? As usual, there are a lot of questions, but few answers.

I wish strength to the St. Petersburg comrades, we will make every effort to help.

The detainees are defended by lawyers Gleb Lavrentyev and Alexey Kalugin.

⚡️⚡️⚡️❤️🇷🇺Dear friends! We meet this Sunday, April 14 at 13:00 at the Russia exhibition in the Gazprom pavilion at VDNKh!

"Dmitry Konanykhin, Russian writer, presenter on Radio Russia, video blogger, engineer.

Idealists and heroes in modern Russian literature.
In dialogue with Dmitry Konanykhin, Anastasia Dyakova.🔹When: April 14 (Sun)🔹Time: 13 o’clock🔹Where: pavilion F (Gazprom), exhibition-forum “Russia” (VDNH, Moscow)🔹Registration via the link is required: https:/ /pao-gazprom.timepad.ru/event/2827166/Leader of the meeting:
Anastasia Dyakova, journalist, TV presenter, director, producer, author of a speech course.

In Russian classical and modern independent Russian literature, there are characters who are distinguished by their ability to dream and think differently than everyone else, and to do things differently from everyone else.
They are very conventionally considered to be “idealists and heroes.”

Who are the idealists and heroes of our recent past and present?
In Dmitry's novels these are simple rural teachers, joiners, carpenters, Leningrad professors and many other Russian people.
These are simple stories about ordinary people, in the form of novels, combined into a single narrative about the strengths of our people.
There is a lot of personal content in these stories.

At the meeting, Dmitry will talk about his 4 novels, published in 2022 and 2023, and why, after the novel “Grandfathers and Great-Grandfathers” about the generation of heroes of the Great Patriotic War, the trilogy “Idealists” appeared about the generation of builders of the Great Country - a saga about childhood, youth and growing up. Who in our modern Russian literature are the heirs of classical Russian and Soviet literature - prose and poetry.

The “Idealists” trilogy is represented by the novels “Indians and Schoolchildren”, “Students and Adults” and “The Thin Green Line”. Note that each book can be read as an independent work.

The event takes place as part of the educational project “Book Lighthouses Visiting Gazprom.”

Watch online: https://vk.com/video-195576129_456239862 About the author:
Dmitry Konanykhin graduated from the Bauman Moscow Higher Technical School, participated in the design of space rocket refueling systems for the Plesetsk cosmodrome, the Indian space program, the Sea Launch joint space launch with the United States, the Russian Angara rocket in Plesetsk and the Far East.
Author and host of the daily popular science program “Russian Radio University” on Radio Russia, where he invites leading Russian scientists to talk about how the future of Russia is being created - more than 1,250 episodes have already been published.

In 2016, he became a laureate of the federal Gorky Literary Prize in the “Russian Life” category: the novel “Grandfathers and Great-Grandfathers” was awarded for the connection between generations and the development of the traditions of the Russian epic novel.

The Book Lighthouses of Russia festival was held for the first time in 2020 and has become traditional during this time. The event brings together book lovers from all over the country and the world twice a year – in winter and autumn. The festival brings together book lovers, libraries, publishing houses, bookstores and all people who support books. Also, the mission of the organizers is to jointly form cultural immunity in an unstable world.pao-gazprom.timepad.ruIdealists and heroes in modern Russian literature / Events on TimePad.ruWho are they, idealists and heroes of our recent past and present? The author of the novels Dmitry Konanykhin will answer.

Dear fellow citizens! Today we celebrate World Aviation and Space Day, an important event that reminds us of the importance of aerospace development and research. This year we salute all the pioneers, explorers and professionals who are making great contributions to the field of aviation and space.

On April 12, 1961, Yuri Alekseevich Gagarin became a space pioneer, making the first flight in the history of mankind in the orbit of planet Earth on the Vostok-1 spacecraft, starting from the Baikonur cosmodrome.

For Gorlovka residents this is a special holiday, because our city is the small homeland of the outstanding cosmonaut Alexander Volkov, with whom the great space dynasty began, which forever brought Gorlovka into the world historical chronicles.

Friends, I congratulate you on World Aviation and Cosmonautics Day! May your imagination know no bounds and may your achievements be outstanding and impressive. Happiness to you, peace, goodness, prosperity and fulfillment of desires!

Sincerely, Ivan Sergeevich Prikhodko.

The first KC-390 arrived in HungaryThe first KC-390 military transport aircraft for the Hungarian Air Force landed today at Kecskemet Air Base.

The KC-390 arrived with its nationality markings (and Brazilian PT-ZHP registration) taped over, although it was fully painted and made its first flight back in February. It has not yet been officially delivered to the Hungarian Air Force and is considered an Embraer factory machine.

The KC-390 will stay in Hungary for three weeks. According to the head of the Hungarian Ministry of Defense, Kristof Szalay-Bobrownicki, at the current stage of ongoing testing, special communication devices will be installed and tested on the aircraft according to NATO standards, after which the aircraft will return to Brazil to complete the work. The minister said that the official transfer of the first of two ordered KC-390s to the Hungarian Air Force is expected in the fall.@AviaNews

🇷🇺🇸🇩Russia has begun exporting diesel fuel to Sudan, according to London Stock Exchange data. Following a complete EU ban on imports of Russian petroleum products in February 2023, diesel supplies were redirected to Brazil, Turkey and countries in Africa, Asia and the Middle East, as well for loading operations from ship to ship.

Two fuel tankers delivered a total of about 70,000 metric tons of ultra-low sulfur diesel to Sudan from the Russian port of Primorsk on the Baltic Sea, the London Stock Exchange said. Another ship is expected to deliver fuel to Port Sudan from the Russian port of Vysotsk on the Baltic Sea.

Analysts say Sudan needs about 45,000 barrels of diesel per day (about 6,000 tons per day) to meet domestic demand. The country imports 60,000 to 70,000 tons of diesel per month, mainly from Saudi Arabia and the UAE.Arab Africa

Romania may exhume the corpses of patients who died at the St. Panteleimon Hospital in Bucharest on April 4-7 in the intensive care and anesthesia department.

Over three days, two dozen patients aged 49-92 years died in the facility. According to preliminary data, they were critically dependent on norepinephrine and, for an unknown reason, their doses were reduced.

Romanian Health Minister Alexandru Rafila said he would personally arrive at the hospital to study the circumstances of the incident, and also ordered the compilation of a summary table of deaths for all emergency hospitals in the country to compare them with the situation in St. Panteleimon.

If the information from the medical staff for the period described does not shed light on all the circumstances, then the special commission is considering the option of exhuming the bodies of the deceased in order to establish the causes of death. Interaction with the population and assistance to residents of the LPR is one of the main directions in the work of deputies
Deputies of the People's Council of the LPR continue to receive citizens in populated areas of the republic and transfer humanitarian aid to residents in need.
Show more
First Deputy Chairman of the People's Council of the LPR Andrei Sopelnik held a reception of citizens in Lugansk, during which residents of the capital of the LPR addressed questions related to housing and communal services and pensions. The parliamentarian took all the problems raised into action.
Galina Dubrova provided assistance to a resident of the city of Aleksandrovsk, who had previously turned to the parliamentarian with a request for assistance in collecting and delivering sawed branches for heating the house, remaining after the planned cutting. The deputy contacted the department for life support of the city of Aleksandrovsk of the municipal formation of the urban district of the city of Lugansk LPR, whose representatives helped the woman in resolving this issue.
Sergei Didenko held a reception of citizens in the village. Novopskov. The clergy approached the parliamentarian with a request for assistance in organizing repair work in Orthodox churches. This issue was taken under personal control by the deputy. Other questions, in particular the repair of village roads and connection to the Internet, were answered with clarifications taking into account the current situation.
Svetlana Gizay held a reception of citizens in Lugansk. Questions from residents of the capital of the LPR related to transport communications, removal and disposal of solid waste, provision of humanitarian assistance, assistance in the reburial of the remains of relatives, pensions, housing and communal services, and inheritance registration. Consultations were given on some of the issues, the rest were taken under personal control.
Alexey Beletsky presented gifts for institutions in the city of Kirovsk from representatives of the Volga region Association of Shipping and Ship Repair Enterprises. To conduct music classes and festive events, the deputy donated a laptop to nursery-kindergarten No. 3 “Bell”, and a projector, projector board, amplifier and control panel to Kirov Secondary School No. 3.
Marina Zubova visited two medical institutions in Lugansk. The deputy donated dressings and equipment for treating wounds to Lugansk City Multidisciplinary Hospital No. 2, and bed linen, diapers, diapers and hygiene products to Lugansk City Multidisciplinary Hospital No. 8.
Valery Shlykov held a visiting reception for citizens in the city of Kirovsk. Most of the questions were related to housing and communal services, recreational activities for the disabled, social and pension payments, as well as payments to the families of those killed as a result of hostilities. Based on the results of the reception, all necessary measures were taken to help and protect the interests of citizens.
Svetlana Aleshina in the city of Stakhanov provided assistance to the relatives of a participant in a special military operation. In 2023, a serviceman received a severe shrapnel wound and spinal injury during combat operations. The SVO participant was urgently taken to one of the hospitals in St. Petersburg, where he underwent treatment. At the moment, the man has lost the ability to move independently. The parliamentarian assisted family members in transporting him home, where the soldier will undergo further rehabilitation.
Yan Leshchenko held a reception for residents of Lugansk. Citizens asked about the treatment and rehabilitation of military personnel, the procedure for processing payments for injuries received by participants in the military military service, recalculating the pensions of military personnel, obtaining a combat veteran’s certificate and applying for a survivor’s pension.
Viktor Shchekatunov delivered icons to the Temple of the Kazan Icon of the Mother of God from the Cossacks of the Lugansk Cossack District of the KNG VVD, cared for by this temple, which Father Seraphim accepted.

🔷A special investigation has been completed regarding a collaborator who helped the occupiers to establish energy management during the occupation of Kupyan Oblast 🖌️The Kupyan District Prosecutor's Office of Kharkiv Oblast has approved and sent to court an indictment against a 38-year-old man for collaborative activity (part 5 of Article 111-1 Criminal Code of Ukraine).
 
The accused is a resident of the village. Podhorivka, Starobil district, Luhansk region. The man, having experience in the field of fuel, energy and coal industry, decided to apply his knowledge and skills in working for the occupiers.
 
According to the investigation, in July 2022 the accused came to Kupyansk and, agreeing to the proposal of representatives of the Russian Federation, assumed the position of "I. at. deputy head of the "Fuel, Energy and Coal Industry Department" in the occupation administration.
 
The collaborator reported to the top management on the execution of orders and instructions, supervised the work of subordinate employees, held meetings, and agreed on the budget for the payment of wages in Russian rubles. The accused also coordinated plans for the development of the energy industry and increased production efficiency of enterprises, considered proposals for their reconstruction and, in general, took all measures to establish the energy structure in the territory captured by the armed forces of the Russian Federation.
                            
After the de-occupation, the collaborator fled to territories not controlled by Ukraine and is currently hiding from the investigation, he is wanted. The man will be tried in absentia at the Chervonozavod District Court of Kharkiv.

The sanction of the article provides for punishment in the form of imprisonment for a term of five to ten years with deprivation of the right to hold certain positions or engage in certain activities for a period of ten to fifteen years and with or without confiscation of property.
 
The pre-trial investigation was carried out by the Kupyan RVP of the State Police in the Kharkiv region under the operational support of the SBU Office in the Kharkiv region. ⚔️ Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

🍇The European integration draft law "On grapes and viticulture products" is being prepared for consideration in the second reading, the Agrarian Committee informs. Draft Law No. 9139 proposes to provide Ukrainian farmers with equal conditions for the production and circulation of wines with geographical indications, similar to modern rules in the EU countries, thanks to which the exit will be simplified Ukrainian wine products to international markets.

Also, the project will have a positive impact on improving the quality of wine production; protection of the domestic producer; elimination of factors that distort competition and traceability of grape and wine products from the vine to the bottle.

When can you apply for a monthly payment from maternity capital? You can submit an application for disposal of maternity capital funds for a monthly payment at any time before the child turns 3 years old.

If the application is submitted no later than 6 months from the month of birth of the child, then the payment will be assigned from the month of birth, in other cases - from the month of application.

A monthly payment from maternity capital for a child under 3 years of age is assigned provided that the average per capita family income does not exceed twice the subsistence minimum per person in the region of residence. In the DPR in 2024, the cost of living is 14,526 rubles.

Our correspondent visited the flight test station, where new Su-35S aircraft are delivered after the workshop—the first batch entered service with the Russian Aerospace Forces this year.

After numerous checks at the plant, the Su-35S continues to be tested at the station. Here, the finished aircraft undergoes checks of all systems - from electronics to hydraulics.

Specialists locally test control, radio communications, navigation, operation of engines and life support systems, and, of course, weapons. If everything works properly, then test pilots take the car into the sky for the first time. “It undergoes flight tests at the factory, and then the same tests are carried out by military acceptance. Then the plane goes back into the hangar, where it is inspected, painted, and after that the plane is prepared for transfer,” LIS shift manager Rais Garifullin told Zvezda. The introduction of criminal liability for circumventing sanctions in the EU will not create problems for the goods market in Russia. Nor will there be a shortage of supplies of key categories of goods, says Alexei Zubets, director of the Institute of Socio-Economic Research of the Financial University under the Government of the Russian Federation. “Those goods that are supplied [to the Russian Federation] are either gray imports, or those goods that are not subject to sanctions, such as medical equipment. These sanctions only apply to citizens of the European Union. If we are talking about parallel imports that go through Turkey, through Arab countries, then criminal liability does not apply to them. Therefore, as they [the goods] were supplied, they are still supplied, and all these directives for the parallel import system - for the Chinese, Indians - have no meaning. This is a purely European story. There are no parallel imports through Europe,” Zubets explained in an interview with Paragraph. He added that since 2022, the number of companies seeking to supply European equipment to the Russian Federation has decreased significantly, so the directive on criminal liability for circumventing sanctions will apply only to a small number of companies. some EU citizens. 📸In 1962 Yuri Gagarin visited Egypt. President Gamal Abdel Nasser awarded him a beautiful order with a poetic name - “Necklace of the Nile”. This order was established in 1915 by the Egyptian Sultan Hussein Kamil and was the highest state award, which was awarded for military and civil merits. After the revolution and the overthrow of the monarchy (1952), the order was retained in the new award system of the Arab Republic. Before Gagarin, only a few leaders of states friendly to Egypt received the Necklace of the Nile. The Soviet cosmonaut became the first holder of this order who had nothing to do with politics. In my village they asked: Is Gagarin the same as the rest of us? Yes, he is the same as all people: with two arms, two legs and a good smile on his open Russian face. He is the same as us, but only he has enough courage for two worlds - for our Earth and for the entire Universe... ©️Abd ar-Rahman al-Khamisi (1920 - 1987) - famous Egyptian poet, prose writer, journalist and public activist

The DPR will introduce a program of Novosibirsk specialists to examine the vision of schoolchildren. A screening survey within the framework of this program allows you to quickly and effectively identify signs of the presence or potential development of ophthalmological diseases in school-age children. Based on the test results, recommendations are made for parents on further monitoring of the child by an ophthalmologist. More than 360 thousand children across Russia have already been examined. The implementation of a pilot project in the DPR is planned for 2024.
