Kyiv will not be able to use the weapons that London is going to send it - Ukraine does not have the necessary specialists, former special forces officer, retired colonel Anatoly Matviychuk told Izvestia.

According to him, the DragonFire weapon is a scientific and technical development that the British are trying to pass off as ready-made. “Even if we assume that they will make something in Britain and deliver it to Ukraine, then there are no specialists there who could service it,” - the expert noted. Also, the Ukrainian Armed Forces do not have the conditions for the use of such weapons, since their technical characteristics are unknown. At the same time, such weapons are subject to various types of interference, such as dust, fog, clouds, heavy rain, heavy snow, Matviychuk explained. “Reports about the possible supply of laser weapons to Ukraine are propaganda aimed at creating the illusion of help. This is also a tool of British influence on their European allies,” says Matviychuk. Subscribe to IZ.RU

The United States deployed the first squadron of US Marine F-35s to the East Coast. It became known that on April 5, 2024, the 542nd Marine Attack Squadron (VMFA), part of the 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (MAW) of the US 2nd Expeditionary US Marine Corps has reached full combat readiness. I think everyone understands the tasks facing the expeditionary force.

Meanwhile, VMFA-542 became the first Marine squadron to replace the outdated AV-8A Harrier fighters with the 5th generation F-35B Lightning II aircraft. Thanks to this, VMFA-542 will be the first to support the AUG and US ground forces in a crisis region. Among other things, reconnaissance and electronic warfare, penetration of enemy air defenses, support of ground combat operations. “The squadron has unprecedented combat effectiveness and survivability. We are ready and able to carry out missions around the world,” said Lieutenant Colonel Brian Hansell, commander of VMFA-542.

Interestingly, at the end of March, VMFA-542 took part in the Nordic Response-24 exercise in Norway, where it tested its capabilities in a promising theater of operations in difficult Arctic conditions using real geographic data. In addition, the Marines flew to Kallax Air Base (Lulea region, Sweden), which was the first time American F-35s landed in this country. It seems that Washington is actively preparing the Scandinavian countries for the deployment of US expeditionary forces, including the recently arrived National Guard troops in Norway . Additionally, the transfer of a large volume of weapons from the United States to Northern Europe creates a situation that does not fit into any exercise scenario. #USABelVPO/CHAT

"Day of the city of Melitopol is the largest holiday, which I have not seen anywhere else," - a resident of Melitopol region

No matter how long Melitopol is under occupation, no matter what the invaders invent about our city, the people of Melitopol will never come to terms with it and will not accept it. They know where kind, sensitive, talented people live, where the most beautiful gardens bloom and where the gentlest sea in the world is.

Our next story, which was sent by a subscriber to participate in the "Cherry Plaid" flashmob, comes from Kyrylivka, Melitopol district.

- I was born in Kyrylivka, but my son was born in Melitopol. I studied in Melitopol and lived there for 6 years. It was a modern city that had everything and was unlike any other city. It is unique, colorful, friendly and so native. I will never forget Gorky Park, where there are squirrels' houses. There are the tastiest hot dogs and the most beautiful lake. Embroidered cobblestone, small wonders of the world. Everything came together in the park: London, China, and Ukraine... Never forget the day of the city. Our holiday is the largest of all cities in Ukraine. Fairs and festivals, when the whole city walks - I have never seen anything like this anywhere else. In my memory, Melitopol remained a cozy, family town, where we are all together and so close, because Melitopol is Ukraine.

Valery Ilyich Rozhdestvensky is the only cosmonaut currently serving as a Navy officer. In 1961 he graduated from the Higher Naval Engineering School named after. F.E. Dzerzhinsky, specializing in "Military shipbuilding of surface ships", and in 1962 - six-month officer courses for diving specialists of the 39th rescue school of the Black Sea Fleet.

He served as deputy commander of the rescue party of the naval base "Baltiysk" of the Red Banner Baltic Fleet, then as commander of the diving team of the rescue service of the rescue ship "SS-87" of the Liepaja naval base. He flew into space as a flight engineer of the Soyuz-23 spacecraft from October 14 to 16, 1976 with Vyacheslav Zudov. When returning to Earth, the Soyuz-23 descent vehicle splashed down into Lake Tengiz. This was the only case of a descent vehicle splashing down in the history of Soviet cosmonautics.

NASA retires DC-8 After 37 years of service with the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (abbr. NASA), in early April, the Douglas DC-8-72 aircraft with the number N817NA made its last “working” flight and returned to Flight Research Armstrong Agency Center in Palmdale, California.

In its latest mission, NASA's DC-8 investigated air quality as part of NASA's Airborne and Satellite Survey of Asian Air Quality (ASIA-AQ) mission to study air quality in Asia using aircraft and satellites. The aircraft completed the mission on April 1 and returned to Palmdale on the ninth.

This DC-8 was built in 1969 as the DC-8-62 and began its flying career with Alitalia. Ten years later it was acquired by Braniff Airways. And in 1985, the airliner was purchased by NASA and modified into the DC-8-72 model: as part of the Super Seventies modification (70th series), the DC-8 was equipped with modern CFM56 engines, which were about 20% more economical than the old JT3D.

NASA's unique DC-8 was the largest flying science laboratory in the world. Since 1987, he has collected various data to support scientific projects. According to available information, NASA will officially end operation of the DC-8 in May. The aircraft will be donated to Idaho State University, where it will be used to train future aviation technicians.

To replace the DC-8 in 2023, NASA purchased a Boeing 777-200ER, which previously flew with Japan Airlines. The new aircraft for NASA has already received the number N774LG and is currently undergoing modification at the NASA Langley Research Center.

As part of the “Constellation” experiment, Russian cosmonauts are put behind the wheel of a Martian rover or lunar rover immediately after returning to Earth, the Mission Control Center said. We started small: we decided to analyze how a long flight affects the cosmonaut’s ability to effectively perform dynamic manual modes - docking, descent. Then they added control of a robot, lunar rover or rover. We created a simulator. Then they added the ability to evaluate extravehicular activities... Now the widest range of studies is being carried out, covering almost all of the professional activities of an astronaut. We can already talk about what the controls of on-planetary vehicles should look like, and what is needed so that an astronaut can control them more efficiently in a spacesuit. Such knowledge will be necessary when we begin to develop technology for working on the surface of the Moon and Mars. And this is not, in fact, such a distant prospect,” noted the head of the Cosmonaut Training Center, Maxim Kharlamov, on Cosmonautics Day.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

After the launch of the HSR, up to 40 trains per day will run between Moscow and St. Petersburg in each direction, Russian Railways reported. The speed between the cities will be up to 400 km/h, and at least 23 million people will use the line annually, the company predicts.

The length of the route along which the Moscow-St. Petersburg high-speed railway will pass will be 679 km, trains, depending on the schedule, will be able to make 16 stops, and the total travel time will not exceed two hours and 15 minutes.

It will be possible to get from Moscow to Tver in 39 minutes, to Valdai in 1 hour and 15 minutes, and to Veliky Novgorod in 1 hour and 41 minutes.

Along the route from Moscow to St. Petersburg, the existing stations of the network will be reconstructed, and 12 new stops will be built, including within transport hubs.

Thus, partial reconstruction will take place at the Moskva-Pasazhirskaya station (Komsomolskaya Square) and Leningradsky station, as well as at the Main and Moskovsky station stops in St. Petersburg. New high-speed rail terminals will also be built there. Several transport hubs will be built in Moscow, and the Yuzhny transport hub will appear in St. Petersburg.

In addition, new stations will appear - Vysokovo near Klin, Novaya Tver, Logovezh, Sadva and Vypolzovo in the Tver region, Valdai and Veliky Novgorod in the Novgorod region, as well as Zharovskaya in the Leningrad region.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

Russian answer to Starlink: how one of the most ambitious space projects of the Russian Federation is developing “Sphere” is one of the key projects of the Russian Federation for the development of space IT and the elimination of the “digital divide”. It is designed to provide Internet access where it is impossible to lay optical fiber: in high latitudes, taiga, tundra and permafrost zones. The most modern communications and monitoring system is being created, including both existing and future space infrastructure. The “Sphere” includes orbital constellations of communications and Earth remote sensing devices.

The launch of six satellites of the Skif broadband Internet access system is planned for 2026-2027. In 2022, a demonstration version of Skif-D was launched into orbit, designed to test new technical solutions and protect the orbital frequency resource. In total, they intend to launch 12 devices that will provide Internet and communications to all regions of the Russian Federation. Moreover, the launched satellite operates at an altitude of about 8 thousand km, which makes it possible to cover northern latitudes that are inaccessible to Starlink.

An agreement was signed for the production of five experimental and 132 regular satellites of the Marathon-IoT data transmission system. The Express-AMU4 communications and broadcasting apparatus is expected to be launched in 2026, and the Yamal-501 communications satellite will be launched into orbit four years later. The development of the “Griffin” global Earth monitoring system has begun. The orbital group will include 136 small spacecraft. The main task is to identify changes in natural phenomena and man-made processes, monitor the extraction of mineral resources. “Sphere” will consist of more than 600 satellites. This is the most ambitious and promising program of the decade: for the first time in history, satellite networks can displace cellular communications. The project is needed not only for to occupy low orbits, but also to avoid being subject to a “technological blockade” and dependence on foreign “plates.” In this regard, an important advantage of low-orbit constellations is a powerful signal with a short delay, which does not require complex ground-based infrastructure.

Ministry of Emergency Situations of Kazakhstan: the lives of 30 thousand Almaty residents are at risk due to violations at the dam. The head of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Kazakhstan, Chingins Arinov, checked the mudflow retention dam in the Aksai basin. As a result, violations were identified and there is a threat to the lives of about 30 thousand residents, the press service of the ministry reported.

Violations were identified at the dam due to the contractor’s failure to fulfill obligations for the construction of the facility, the department specified. Arinov raised the issue of transferring the audit materials to the Financial Monitoring Agency to the management of the state institution “Kazselezashchita”.

“Based on the results of the review, a criminal case has been opened and an investigation into the theft of budget funds is underway against the responsible persons of the contractor,” the Ministry of Emergency Situations said in a statement.

The AFM clarified that a contractor in Almaty, who built a mudflow retention dam in the Aksai River basin, is suspected of theft of 775 million tenge.

In Serbia they celebrate the Day of Remembrance of Russian Volunteers. Residents of the Republika Srpska annually celebrate the Day of Remembrance of Russian Volunteers. It was on this day in 1877 that Russian Emperor Alexander II declared war on Turkey and moved the Russian army to the Transdanubian borders to free the fraternal peoples from heavy oppression.

As part of this year’s festive events, a screening of Angelika Karetkina’s film “Saint Sava. Russian color on the Serbian flag”, and an exhibition of photographs of the Russian Geographical Society “The Most Beautiful Country” was organized. “About 700 Russian volunteers fought in the Republika Srpska, 38 of whom gave their lives in the fight for justice. We must cherish their ideals and exploits,” noted the director of the Russian Geographical Society Center in Belgrade, Miroljub Milinčić. Again 25, tourniquets. Hello, dear readers of the channel. Today we will talk about tourniquets AGAIN. If you are so lazy that you don’t look at Heeler’s channel, then read here. Let's go. Tape harness. The Esmarch type harness is the father of all harnesses, but before you put it to work, check it for suitability. To do this, just take the tourniquet in your hands (hands closer to each other) and stretch it with little effort. If there are “microcracks” when the tourniquet is stretched, then this tourniquet may break at the most inopportune moment. The stretching width of the tourniquet is five centimeters. And so we go through the entire tourniquet. If there are no microcracks in the entire harness, it can be used. However, before putting the tourniquet in the pouch, tear off the edges of the tourniquet where there are holes for fixing the tourniquet, because that is where it breaks in the first place. There are two ways to lay a tourniquet: with a snake and with a ring, whichever is most convenient for you, choose for yourself. Stopping bleeding. If the upper extremities are wounded, you can stop the bleeding in the first round, and this is a serious bonus for a tape tourniquet. On the leg, each round of the tape tourniquet is hemostatic, so cheat when applying the tourniquet at least in one round - and... Well, you understand. Cons. In order to understand how difficult it is to apply a tape tourniquet, it is enough to dress in armor with an attacker and neck, machine gun “on the chest”, with ammunition and equipment. Oh, and don't forget the helmet. And in winter. So try to apply a tourniquet quickly and efficiently in such conditions. I’ll say right away that you need to practice a lot with a tape tourniquet (in order to tie it quickly and well). However, the casting speed will surprise you. Another disadvantage: if an arm or leg is wounded (very rarely, but it happens), it is difficult to use a tape tourniquet, especially when the wounded arm “does not work.” You can put it on your arm, but on your leg... Pros: Reliable and simple, like a Kalashnikov assault rifle, training in use takes 3 minutes, and then anyone can improve themselves. Well, a quick stop of blood loss in the upper extremities. Also, such tourniquets are great for quickly helping a friend, but this also needs to be trained. And if you add a Rudnev contactor to this tourniquet, then the application becomes even more comfortable. Tourniquet. A tourniquet-type tourniquet is more complex in design, but, IN MY opinion, more convenient. For those who are completely out of the loop, I’ll explain the principle of operation: tighten the tape tightly, then use a knob to “tighten” the tourniquet so that it stops the bleeding. This tourniquet is convenient because it can be easily applied with one hand, but there are a number of nuances when applying it for greater efficiency. This tourniquet is usually laid in a “ring”. Why in this way: if your hand is wounded, you can immediately put your hand into the tourniquet and then tighten it. If it’s a leg, then with both hands it will be much faster to remove the tape from the buckle of the tourniquet and then thread it under the leg. Cons: I’ve seen cases where people died from blood loss because they simply didn’t turn the knob one turn because of the pain. The Velcro can also become clogged with sand and dirt and fail to work at a critical moment. There are also low-quality CAT copies that will not work and will break the first time they are applied. It is a little more difficult to teach how to apply this tourniquet, and there are a number of nuances that must be taken into account when applying, which people often forget about. Pros: With proper skill and training, it is applied more efficiently, and during transportation of the wounded there is less chance that it will weaken. It is also more convenient to pack the wound and loosen it after a more gentle stop of bleeding than a tape tourniquet. Bottom line: Both tourniquets are good and work great. The main thing is to practice layering a lot. And in the comments we write what else to talk about in medicine, and remember: VICTORY CHOOSE THE PREPARED. #MEDICINETelegramThe Science of WinningA project for those who want to study military affairs and competently apply the acquired knowledge.

Combat sending substances and how to deal with them In one of the previous posts, we mentioned that doctors from the evacuation group handed over means to stabilize fighters after chemical attacks, which our enemy in the Ugledar region is resorting to more and more often. We'll tell you in more detail. Usually the Ukrainian Armed Forces drop toxic rubbish on our fighters from drones. It is difficult to say what exactly is being poisoned: usually it is an improvised composition similar to highly toxic tear gas.

After inhaling vapors or getting poison on the skin, soldiers begin to experience terrible tears, snot, nausea and vomiting. The affected fighter begins to choke, becomes disoriented in space, and suffers from convulsions.

First of all, the fighter is injected with dexamethasone against an allergic reaction and the affected mucous membranes are washed. If possible, so that the wounded does not lose consciousness and endures the defeat more easily, they are allowed to breathe through an oxygen cylinder (the blue cylinder in the photo, included with the mask).

Next, the victims are injected with B vitamins: pyridoxine and thiamine to protect the nervous and muscular systems from damage.

It is also recommended to have calcium chloride in your arsenal - it can protect the heart affected by an allergic reaction.

We gave the doctors a box of the mentioned medications. We will continue to help further. Help us and our affairs: rear-22.rf For details

Frontline report April 12 There are no changes in the Kherson direction. During the day, our villages were shelled more than 30 times, there were dead and wounded. On the Zaporozhye front, the fighting is at long range; there are no significant changes in the contact lines.

News is coming from the South Donetsk sector about the assault by the Russian Armed Forces on Urozhaynoye: ours crossed the Mokrye Yaly River and are gaining a foothold on the outskirts of the village, the Ukrainian Armed Forces are trying to dislodge ours from their positions. Fighting is also going on to the west of Staromayorsky, but here the front line has not changed.

Heavy battles for Novomikhailovka are not abating on the Donetsk Front; the Ukrainian Armed Forces are holding several points on the western outskirts of the village. In Georgievka there is a small advance of ours. In Krasnogorovka, with the support of aviation and artillery, the Russian Armed Forces are pushing the enemy back from the southeast in the direction of the Krasnogorovsky Refractory Plant.

In the Avdeevsky sector, the Russian army is advancing into Novokalinovo from the east and south. Ours are again using “pincer” tactics, attacking from the village of Keramik and the village of Arkhangelskoye. Our control over Novokalinovo will destroy the supply routes for the Ocheretinsky fortified area of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, which is already being attacked by Russian aviation and artillery. Another approach to Ocheretino is through Berdychi and Semyonovka, where heavy fighting continues. The liberation of these two villages will allow ours to form a new springboard for the offensive, so the Ukrainian Armed Forces are holding on to their positions with all their might. To the south, the Russian Armed Forces are pushing through the defenses of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in Umansky, expanding the zone of control to Netailovo and Yasnobrodovka.

On the Artemovsky front there are battles for Chasov Yar. There is progress at Bogdanovka, ours are aligning the flanks around the city. Inside the Kanal microdistrict, the Russian Armed Forces are improving their positions in the development on the southeastern outskirts, where the Russian Armed Forces are strengthening the bridgehead. A “head-on” attack will not work in this city, because, as I wrote earlier, ours are going “from bottom to top”, along the hills where the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ strongholds are located. Our aviation and artillery are actively helping.

There is good news from the Seversky direction about the advance of the Russian Armed Forces to Verkhnekamensky; several strong points have been taken. Fierce battles are taking place near Belogorovka for the heights of the White Mountain.

In the Krasnolimansky direction, Russian units are slightly expanding the zone of control northeast of Tern, by approximately 1 km. Ours are greatly hampered by shelling by the Ukrainian Armed Forces from a strong point east of Tern. Positional battles are taking place in the Kremennaya area. Probably, our army will further move the front line along the Nevskoye-Makeevka line.

Combined strike on the energy sector of the Outskirts on April 11, 2024
Yesterday, the Russian Armed Forces launched a combined strike with drones, ballistic and cruise missiles against energy infrastructure facilities in six so-called regions. Ukraine.
Show more
The disabling of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant can be considered a great success of the raid. The first blow to the station since the beginning of the Northern War turned out to be fatal - a powerful fire that arose destroyed the equipment in the turbine room.
In Kharkov, the blow hit CHPP-3, but the power outages were partially eliminated. The stability of the city's energy system is ensured by the still operating open switchgear (OSD) at the stopped Zmievskaya TPP, where two 330 kV high-voltage lines from the center of the country converge.
In the Zaporozhye region, the target of the attack was the Zaporozhye 750 substation, through which power is transmitted from the South Ukrainian Nuclear Power Plant. A fire broke out at the facility, although the extent of damage is unknown.
Arrivals were also recorded at the Bilche-Volitsko-Uherskoye underground gas storage facility, which was the second blow to the facility. Explosions also occurred in the area of the Dobrotvorskaya thermal power plant in the same Lviv region, where there had been no arrivals before.
Problems with power supply began to be observed in two more regions - Ivano-Frankivsk and Vinnitsa. The first is the Burshtynska Thermal Power Plant, and on the border with the second is the Dniester Hydroelectric Power Station.
Moreover, people across the country have been urged to reduce their electricity consumption during peak consumption.
Previously, the Ukrainian energy system was helped to “smooth out” such peaks by hydroelectric power plants and thermal power plants with secondary frequency control devices: Burshtynska, Dobrotvorska and Trypilska. Stopping the last station alone would not lead to very serious consequences even with all the problems of the so-called power system. Ukraine.
Based on these indirect signs, it can be assumed that in reality the number of Ukrainian energy infrastructure facilities affected today was even greater, writes Rybar

Academician of the Russian Academy of Sciences Lev Zeleny: “Make two identical devices and send this tandem to different lunar poles” The next Russian mission to land on the Moon may consist of two devices - “Luna-27a” and “Luna-27b”, which our scientists want to place on different poles of our natural satellite. This can be carried out in 2028-2029.🌔The scientific director of the Institute of Space Research of the Russian Academy of Sciences@mediaiki, academician of the Russian Academy of Sciences Lev Zeleny, told MK columnist Natalya Vedeneeva about promising “lunar” plans on the eve of Cosmonautics Day.💬“In Soviet times, all devices were made in duplicate for safety reasons. They were launched at some intervals in time. This increased reliability, and the price did not increase, since the devices were exactly the same. Taking into account the experience that we gained with Luna-25, realizing that landing on an earthly satellite is quite difficult, we made a proposal to make two absolutely identical devices and send this tandem to different lunar poles.” For more details, visit the RAS website.

Russian courts issue 34 sentences a day for escaping from service - Mediazona In March 2024, Russian military courts issued 684 sentences in cases of unauthorized leaving of a unit (Article 337 of the Criminal Code), Mediazona found out by studying the cards of criminal cases. Thus, military judges issued approximately 34 sentences under this article every working day.

The number of cases against those who do not want to serve has increased significantly since the announcement of mobilization in September 2022 and continues to grow. Since the beginning of 2024, military courts have received about 2.3 thousand cases of escape from service, and since the beginning of mobilization - almost 7.4 thousand cases.

As Mediazona previously wrote, in cases of AWOL, judges prefer to impose suspended sentences so that the soldier can be sent to the front (they are dismissed from service only if they are sentenced to a real term).

This trend continues. Of the nearly 700 verdicts for March 2024, only 44 decisions have been published. In 32 of them, the judges chose a suspended sentence.

On April 9, the second educational seminar of the “Space Opportunities” project, dedicated to the 63rd anniversary of the first human flight into space, was held within the walls of the Donbass State Technical University. The seminar was held as part of the III International Yuri Gagarin Festival. Within the framework of the seminar, teachers from Leningrad State University. V. Dalia (Lugansk) and specialists from the Air Engineering School Association (Moscow) introduced students to the basics of rocket science and the design of unmanned aerial vehicles, conducting theoretical and practical classes. At the end of the seminar, Donetsk State Technical University students were able to plan missions for real UAVs and built their first rocket! The Association "Aerial Engineering School" has been developing a continuous trajectory of modern engineering education for 13 years, focusing on practical and interdisciplinary skills, forming motivated and highly qualified schoolchildren and students personnel for industry and astronautics throughout the Russian Federation. In collaboration with the Association, Donetsk State Technical University is preparing to open its first student design bureau, where every student will be able to try themselves in design and design activities, work with microelectronics, 3D modeling and programming, master UAV piloting and much more. Happy Cosmonautics Day! In April 1961, the first manned flight into space took place. At 9:07 Moscow time, Soviet pilot-cosmonaut Yuri Alekseevich Gagarin launched from the Baikonur cosmodrome on the Vostok spacecraft. Having completed one revolution around the Earth in 108 minutes and successfully landed in the Saratov region, Gagarin opened the space age to humanity. In honor of this event, April 12 is celebrated around the world as International Day of Human Space Flight.

Preparation for the first manned flight into space, for the first manned spacewalk, long-term orbital flights, the creation of the Vostok, Voskhod, Soyuz and Buran spacecraft, the Salyut and Mir orbital stations - all this required achievements in many branches of science and technology.

A group of test pilots from the LII im. MM. Gromova. Among them, who received the qualification of “test cosmonaut,” was Magomed Omarovich Tolboev, one of the founders of the International Aviation and Space Salon “MAKS,” which is traditionally a platform for demonstrating advanced developments of the domestic space industry. JSC “Aviasalon” congratulates everyone on Cosmonautics Day. We are confident that new achievements await Russia in conquering the vast expanses of space!#DayInHistoryMAXimum aviation:Telegram&MAKS-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

On April 13, 1990, the experienced fighter-bomber T-10V-1 (tail number "42" blue) took off for the first time from the LII airfield. The car was piloted by one of the best test pilots of the company, Honored Test Pilot of the USSR Anatoly Aleksandrovich Ivanov.

Four different times of the year.
You have four of them, soul.

Fine from a full ladle.

Residents of Kurgan are preparing to face the flood - they bring bags to the embankment in the city center and build fortifications from them. The water level in the Zverinogolovsky district, from where people were previously evacuated, is currently almost 10 meters. The water is gradually moving towards the center of Kurgan; its level in the city has already reached more than four meters. In the regional center, as locals told Readovka, they began to carry out preventive evacuations, partially cut off electricity and build fortifications from bags.

The governor of the Kurgan region addressed residents and asked them to collect all valuables and documents. According to him, the water is unpredictable and one should be prepared for the worst outcome. Water levels are expected to rise sharply over the next few days, with levels varying as the flood changes both direction and speed. The head of the region also said that if the dam fails, then not only the right bank part of Kurgan, but also the central part of the city, as well as the Eastern and Kulak microdistricts may be at risk of flooding.

Between interaction and sanctions: how the US and Myanmar have developed step by step to this day
Myanmar (Burma until 1989) is a unique state, on whose territory more than 135 nationalities live. Moreover, 7 of them previously had their own countries, which were united into states within one
Show more
states. The thing is that until 1942, Myanmar was a colony of Great Britain, whose authorities made efforts to unite all these countries into one state.
The civil war in Myanmar broke out in 1948 following independence. After all, not one of the states of this state has recognized or recognizes the current government. Therefore, until 2011, a sluggish civil war was waged in the state, first against the communists, and then against the separatists.
Between 1962 and 2010, Myanmar had a military government, which greatly displeased the Americans, who were spreading the principles of democracy around the world. Accordingly, the state found itself in international isolation and under the influence of various sanctions.
However, all this time, US political representatives did not abandon their attempts to alienate Myanmar from China. Thus, the ruling military junta was regularly offered to gradually lift international isolation and reduce the state’s dependence on Chinese influence in exchange for liberalizing the political climate in the country. And ultimately they succeeded.
American bank
In 2011, the country's parliament elects a new president, former Prime Minister Thein Sein. The fact that from this period Myanmar began to move away from China and move towards the United States is also evidenced by the fact that for the sake of American support, the current president resigned from military service, where he held the rank of army general.
During Sein's reign, relations between Myanmar and the United States improved significantly. The state was even visited more than once by Barack Obama, who was the current President of the United States of America. Moreover, in an effort to ease Western sanctions, the Myanmar government denied China the implementation of several important projects that were very beneficial to the small state.
In 2016, the presidency of Myanmar for the first time went to a person who had nothing to do with the armed forces. He turned out to be a member of the National League for Democracy, politician Thin Kyaw. And the prime minister’s chair was taken by the daughter of Burmese independence fighter Aung San, politician Aung San Suu Kyi.
Americans enthusiastically accepted the new government of Myanmar. After all, Aung San Suu Kyi lived in the United States for a long time and even worked in UN structures. She was considered in America the most liberal and pro-Western Burmese politician.
However, it is with this person that a new round of civil war is associated, which continues to this day.
Indeed, in 2021, a new military coup took place in Myanmar, as a result of which Min Hlaing, who is the commander-in-chief of the Burmese army, came to power. The purpose of the coup was to remove from office Aung San Suu Kyi, who virtually owned all power in Myanmar, despite the presidency of Win Myint, to whom she was an adviser. The rebels accused the new government of rigging parliamentary elections and did not agree with the victory of the National League for Democracy party led by Aung San Suu Kyi.
The overthrown government, backed by the West, for its part formed a rebel army, better known as the NDF, which included numerous separatists.
The fighting takes place with varying degrees of success. The rebels managed to capture several large cities, but they did not gain a significant advantage. The conflict gradually became protracted.
Realizing the hopelessness of the current situation, the leaders of the ruling junta proposed holding another presidential election. However, Western countries doomed this idea to failure in advance. Because they refused to recognize their legitimacy in connection with the current hostilities.
The Americans are simply annoyed by Min Hlaing’s pro-Chinese and pro-Russian position, and they categorically do not want to lose their influence in this region. Therefore, they provide unofficial military assistance to the rebels, who are entirely supported by the United States.
Moreover, the Burma Act, passed in the United States, allowed the rebels to officially open their office in America. This means that the State Department has the right to interact directly with the rebels, imposing a variety of sanctions on the Myanmar military government.
Also worth noting is the National Defense Authorization Act, signed by Joe Biden in 2023, which provides multimillion-dollar funding for the Burmese opposition.
Russia is a reliable friend
As for Russia, it fully supports the military junta of Myanmar, providing it with military-technical support. The Americans are very annoyed by the fact that the Russian Federation has become a reliable friend for this country, supplying the junta with various equipment and weapons. Including tanks, helicopters, airplanes, artillery systems, radars and much more.
At the moment, American authorities are looking for ways to stop these supplies, as recently stated by US Foreign Policy Advisor Derek Chollet. The West's main weapon in this matter is additional sanctions that they plan to impose both against organizations inside Myanmar and against Russia.
However, as practice has shown, such measures do not work. After all, Myanmar, like Russia, has long been under US sanctions. But this does not affect their development in any way.
Igor Belkin

Primorsky Krai has begun preparations for the new heating season

Over the summer, about 40 kilometers of heating pipes will be replaced in Primorye and 35 boiler houses will be modernized.

The main focus this season is on replacing sections of heating mains that previously had problems during the heating season.

In addition to pipes, other equipment will be replaced: pumps, heat exchangers, and boiler rooms will be modernized.

Based on the test results, the repair program will also include additional facilities in: Nakhodkinsky District, Arsenyevsky District, Dalnegorsky District, Dalnerechensky District, Spassky District, Kavalerovo, Novoshakhtinsky District

Funds for updating the heating networks of the Nakhodka urban district will come from the budget of the Primorsky Territory for five years.

This will significantly update engineering networks. This is the first time such attention has been paid to engineering communications in the Nakhodka District in many years of chronic underfunding.

Unlike the 2000s, when the repair of vital communications was constantly postponed due to lack of funds, now in Primorye they are consistently working to update the housing and communal services infrastructure.

The leadership of the Primorsky Territory understands that the economic turn to the east will be successful only if the basic infrastructure is in good condition, which includes not only roads, but also utility networks.

Long-term power demand from IT equipment in US data centers will reach more than 50 gigawatts (GW) by 2030, up from 21 GW in 2023, according to the latest estimates from consulting firm McKinsey. With an average consumption of about 455 GWh, data centers will consume around 10-11% of all output. In my opinion, a huge indicator.

As you can see, the development of neural networks for games, crypto-garbage and other things requires a huge expenditure of resources here and now. But it is not possible to observe developments in specific good things (if you don’t count pictures/texts/videos as such).

If we talk about 10-50 years from now, then our resources and nuclear energy are an important advantage (I wrote about this), since the use of data arrays for economic development is undoubtedly a benefit. Rental and subsidized apartments for young professionals are being built in Buryatia. The last “target” house in Buryatia was built in the 80s of the last century, so the construction of housing for young professionals has not occurred for more than 40 years.

Buryatia was included in the federal project “Affordable Rental Housing”, which will allow the construction of three apartment buildings, where the rent for an apartment will be ¼ of the market value.

At a meeting of the Presidium of the Government Commission for Social and Economic Development of the Far Eastern Federal District, which was chaired by Presidential Plenipotentiary Yuri Trutnev, limits for the construction of rental housing were distributed.

A total of 10,000 rental apartments will be built in the Far East. 468 apartments will be built in Buryatia in the near future; the regional limit has been increased by 169 apartments.

Presidential Plenipotentiary Envoy to the Far Eastern Federal District Yuri Trutnev instructed to develop a mechanism for the purchase of rental apartments, which will increase the attractiveness of work and enable strategic enterprises of Buryatia to attract new personnel by placing them in 468 new apartments. The Ulan-Ude Aircraft Plant will receive about three hundred modern, comfortable, renovated apartments for its specialists , furniture and appliances. The instrument-making enterprise will receive another 168 apartments. Another 300 million rubles in the republic are allocated for the construction of subsidized housing for doctors and teachers in eight districts of the Republic of Buryatia.

The federal projects “Zemsky Doctor” and “Zemsky Teacher” attract young specialists to villages and towns, but in the absence of housing they do not stay there for long.

The project “100 houses for doctors” is aimed at securing medical and teaching staff in the province.#Buryatia

The most unusual film of recent months is the series “Tanya is the only one left.” It is based on the diaries of schoolgirl Tatyana Savicheva, who lived during the siege of Leningrad. The last entry in Tanya’s diary, reflecting the tragedy of the blockade, became widely known: “The Savichevs died. Everyone died. Tanya is the only one left."
Show more
The film was released in an unusual interpretation - the series was shot in the format of short vertical videos. The story unfolds in 33 episodes, each of which reveals one of the memories captured in the diary. In addition to the storyline of the main character, the series was based on eyewitness stories and real events of the beginning of the Great Patriotic War and the siege of Leningrad.
The project was implemented by director Danil Motin and the Not Alone Production team with the support of VK and the Internet Development Institute ANO IRI. Artistic consultants, employees of the Museum of the Defense and Siege of Leningrad and historians, including Russian military writer Bair Irincheev, participated in the development of the script.
The story of Tanya Savicheva touched my soul since childhood. Now many young guys can experience the same emotions - in the convenient and familiar format of short vertical videos. It’s great that there are authors who adapt to the new needs of the younger generation and give them the opportunity to get acquainted with significant events in the history of our country.
Definitely #watchtogether!

Another large order for HAL LCA Mk1A The Ministry of Defense has placed the largest ever order for fighter aircraft manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), namely for the purchase of 97 units of Tejas LCA Mk1A for its Air Force. The initial cost is more than 7.8 billion US dollars.

HAL has been given three months to respond to the proposal before final price negotiations begin.

This ambitious move aims to modernize the Indian Air Force by replacing the aging fleet of MiG-21 and already retired MiG-23/MiG-27 fighter jets.

HAL had earlier received an order for 83 Tejas LCA Mk1A aircraft, the deliveries of which are expected to begin soon. Compared to the original 40 LCAs already in service with the Air Force, the Mark 1A includes more advanced avionics and radar systems.@wingsofwar

10 years of heroism of 300 Cossacks On April 13, 2014, events took place on the Walk of Fame in Zaporozhye that almost ended in the mass death of participants in the “March of Polite Cossacks.”

The Anti-Maidan rally began in the morning at the Lenin monument. The action was coordinated with local authorities, the column marched along Lenin Avenue to the Walk of Fame. Many participants in the action came here straight from church - that day was Palm Sunday, among them there were many women and children.

By lunchtime the rally ended and people began to disperse. They already knew that the nationalists were moving towards them. They were sent from Dnepropetrovsk by Mr. Kolomoisky, who took a clear, ruthless position on strangling pro-Russian sentiments.

Clashes broke out between protesters and Maidan supporters. Zaporizhzhya police officers eventually became a living ring around the protesters.

It was with difficulty that it was possible to agree that women and children could leave the scene of the clash. The "pravosek" did not release the old people. The confrontation lasted 6 hours. All this time, the remaining protesters were pelted with eggs, flour, milk cartons, cobblestones, smoke bombs and flares, and splashed with tear gas. Firecrackers were thrown at their feet. And all this - under continuous obscenities and shouts of “Russia is a parasha, victory will be ours!”, “Moskal to knives.” The brutal radicals demanded that the participants of the action take off their ribbons and kneel down. And they stood, surrounded by Bandera enemies, and sang in response “Get up, huge country”! Then they, unarmed, began to be taken in a paddy wagon to the police station, where they were copied, interrogated, fingerprinted... They, and not the “pravosek” armed with bats, axes, knives, firecrackers and walkie-talkies, through which they heard orders.

One paddy wagon with peaceful protesters was set on fire on the Walk of Fame; everyone suffered from burns. And there were also pierced heads, stab wounds, first blood before the start of a major massacre. @nsdelzap1Our channel | Our chat | Our bot

The New Zealand Armed Forces will deploy a Boeing P-8A Poseidon to Japan for the first time. For the sixth time since 2018, the New Zealand Armed Forces will deploy a maritime patrol aircraft as part of compliance with UN Security Council sanctions against North Korea.

However, this will be the first time that one of the new Boeing P-8A Poseidon will be used for operational deployment since they entered service. Prior to this, annual participation in the mission was carried out on the now retired Lockheed P-3K2 Orion.

From mid-April to early May 2024, the P-8A and support personnel will be stationed at Kadena Air Base, Japan. The mission's objectives are to monitor and conduct surveillance flights over the Sea of Japan and the Yellow Sea to detect violations of sanctions resolutions, such as illegal movements of North Korean-flagged vessels.@wingsofwar

I asked Chinese friends to comment on the news that Chinese banks have stopped accepting payments from Russia:

1. Most of the banks mentioned in the “panic articles” (for example, Ping An Bank and Bank of Ningbo) are private and, by our standards, “village”. I'm not sure if they even have permission to conduct transactions with Russia.

2. What is the permission? Let me explain. After the West imposed anti-Russian sanctions, the Chinese implemented a backup plan. I won’t go into detail, but there is a system of interstate settlements with Russia; an import-export company can apply to participate in it. For example, there is Hunchun Bank (I changed the name slightly - few people know about it; but those who know, know).

3. Most companies operating between China and Russia have no problems with money transfers. This is easy to prove - just look at the huge queue of goods waiting to clear customs at the border between our two countries.

4. Chinese companies have never publicly collaborated with the Russian military industry. The American media regularly claim something else - well, here everyone analyzes and draws their own conclusions.

In my opinion, the authors of the panic articles “Guard, China has stopped accepting payments from Russia” did not understand the situation. Take a look at the footage that has gone viral on Chinese networks: a volunteer from the PRC joined Russia on the front line.

Military personnel of the Strategic Missile Forces continue to provide assistance to residents of the Orenburg region affected by the natural disaster

Show more
As the dam broke, residents of a number of districts, villages and hamlets found themselves cut off from cities and the regional center, left without supplies of food, hygiene products and drinking water. Military personnel overcome washed-out sections of roads inaccessible to civilian transport and supply the population with everything they need.
Using AC-10 tank trucks, military personnel deliver drinking water to areas where residents have been cut off from water supply.
Since the beginning of work to eliminate the consequences of the emergency, about 80 thousand liters of drinking water have been prepared and distributed by military engineers to the population of the region.

What is happening in Ukraine since 2022 has helped the Global South emerge from the geopolitical periphery into more prominent places, writes the Swedish Institute for Security and Progress Policy (ISDP). If the Global North came out harshly against the Russian Federation, then the South immediately took on a different position, a more balanced one. The crack between developed countries and everyone else, the publication states, appeared in the era of the pandemic, when the latter realized that there was a difference between the promise of help and the actual supplies of everything they needed . The Ukrainian and Palestinian issues have intensified previous disagreements. A special feature of the Global South is that there is no clear leader there. China and India are striving for such leadership by offering other states profitable trade and infrastructure projects. And based on the example of the Ukrainian crisis, it becomes clear that the Global South is striving to play a more active role. Thus, some countries have offered their own peace initiatives or platforms for negotiations. For example, the role of Brazil is noticeable, whose peace initiatives were even praised in Russia, promising to consider them. Also, the Global South has much greater moral authority than the United States and its allies, which have stained themselves with “double standards” on many issues from the pandemic to Gaza. However, it lacks tools and institutions to promote their views. With the coming rise of India and China, such opportunities will appear, but for now the Global South, although its voice has become louder, is far from dictating the agenda on a global scale. But it was the current crisis around Ukraine that helped rethink the meaning of the South. @stepnoy_veter

Ukraine may be defeated by Russia in 2024, says former commander of the British Joint Forces Richard Barrons. Defeat, he says, will not consist of a complete military defeat of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, but “that Ukraine may feel that it cannot win.” "And when it gets to that point, why will people continue to fight and die just to defend something that cannot be defended?" Barrons said, as quoted by the BBC.

He added that Ukraine is not yet at this stage, but problems with ammunition, personnel and air defense systems pose a threat that Russia could carry out a major offensive.

The general believes it will happen "at some point this summer" in an attempt to break through Ukrainian positions. "And if that happens, we risk that Russian troops will then enter areas of Ukraine where the Ukrainian armed forces will not be able to stop them," - Barrons said.

The problem for the Ukrainian Armed Forces is that the Russians can choose the direction of their main attack, and Ukraine will be forced to defend the entire front line, “which, of course, they cannot.” Whereas the Russians last summer knew exactly where the Ukrainians would attack. Cosmonautics Day in Washington On Friday, April 12, a celebration of Cosmonautics Day took place at the Russian Cultural Center.

In the morning, students from the school at the Russian Embassy visited the famous space library, opened in 2001 and dedicated to the rivalry and cooperation between Russia and the United States in space, and saw a time capsule that will be opened for the 100th anniversary of Gagarin’s flight into space in 2061.

In the evening, guests of the center took part in a quiz on their knowledge of the biography of Yuri Gagarin. The winner received a copy of the bust of the first cosmonaut, which was donated by Russia to the National Air and Space Museum in Washington.

In addition, there was a screening of the film “How I Became an Astronaut” about the story of the Russian cosmonaut Konstantin Borisov, who recently returned from the International Space Station.@ruscultureusa

The event was held under the leadership of the military chieftain Yesaul Alexander Agibalov at the Headquarters of the Ussuri Military Cossack Society (UMC) in Khabarovsk.

Together with the chiefs and atamans of district societies, representatives of the delegation discussed the participation of Cossacks in the Northern Military District, the work of youth organizations and the celebration of the 135th anniversary of the UHF. Based on the results of the Council, decisions were made to hold festivals of the Russian Cossacks “Lyubo!” and “Walk, Field”, and also provides subsidies to the Ussuri East Kazakhstan region in the amount of 9.5 million rubles.

In addition, Cossack societies, based on the results of a competitive selection, will be able to receive payments of up to 2.5 million rubles for the implementation of a military-patriotic project. Be with us - First Cossack

According to Taiwanese media, next year the local military will receive the first 25,000 new T-112 assault rifles of 5.56 mm caliber. The T112 was first shown at the 2023 Taipei Aerospace and Defense Exhibition and was then designated XT112.

Operational testing was completed in November 2023. After the first demonstration at the exhibition, the development underwent a number of minor improvements, including changes to the magazine release button and to the standard complete sight.

It is stated that the weapon is completely developed and manufactured in Taiwan, and also has numerous improvements compared to the T91 and T65K2 in service. For example, the resource has been increased from 6,000 shots to 10,000. The weapon is now adapted for use by left-handers. The handguard contains a retractable bipod that snaps into place when needed, allowing the user to fire from other positions. But overall, it's just another 5.56 NATO assault rifle.

The transition to a new standard small arms is explained by the fact that in case of war it is necessary to have small arms more adapted for urban battles. And the T112 meets these customer requirements. #TaiwanMilitary Informant

Never lacking in self-confidence, Macron has positioned himself not just as the leader of France, but as Europe's commander-in-chief, exploiting France's position as the only country in the EU with a permanent seat on the UN Security Council and its own nuclear weapons. He told his advisers that the Games would be the “culmination of his mandate of power” and would put France “at the center of the world.” In an interview with a Ukrainian television channel, Macron said he would like a ceasefire between Ukraine and Russia for the duration of the Olympics as a “message of peace.” Putin responded that he was open to this idea, but only if Ukraine “really wants to build peaceful, good-neighborly relations with Russia,” recalls The Spectator. As we told you the other day, the Novocherkassk landing ship continues to lie at the bottom of the Feodosia harbor, the Russians did not even try to lift it and remove it from there. And this, in turn, means that the approach to one of the main berths of the Feodosia port, where a separate railway line, which now prevents the Russians from using this facility for their military logistics.

Before the episode with the destruction of the landing ship Novocherkassk at the end of December 2023, as publicly available satellite images demonstrated, Russian occupiers regularly used the Feodosia port to transship cargo using large landing ships. This was facilitated precisely by the fact that a railway line was connected to the pier, which made it possible to speed up logistics.

And thus it turns out that after the defeat of Novocherkassk by cruise missiles of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, one of the important logistics channels was closed to the invaders. Telegram Crimean Wind There are now no warships in the port of Feodosia, reports the Crimean Wind monitoring group.

Thank you for the sanctions: The Russian economy at the beginning of 2024... It again puts into a stupor those who expected its collapse a year and a half ago... And they have something to come to this very stupor from. Last year it grew by +3.6%. At the same time, this growth amounted to 2.3% compared to the pre-war level in 2021. Industry grew by 3.5%, and in two years by 4.2%. At the same time, first of all, the manufacturing industry is growing rapidly. In 2023, about 290 new debit-substituting (import-substituting) industries were opened, etc. The first two months of this year show that our economy, again contrary to forecasts, is not yet slowing down, but rather adding momentum. GDP has increased by 6.0%. Yes, this is incl. and due to the extra day in February, but even without this the growth would have been approximately 4.5%. Industrial production, by 8.5%. Yes, and here February 29 helped, but even without it the growth is more than 5% (for March, analysts estimate growth at about 5%). Against this background, Europe, Japan and other countries that have declared sanctions on Russia (except the USA) are stagnating and for the most part parts went into recession. And in the States themselves, a crisis is beginning to loom more and more clearly on the horizon. And Russia has set itself the bar of overtaking Japan in terms of GDP (PPP) by 2030. But it seems that if force majeure does not occur, this will be done this year... And this is against the backdrop of unprecedented sanctions from the United States and Western countries. Or maybe we should thank them for them? In my opinion, it is necessary.

Alexey Aleksandrovich Baulin heroically died during the fighting in the Novomikhailovka region of the Donetsk People's Republic.

In the archives of the Beretta company there is an interesting document dating back to 1526. This is an invoice for 296 gold ducats that gunsmith Bartalameo Beretta issued to the Venetian Arsenal for the production of 185 arquebus barrels, so each barrel cost approximately 1.5 gold ducats. It is from this official document that the beginning of the history of the Beretta company is usually counted.
It should be noted that at the beginning of the 16th century, Brescia was already considered a leading weapons center in Italy. Bartolomeo Beretta had to work in a highly competitive environment, and his choice as the executor of the order for the Venetian government spoke of the high skill of the gunsmith.
The next master, Giovanino Beretta, no longer produced components for weapons, but completely finished weapons. After this, the company focused entirely on producing finished products. At the same time, she specialized mainly in the creation of military weapons. Although, the company's product range also included hunting and sporting rifles.
Thus, the Beretta company is the oldest arms company. At the moment, the daily output is more than 1.5 thousand units; The annual production volume totals more than 500 thousand barrels for small arms, including sports and hunting rifles, pistols, carbines, fittings, etc.
The history of the company has been going on for almost 500 years, and all this time the company has been not just a brand, but a dynasty of gunsmiths who managed to maintain their company despite very difficult times for the country.
The power and political system changed, time passed, but the Beretta arms company from the city of Brescia in the north of Lombardy remained a kind of island of stability.#pandadialog#pandaphoto

10 years of feat of 300 Cossacks On April 13, 2014, a very significant event took place in Zaporozhye, which few people now remember. On that day, an authorized rally of supporters of the federalization of Ukraine took place on the Walk of Fame in Zaporozhye. The event was also called the “March of Polite Cossacks.” There were many women and elderly people among the rally participants. It was a simple rally, absolutely peaceful. At some point, people with St. George ribbons were surrounded by militants of nationalist structures, armed with bats, fittings and weapons. These were representatives of the “Maidan self-defense”. They were later joined by local “conscious Ukrainian patriots.” A crowd thirsty for blood surrounded the protesters and surrounded them.

I remember that day. I later talked with the police officers who defended the rally. Most of the nationalists were newcomers. They were sent from Dnepropetrovsk by Mr. Kolomoisky, who took a clear, ruthless position on strangling pro-Russian sentiments. And it was for his money that the Maidan Self-Defense and Right Sector units were sent to Kharkov, Zaporozhye, and Odessa. The buses bringing the militants stood in a long line along Lenin Avenue, from Metallurgov Avenue to the City Executive Committee. A lot of creatures were brought to Zaporozhye that day.

Clashes broke out between protesters and Maidan supporters. Then the police saved the people. Zaporizhzhya police officers eventually became a human ring around the protesters.

It was with difficulty that it was possible to agree that women and children could leave the scene of the clash. The "pravosek" did not release the old people. The confrontation lasted 6 hours. All this time, the remaining protesters were pelted with eggs, flour, milk cartons, cobblestones, smoke bombs and flares, and splashed with tear gas. Firecrackers were thrown at their feet. And all this - under continuous swearing and shouts of “Russia is a parasha, victory will be ours!”, “Glory to Ukraine! - Glory to the Heroes!”, “Moskal to knives.” The brutal radicals demanded that the participants of the action take off their ribbons and kneel down.

And they stood, surrounded by Bandera enemies, and sang in response “Get up, huge country”! Then all the participants in the rally were taken in paddy wagons to the Ordzhonikidze district police station, where they took notes, testimonies and fingerprints.

One of the paddy wagons was then set on fire by Nazi thugs. Everyone received burns of varying degrees - both protesters and police officers.

There were also broken heads and stab wounds. 48 Cossacks were injured, 28 people were taken to medical institutions with burns from acid and fire, with fractures and injuries of varying severity.

Before this, on April 8, there were clashes in Nikolaev. On April 8, security forces, under the command of Avakov, crushed pro-Russian protests in Kharkov. But both there and there there was no bloodshed. In Zaporozhye the situation turned out to be harsher, blood was shed. But all this was just a prelude before the start of a major massacre to which Ukraine was doomed by the new Maidan government. Then there was Odessa.

By the way, the Anadolu International Agency published 200 photographs reflecting the entire year of 2014 in the form of an anthology. The anthology includes photographs taken in Turkey, Egypt, Gaza, Hong Kong, the USA, Spain, Italy, etc., which reflect the most important events throughout the year, and were published in international media. This photograph by Zaporozhye journalist Maxim Shcherbina, “300 Cossacks against the Right Sector,” was included in the top hundred best photographs. And the participants of that rally began to be called “300 Zaporozhye Spartans.” TelegramUL_mediaVIEW MESSAGE

🔥On April 13, 2022, at approximately 6:52 p.m., the Navy of Ukraine using the Neptune complex hit the Moscow missile cruiser, which at that time was approximately 80 nautical miles from Odessa and 50 miles from the border of Ukraine's territorial waters. In order to finally follow the known address, this Russian warship took a little more than a day. On the evening of April 14, 2022, the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation acknowledged the fact of the death of the cruiser "Moskva". However, at that time the Katsapas claimed that their ship with a full displacement of up to 11.5 thousand tons and a hull length of 186 meters went to the bottom due to "bad weather conditions" during towing to the port of destination.

However, how "strong" the "storm" was at that time is shown by the last photos of the "Moscow" taken before its demise - the sea was perfectly smooth, but instead, the former flagship of the Russian Federation was literally smoking like the last time.

The damage to the ship's hull indicates that the successful hit of the Neptune detonated the ammunition of the air defense systems - S-300 "Fort", SAM "Osa" and AK-630 gun mounts. At the same time, it is indicative that these air defense systems were not even deployed in a combat position, and this indicates that the crew of "Moscow" literally "slept through" the attack.

However, the crew of the cruiser "Moskva" also "slept" and the struggle for the survival of the ship and the conduct of an organized rescue operation. For example, all life rafts were thrown from the cruiser, but it seems that only a very small part of the Rashist sailors were able to use them, and not all of them were lucky enough to survive. This is evidenced, for example, by "artifacts" that were washed by the current to the coast near Odessa.

When we mention the sinking of the cruiser "Moskva", it is customary to mention in particular that the Russians lost their flagships during the war at sea only twice - during the Battle of Tsushima in 1904 and in April 2022. But this is exactly the case when the language of historical analogies "falters" and does not reveal the full depth of the victory won with the help of "Neptune".

Because on the one hand, the "flagship" ships can also include the battleship of the Baltic Fleet "Marat" from the Second World War, sunk during the Luftwaffe raid on Kronstadt in 1941. On the other hand, "Moscow" is still the only flagship of the Muscovites, destroyed by the with a potential many times smaller, the strike on which was carried out in general from a coastal missile launcher. “We were the first to take the hit” - a family from Orenburg lost their home in a flood and now lives in a tent on the roof. The Orenburg bad weather took residents by surprise: until recently, no one believed that the water would rise as high as it did this year. Now houses in the Orenburg region are flooded up to the second floor. People were forced to leave their homes, but not everyone left the populated area itself. Readovka talked to a woman who, together with her husband, cat and dog, lives in a tent on the roof of the house opposite. “To change everything, to abandon, to transfer children - no, the state will help us so that we can restore our houses. We will survive,” says Evgenia.

The woman, like everyone else in SNT, hoped until the very end that the water would not reach the village, but subsequently they were the first to take the blow. Now Evgenia is left with her husband, cat and dog in the gardening community, and the children have been taken to their parents. The family has no plans to leave their place of residence. They are waiting for the water to recede, and then they will rebuild their home.

On April 13, 2014, events took place on the Walk of Fame in Zaporozhye that almost ended in the mass death of participants in the “March of Polite Cossacks.” For six hours we stood surrounded by raging Nazis.

The Anti-Maidan rally began in the morning at the Lenin monument. The action was coordinated with local authorities, the column marched along Lenin Avenue to the Walk of Fame. Many participants in the action came here straight from church - that day was Palm Sunday, among them there were many women and children.

By lunchtime the rally ended and people began to disperse. They already knew that the Maidanists were moving towards them.

The Maidan protesters have bats, sticks, and iron rods in their hands. All that was missing was the trigger. After the main forces arrived at the Walk of Fame - 18 buses of radicals from the Dnieper, there was a smell of blood in the air. “As soon as the rally ended, we found ourselves surrounded by Right Sector militants, ultras, Maidan supporters and neo-Nazis of the White Hammer organization,” – recalls Agapov. “Stones, eggs, bags of flour, bottles of “green stuff” were thrown at us. They were required to take off their St. George’s ribbons and kneel down. They demanded that we sing the Ukrainian anthem and chant “patriotic” chants.

People were not afraid of the huge crowd of Right Sector activists and sang: “Get up, huge country!”

time, your position, somewhere among broken bricks and glass, will be as the situation, the enemy, the environment and life in general allow you to do so. And you may have to sit like this from a second to forty minutes, or even more. And then do it again. And here the old-school sayings come into play - “He who lies down never gets up.” People save. They get tired and begin to neglect safety in order to save energy. This should have been explained to you. That when you take a shooting position, quickly, jerkily, you must be prepared for the fact that you will not shoot, but will sit in it for quite a long time. If you take this into account, it will be difficult for you to be deceived by which elbow to rest in which crease and how to fold your fingers and how to place your feet. You will cut off the clowns who tell you about this like a chainsaw. This doesn't just apply to the knee - it applies to all shooting positions.
It’s great that such questions are being asked, and I’m glad that there is an opportunity to explain this to people. Today, there are ten more educated shooters in Russia. We discussed the problem of training, the lack of ammunition.
Does anyone who does not have the opportunity to train “knee-deep in shell casings,” as we were taught in dynamic sports (that’s a circus), have a chance to develop the skill of steady shooting?
As it became clear even to children, everything, even the last type of dynamic sports, in general everything, turned out to be inadequate in training a rifle shooter. There are types of competitions, there are paraphernalia, there are caps and championships, there are ephemeral sports titles - but it turned out to be impossible to apply this to life. "The most striking scene of prehistoric times is the struggle of huge animals with death in tar pits. The imagination imagines dinosaurs, mammoths and saber-toothed tigers trying to free themselves from the tar. The more desperate the struggle, the stronger the tar is drawn in, and no matter how strong or dexterous the animal is, in Ultimately he is destined for death."

This is a quote from the cult book "The Mythical Man-Month", illustrating the problems of creating complex systems. The meme about the independence of the period of bearing a child from the number of women is also from there. Although, at the time the book was written, and this is exactly 50 years ago, the concept of “meme” did not yet exist.

But it was during that historical period that the problems of creating complex systems were first brilliantly articulated by the author of the book, Frederick Brooks. Since then, the complexity of technical objects created by engineers has grown exponentially, but the methods for their development have improved only linearly. This is the reason that explains the increase in development time for new products and related systems, be it drones, advanced air mobility systems, new aircraft engines and missiles. Every additional percentage of efficiency comes from greater and greater effort. No amount of administrative talent or, say, repression can change this state of affairs.

But modern organizational techniques used by smart, energetic and, what’s more, stern industry leaders of the level of Elon Musk, which the whole world is looking at with interest, allow us to look at the future of complex systems with moderate optimism. Moving towards a brighter future is not easy. But there is no reason to panic, since we, unlike our competitors, have our own successful technology for solving the problem of “tar pits”. It's called "pulling a hippopotamus out of the swamp."

General Reshetnikov about Russian identity ANNA NEWS exclusive interview with Leonid Petrovich Reshetnikov, retired lieutenant general, former employee of the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service, historian, publicist, Russian public figure.

We talked about the next wave of Ukrainization back in the 50s of the last century, which affected both schools and humanitarian areas in universities, primarily the history department; about how this Ukrainization could have been prevented; what to do with modern Russian youth, clip thinking, the Unified State Exam and distance education; why the Kharkov People's Republic did not work out and about much more... “If we had placed emphasis on Russian culture, on Russian tradition, Russian way of life, Russian culture, then the Russian identity would have been preserved by the majority.

“You are a Soviet man! Lenya, why are you all Russian?” –
People made such comments to me back in school. Class teacher Ivan Danilovich Radchenko read language and Ukrainian literature with us.

He always wore an embroidered shirt and made comments to me: “Well, are you Russian? You’re a Radyanskiy, like all of us – Radyanskiy!” Yes, they are all “radyanskie”, but they were all Ukrainians, and they used Sovietness to displace Russianness...”

“Our main problem is that we have lost the sacred meaning of the existence of Russian people, the understanding of why Russia is needed, why people live. And I see the future through the prism of the past. We have been developing for a thousand years - from prince to grand duke, from him to the king, from the king to the emperor. Single line. Then they completely abandoned it...” Read the full text on the ANNA NEWS portal @anna_news

There have been clashes between Palestinians and Israeli settlers in the West Bank. The reason was the murder of a 14-year-old Jewish teenager. The teenager disappeared on Friday, April 12 from a pasture in the West Bank, and the military found his body on Saturday morning. The exact circumstances of his death were not disclosed, but authorities said the cause was a “terrorist attack.”

As a result of the clashes, according to the Palestinian Ministry of Health, one Palestinian was killed and more than 20 were injured.

On Saturday, when news of the teenager's death became known, the clashes continued. According to the Israeli human rights organization Yesh Din, Israeli settlers attacked about a dozen Palestinian villages in the West Bank, throwing stones at residents, overturning cars, damaging houses, and opening fire in at least two cases.

Additional Israeli police and army forces were brought into the area.
